title: Senior Sexual Health Nurse (pt)
description:
Working Pattern: 30 hours worked over 5 days per week, including up to two evenings per week, and rotational Saturday.

West Lancashire Sexual Health Services provides Genitourinary Medicine (GUM) and Contraceptive services through established clinics in Ormskirk and Skelmersdale. The clinics currently operate between: 0900- 2100 hours.

This integrated service is looking to permanently appoint a suitably qualified dual trained nurse whose skill set includes, initiating and subsequently supplying hormonal contraceptive methods; including insertion and removal of subdermal implants, perform genitourinary examinations incorporating appropriate testing, diagnosis, and treatment for sexually transmitted infections, and deliver appropriate sexual health advice and promotion. Previous experience working with patients diagnosed positive with Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) would be an advantage.

Assess and examine patients, taking a sexual history, formulating diagnoses
and initiating treatments using patient group directions.

Perform venepuncture daily

Administer vaccinations and immunisations

Maintain patient dignity and confidentiality, acting as the patients advocate

Provide comprehensive sexual health information and advice

Assess patients under the age of 16 using Fraser Guidelines

Maintain the safe custody of drugs

Ensure that accurate and contemporaneous records are maintained

Observe and adhere to all Trust Policies and Procedures

Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust is ideally situated just a forty five minute drive from Manchester. The Trust provides services to the 440,000 residents of Blackpool, Fylde & Wyre and North Lancashire, as well as specialist tertiary care for Cardiac and Haematology patients.

As one of the United Kingdom’s largest coastal resort, Blackpool has plenty to offer its residents – it’s not just a good place to work; it’s a great place to live. In addition to its bustling centre and historic seafront, the town is world famous for its many attractions, including the famous Blackpool Tower. Blackpool also offers a number of scenic cycling routes round our local parks and across the surrounding countryside, as well as boasting panoramic views of the coast on its picturesque Promenade. Further afield, Blackpool also benefits from less than three-hour connections via rail to Edinburgh in the north and London in the south.
company: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Dispensing Optician - Runcorn
description:
Location: Runcorn
Salary: Competitive basic depending on your experience.
Working Hours: Full-Time or Part-Time
Experience Level: Must have previous experience working in an optician and must have a GOC number.

Your future is clear at Specsavers Runcorn, where there’s always something exciting ahead.

Come and join our accomplished team as a Dispensing Optician at Specsavers Runcorn, where we are at the height of customer care. Join us and help work to ensure every single one of our customers receives the very best patient experience. We’re community-focused and we need someone ready to use their passion, skills and experience to build on our ever-growing and loyal customer base.

Our Dispensing Opticians are the face of our clinic on the shop floor and usually an integral part of our store management team, so we’re keen to get you up to speed with management responsibilities. With ILM courses, pre-reg supervision and Specsavers Partnership Pathway available, we can guide you on your way to becoming a great leader. This – along with your clinical expertise – will stand you in good stead if you choose to become a store director yourself one day.


We’re dedicated to our customers, but what really makes this role stand out is that we offer a workplace with a difference - where people grow both personally and professionally.


What’s on offer?

  • Outstanding annual salary based on experience – we can talk more about this at interview
  • A highly-rewarding performance-based bonus scheme
  • Pension contribution
  • Support with CET
  • Exceptional clinical and professional development opportunities
  • Access to cutting-edge clinical technology, such as OCT


The Role in a Nutshell:

  • Ensure that you provide good levels of customer service to customers at all times.
  • Liaise with Optometrists to ensure that each customer you dispense receives a consistent quality handover.
  • Manage aftersales service (including complaints and problem solving) in a customer service focused ‘can do’ manner.
  • Contribute to achievement of individual and team sales targets by demonstrating effective professional sales techniques.


Then there’s you

Alongside being a qualified and GOC registered Dispensing Optician, we are searching for someone who shares our store’s ethos. Someone who wants to grow, develop and offer exceptional customer care along the way. We want a practitioner who prides themselves on their clinical judgment, that isn’t afraid of a hands-on approach and who is keen to get involved and build rapport with the rest of the team. In summary, we’re looking for a skilled Dispensing Optician to join us, be part of the team and assist in driving our practice forward.


Get in touch

If this opportunity sounds interesting, we’d love to hear from you. Contact Meg Francis on 01566 771899 or megan.francis@specsavers.com

title: Senior Rehabilitation Therapist B6
description:
Additional funding has been created for a full time, or part time, Band 6 Occupational Therapist or Physiotherapist, providing rehabilitation and intervention across the Fylde locality.

You will be working within the Fylde Enhanced Primary Care Team who support the patients to be the person they are- working on their illness and wellness-enabling them to lead a more fulfilling life.

We are looking for an enthusiastic and experienced professional with a clinical interest in the area of community rehabilitation for adults aged 18 and above. The post holder will provide a specialised assessment, treatment, intervention and discharge planning of patients referred to the service experiencing a number of conditions which include a variety of complex conditions including chronic, disabling and life limiting illnesses- orthopaedic, neurological and general longer term conditions and frailty.

The prescription of essential equipment and exercise is part of the therapeutic intervention. Specifically assessing issues related to the barriers which prevent the individual carrying out activities of daily living eg mobility, moving and handling, functional restrictions, activity tolerance, hand eye coordination, positioning, cognitive impairment, social and psychological issues and environmental restrictions.

This is an exciting opportunity to be involved in a fully integrated and forward thinking team of therapists, technical instructors, Community Matrons, Integrated Care Coordinators, Health and Wellbeing Support Workers, Neighbourhood Assistants and admin staff, working within patient’s homes and also care homes. You will be at the forefront of changes, helping to shape the service for the residents that we serve. There will also be opportunity to maintain and develop links with other service providers.

Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust is ideally situated just a forty five minute drive from Manchester. The Trust provides services to the 440,000 residents of Blackpool, Fylde & Wyre and North Lancashire, as well as specialist tertiary care for Cardiac and Haematology patients.

As one of the United Kingdom’s largest coastal resort, Blackpool has plenty to offer its residents – it’s not just a good place to work; it’s a great place to live. In addition to its bustling centre and historic seafront, the town is world famous for its many attractions, including the famous Blackpool Tower. Chester, CH1 1QX

Competitive rate + Perkbox + Bonus + Commission +33 days annual leave + Staff discounts

A bit about us - and why we need you!

Treating over 25,000 clients each month through a nationwide network of over 75 clinics, sk:n is the UK’s leading provider of advanced skin treatments. We have a truly recognisable brand which has been carefully built over 28 years on the foundations of efficacy, knowledge and trust. Simply put, our aim is to give people greater self-confidence through better skin. Whether we’re getting rid of unwanted facial hair, treating acne, removing blemishes or reducing the signs of ageing, we change lives every day and it’s something we’re extremely passionate about. We are expanding our clinic network throughout the UK which means it’s a hugely exciting time to become part of our team!


The Opportunity

We are now recruiting for a part-time Aesthetic Practitioner to join the team at our Chester clinic. You will be responsible for meeting and greeting clients, advising them on suitable treatments and products and carrying out a range of advanced treatments. Other duties will include reception, retailing products, diary management and general administration.

What’s in it for you?

You will receive a competitive hourly salary, industry leading bonuses, 33 days holiday, free or reduced treatments and products, in addition to full training in the life changing treatments that we offer. There are also genuine opportunities for career progression, we have a structured career path for Practitioners and there is also the opportunity to apply for our internal Clinic Manager training programme.

Finally, it’s an opportunity to join the UK’s market leader within the rapidly expanding Aesthetic and Cosmetic industry. You too could be changing lives by helping people to achieve greater self-confidence through better skin!

If this sounds like the career path you have been looking for, we look forward to hearing from you!


JOB REQUIREMENTS

Experience, Qualifications and Personal Qualities.

  • Qualified to Level 3 in Beauty Therapy (or equivalent), Level 4 is highly desirable.
  • A minimum of 2 years experience within either an Aesthetics, Day Spa, Beauty Counter or Salon environment.
  • Team player, with a positive can do attitude.
  • You'll be passionate about giving great customer service, every time, no matter what.
  • Experience of working to sales targets and be happy to get involved with promotional activity
  • You should be willing and able to work a minimum of alternate weekends (Saturday and Sunday) and two to three late shifts per week.

title: Nursery Chef
description:
Busy Bees in Busy Bees Childcare, Daisy & Jake in Little Sutton are looking for a Nursery Chef to join our Team working Part Time- 9am-1pm Mon-Fri,

Working Monday to Friday only with no evenings or weekends!


The top 5 Reasons to join us!

  • Childcare provision with substantial childcare discounts
  • Excellent in-house training, opportunity to gain further qualifications, Virtual learning andcareer progression opportunities
  • Exclusive access to UP*; Busy Bees unique early years learning programme
  • Retail Discounts Scheme via an online benefits portal
  • Global exchange programme (short term secondment to another country)
  • Visit our website to find out more

Our Nursery

Recently having been acquired by Busy Bees Childcare, Daisy & Jake in Little Sutton offers welcoming and stimulating environments both indoors and out with a dedicated staff team nurturing each individual child’s interest to give children the best start in life.

Our Company

Established by 3 families in 1984 Busy Bees is now the UK’s largest childcare company with over 350 nurseries across the UK.

Our Vision

To give every child the best start in life

Our Mission

Deliver high quality childcare & Exciting opportunities for learning that gives every child a head start as they prepare for school

Your Mission

As Nursery Chef you will be responsible for the overall food preparation, cooking and serving of food to children at various times throughout the day, this should be done using the highest levels of hygiene and cleanliness.

Care: We take care very seriously

  • Follow safe working practices for children and staff to comply with Busy Bees food hygiene and safety policies.
  • Play a role in the education of our children’s development by promoting good hygiene standards and spending time within the rooms teaching them basic cooking skills and promoting healthy eating.
  • Speak Up against practices that don’t support safeguarding or our Core Values.

Service: We are an integral part of a parent’s support network

  • Provide high quality, nutritious, freshy prepared meals and snacks in appropriate portion sizes and consistencies in line with food hygiene and safety regulations and Busy Bees policies.
  • Liaise with suppliers to ensure good levels of service are provided.
  • Accept deliveries and store away appropriately following correct manual handling techniques and effective stock rotation.

Quality: We set and maintain the highest standards it’s what children and parents deserve

  • Liaise with regulatory bodies during their inspection visits, ensuring action points and recommendations are addressed in a timely manner.
  • Comply with the company’s procedures relating to the Control of Substances Hazardous to Health (COSHH). Through understanding the principals of storing and using cleaning materials safely and taking precautions to protect yourself and others and ensure that records are up to date and available.

Value: We ensure that we provide outstanding value for money

  • Ordering food supplies to meet the menu requirements within budget.
  • Report any damages, repairs to the nursery management team so it can be logged with estates, take action to control any risk and make reference to this in your daily food safety book.

Your Qualifications and Experience:

  • At least 1 years previous experience working within a catering environment with an excellent understanding of food hygiene standards and allergens.
  • A good understanding of food standards requirements for the management of medical conditions, in particular allergies associate with food.
  • Food Hygiene Level 2 qualification (Essential)
  • Recognised catering qualification (Desirable)
All positions are subject to an enhanced DBS Check

title: Support Worker (Kick Start Scheme) - Queensferry, Flint, Bretton & Greenfield
description:
Job Reference: 002571
For more information on the role,
please contact Flintshire office
Email: hftflintshire@hft.org.uk
Telephone: 01244 831290

*Hft Flintshire is now welcoming applications from candidates who have been referred by their DWP work coach for a work placement opportunity via the Kickstart scheme*

Pay rates:

  • £8.20 – Age 21-24 years
  • £6.45 – Age 18-20
  • £4.55 – Under 18

The vacancies are for 25 hours per week, Monday – Friday between the hours of 8.30am and 4.15pm. We have 6 vacancies for Kickstart support workers across 4 of our day opportunity services.

Find your place with us and help change lives.

We are one of the largest learning disability charities in the UK, supporting over 2,500 people through our friendly, supportive, creative and diverse teams.

About the role
Hft Flintshire are seeking Support Workers through the Kickstart Scheme to join us and support adults with learning disabilities to live the best life possible. We recognise that the current pandemic means we have had to adapt to change and in many ways we are now doing things differently but what hasn’t changed is our passion for standards and doing all we can to look after the people we support both in these current challenging times and in the future.

To keep the people we support and yourself safe and in line with government advice, opportunities to go out and about are limited, instead our Support Workers are finding fun and creative ways to keep people occupied at home, promoting health and wellbeing. In this caring and creative role, everything you do will enable people to have choices about their own lives, providing flexible services that meet people’s needs, and always looking for the best way of doing things.

The purpose of your role is to give the highest possible standards of support to individuals with moderate to severe learning disabilities, in all aspects of their daily lives. You’ll be helping to ensure the people we support:

  • Build confidence to develop interests
  • Feel secure and safe
  • Are provided with any personal care needed with dignity
  • Increase their independence
  • Are enabled to make as many choices as possible
  • Achieve personal goals, which may include travel or holidays

About you
You don’t need experience of support work or any special qualifications for this job - you’ll get plenty of training along the way. Having the right values, a positive attitude to life and a desire to support people to live their life with as much independence, choice, dignity and control as possible is what matters most. You will need to have good listening skills and a practical, caring approach. You also need to have basic level IT skills to be able to use a computer as you will regularly need to record information about people you will be supporting.

We are currently restricting face-to-face training; therefore most of your training courses, including some aspects of your induction, will be online. But you will still be able learn from your colleagues in a supportive hands-on environment.

What we offer
We offer a range of benefits and career development opportunities. We’ll give you a comprehensive induction, full training, and support along the way. With Investors in People and Skills for Care accreditation we are committed to investing in you to ensure you have the specialist skills and expertise needed to support people to live the best life possible.

Benefits

  • Complete the All Wales Induction Framework
  • Access to the Hft Plus benefits package, which includes a great number of discounts and rewards across shops, restaurants, gym membership and days out; but also an Employee Assistance Programme, with telephone and face-to-face support options
  • Access to award winning training and development – Hft is one of only four charities to have achieved the Skills for Care ‘Centre of Excellence’ provider status
  • Annual staff award scheme – The Fusion Awards, and peer recognition through our GEM awards programme
  • 23 days holiday plus 8 bank holidays (pro rata for part time staff)
  • A contributory pension scheme & life assurance
  • Free DBS Check
  • As a “key worker” you will benefit from government incentive schemes

Join us and help change lives.

PLEASE NOTE - The Kickstart Scheme provides job placements for 16 to 24 year olds on Universal Credit who are at risk of long term unemployment.

STRICTLY NO AGENCIES PLEASE
Hft's usual terms and conditions apply.
Hft is committed to equal opportunities and welcomes applications from all sections of the community. As a Disability Confident Employer, Hft is helping to ensure that disabled people have the same opportunities to fulfil their potential and realise their aspirations that people without disabilities do.
Successful applicants will need to undertake an enhanced disclosure check against the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS). Having a criminal record may not bar you from employment.

title: Senior Occupational Therapist - Medical Surgical Team
description:
Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust Band 7 Occupational Therapist

Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust has teams of experienced and highly
skilled Therapists working in a wide range of acute specialty areas. They are an integral part
of the MDT, providing for the acute therapy needs of patients and supporting their safe
early transition out of the acute Trust.

An exciting and challenging opportunity has arisen for an experienced Occupational
Therapist to join the Acute Intervention Team based at the Royal Liverpool Hospital. The
team provides a quality Occupational Therapy service to the Medical Division. The different
specialities within the service include Gerontology, Cardiology, Respiratory Medicine,
Infectious Diseases, Gastroenterology, Endocrinology, Clinical Pharmacology, Nephrology,
Diabetic Medicine and Palliative Care. You will work alongside two Band 7 Occupational
Therapists who lead the Cardio-Respiratory and Palliative care sub teams. You will be
responsible for your own sub team and will lead on Acute Gerontology and part of General
Internal Medicine. In these settings, therapists have a key role in high level clinical
reasoning, risk identification and problem solving to enable patients to maintain their
independence, to avoid admission and to support patient discharge at the earliest safe
opportunity.

We wish to recruit a highly skilled senior clinician who has a clear understanding of the
developing role of the therapist in the acute setting, and the ability to lead a team which
delivers innovative, responsive services to meet both the needs of patients and the
organisation. The role requires excellent communication skills and the ability to work as an
effective member of the wider team as well as with other external agencies. The post holder
will have significant experience working with adults with complex presentations, in
particular older people with multiple co-morbidities.

We are committed to staff development and training. You will have peer support from two
Band 7 Occupational Therapists who you will work alongside, support from the Therapy
management Team and the opportunity to attend courses and training including leadership
development. You will be responsible for the supervision and support of your team, and
development of all staff.

Staff are required to work flexibly, to support 7 day services and shift patterns over an
extended working day.

Part time and job shares may be considered.

For further information please contact:
Vikki Engel, B7 Team Leader, Vikki.Engel@LiverpoolFT.nhs.uk
Lisa Christian, B7 Team Leader, Lisa.Christian@LiverpoolFT.nhs.uk
Joanne Vickerstaff, Deputy Therapies Manager, Tel: 0151 706 2701, Email:
Joanne.Vickerstaff@LiverpoolFT.nhs.uk

title: Asset Engineer - Civil & Geotechnical
description:
Job Purpose:
We are the charity who look after and bring to life 2,000 miles of waterways across England and Wales, because we believe that life is better by water. Every role across the Trust plays it's part in transforming our canals and rivers into spaces where local people want to spend time and feel better, bringing wellbeing benefits to millions.

Our Engineers play a key role in supporting our vision and in delivering our Waterways and Wellbeing strategy across the country. We are open and committed to develop, train and support people in their personal and professional development, at all stages of their careers.


We currently have Permanent and Temporary (9 month FT) opportunities for Asset Engineers covering the North West Region.


The role of the Engineers in the asset management team is to maintain, the Trust’s infrastructure through their entire life cycle to enable visitors to safely enjoy our canals and rivers and safeguard them for future generations. Our asset engineers do this by inspecting and assessing the condition of our built assets, prioritising repair and renewal works specifying works that are required, and support of the operations team on minor repairs and reactive repairs.

Working as part of a team of Engineers and Inspectors, our Engineers (Eng Serv) provide an important role across the Trust supporting works delivery and the implementation of the asset strategy. See more about our specialist teams here.


Location & coverage -


Formally based in either Burnley or Ellesmere Port, our teams continue to work in part from home. We expect this working arrangement to continue, it is therefore essential that applicants are able and willing to work effectively from home.


This role will involve regular travel to and along the Canals and River navigations of Greater Manchester and Cheshire. Occasionally you may also be required to work in other areas of the North West Region.
Knowledge, Skills/Qualifications & Experience :
About the role

We're very proud to be the custodians of one of the largest collection of industrial heritage, covering 2,000 miles of the UK's canals and rivers and over 8,500 different structures, many of them listed. The majority of our canals and navigable rivers are over 200 years old, and they still work as they were designed to. This is quite remarkable and reflects the innovation and skill of the original engineers and the continuing dedication and expertise of our team today.

As Asset Engineer you will work with colleagues across departments, and with a variety of partners internally and externally, to deliver works programmes and supports the implementation of the asset strategy for the Trust. You will support decisions on asset investment priorities which are driven by a risk management approach.
Accountabilities:
  • Investigate and develop cost effective design and construction solutions ensuring best value, taking into account user requirements and whole life costs where appropriate.
  • Responsible for undertaking scheduled asset inspections, ensuring that they are completed to plan, approved and recorded in the prescribed format, to the prescribed quality.
  • Contribute technical advice during the feasibility, design, construction and commissioning phases for projects to our direct labour force (Direct Services), framework contractors and volunteers.
  • Define the maintenance, repair and renewal works for delivery by the Trust ‘s teams and contractors, taking account of all statutory, technical, operational and customer requirements.
  • Design and specify engineering solutions and, where required, act as Principal Designer or Designer for works, (in accordance with CDM2015).
  • Support the definition of the maintenance, repair and renewal works for delivery by internal teams and contractors, taking account of, all statutory, technical, operational and customer requirements.
  • Contribute to the development and the implementation of the Trust ‘s Design Guidance, Standards and Specifications.
  • Support internal and external enquiries associated with the assets. Respond as appropriate by reference to relevant information sources..
  • Where required, provide suitable temporary works designs to support works by Direct Services.
  • Build relationships with local representatives of partnerships, regulators, and stakeholders to protect, maintain, and continually improve levels of service and improve data held by the Trust.
  • Where appropriate actively participate in the Trust‘s “Stand-by” and” Call-out rotas”.
About you

As you will work in a multi-disciplinary environment & teams as part of your day to day work, it is important that you really enjoy being part of a team and that you have a collaborative approach to your work. You will, of course, work alone under your own initiative too, however engaging with others across all levels of the organisation and with a variety of external partners is how you will get the job done.

Essential
  • Professional qualification in a relevant technical discipline, i.e. Degree or HND in Civil Engineering.
  • GCSE (or equivalent) in English and Maths.
  • Knowledge and understanding of historic infrastructure, preferably in a water environment.
  • Experience in assessing infrastructure risk.
  • Experience in cross-functional working delivering performance across range of functions.
  • Able to negotiate with internal and external contacts.
  • Able to support other areas of the business in an appropriate manner, taking account of overall business priorities and negotiating resources as appropriate.
  • Able to provide a good standard of written communication and proven ability to present technical data to non-technical audiences.
  • Evidence of Continuous Professional Development.
  • Proficient in the use of a personal computer and business applications software e.g. MS Office.
  • Experience of GIS or mapping systems.
  • Valid driving licence appropriate for vehicle to be driven.
  • Confirmation of right to work in the UK.
Desirable
  • Incorporated Engineer (AMICE) (or working towards Incorporated or Charted status, the Trust Operate an ICE accredit training agreement) or equivalent professional qualification (ICE)
  • Membership of relevant professional body at an appropriate level ICE, CIWEM.
  • Proven experience of inspecting / delivering engineering activities.
  • Proven experience in assessing infrastructure risk.

We are currently conducting our interview processes virtually as we continue to respect and follow necessary social distancing guidance to protect our team and our candidates. You may be invited to a face to face further stage interview which will always be conducted following strict social distancing guidelines.


To Apply: click on the "Apply for this job" button and follow the process - complete the application form & upload current CV

If you have any questions about the role please contact CRT.recruitment@canalrivertrust.org.uk
What We Offer:
In addition to your annual base salary of £30,000 to £34,000, we offer Car Cash Allowance of £390 per month, great holiday entitlement, access to generous DC pension scheme and other benefits. Further details of which can be found here.

At the Trust we care passionately for our waterways, and as importantly, for those who look after and use them. We strongly believe that a diverse workforce brings with it a diversity of ideas, thinking and ways of working which enhances what we do as a Trust.

All candidates will be treated on the basis of their merits, skills and abilities and solely by being assessed against the requirements for the job. Many of our vacancies can be considered for people who wish to work flexibly, job share or part time.

title: Customer Support Assistant
description:
Due to a surge in the the UK staycation industry, Sykes Cottages are seeking a Customer Support Assistant to join our fast-paced, dedicated Operations team at our Chester HQ!

Sykes Holiday Cottages is one of the UK’s largest independent holiday letting agency; a successful travel business with strong year-over-year growth and ambitious plans for 2021 and beyond. Offering more than 17,000 holiday homes across the UK, Ireland and New Zealand, we are immensely proud to say we took over 1 million customers on holiday last year alone and show no signs of slowing down on our next ambitious goals.

Our latest Customer Support Assistant will be joining our wider Operations department which stands as one of our longest established departments in our 27-year business. Split across our Reservations, Customer Support, Web, Owner Performance and Customer and Owner Relations teams, we embody our Sykes ethos in every aspect of the customer journey from initial bookings to cancellations and through to customer and owner enquiries. We are immensely proud of each and every one of our team members, who are all true experts in their area – using their outstanding knowledge to build long standing, trusting rapports with our customer and owners to exceed their monthly business targets and maintain our reputation of gold standard customer service. Our Operations team year-on-year act as the driving force in our ongoing success and are one of our most continuously successful areas of our entire business.

As our newest addition, you will be responsible for answering queries and aiding in driving appropriate questions online. The role requires a proactive approach to dealing with customers whilst having an in-depth knowledge of Sykes processes and supporting customers and owners through the online process. You will be responsible for ensuring that every customer contact maximises income per booking, that the quality of the contact exceeds customer expectations and that all company procedures are adhered to.

This is a full-time, permanent role within an expanding team dedicated to providing high-quality, industry-leading solutions to facilitate the growth ambitions of the business. Part time hours are also available.

Reporting directly into our Customer Support Team Manager you will be responsible for the following areas:

  • To deliver outstanding customer service on every call and going the extra mile for our customers
  • To resolve customer/owner issues in a timely manner and in line with the overall Company Guidelines
  • Feeding back to Reservations/Customer Service/Ops Team Manager’s on opportunities to enhance the customer experience
  • Feeding back to Reservations/Customer Service/Ops Team Manager’s on opportunities to improve Sykes processes
  • To adhere to all Customer Support Team and Company procedures
  • Effective communication with customers, both internal and external

As our newest Customer Support Assistant, you will have the following key skills:

Essential to have:

  • Previous experience in a similar Customer Service or Customer Support position
  • Proven Customer Service experience within a call center environment
  • Telephony experience dealing with customers queries
  • Skills in negotiating
  • Excellent communication skills

Nice to Have:

  • IT literate
  • Empathetic approach
  • Quick thinker
  • Excellent written and verbal skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Patient and diligent approach
  • Commercial acumen

Hours of work will be 37.5 per week to be worked on a shift-rota basis covering evenings and two weekends a month. Department opening hours are 9am - 7pm however during peak times these will be extended to 9pm.

Please note: Whilst our offices remain closed for the time being due to the latest lockdown restrictions, this position will be based at our Chester Head Office when normality resumed. We will not be offering remote working with this vacancy.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From £17,004.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Additional leave
  • Bike to work scheme
  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Employee discount

  • Private medical insurance

Work remotely:

title: Proposals Manager
description:
About the Project

Costain’s team is Part of the Larger Water Sector Team and provides specialist technical concept, design and programme management and on behalf of United Utilities, working collaboratively to influence, shape and deliver solutions that tackle some of our clients’ complex engineering problems.



As Proposals Manager your focus will be on leading and co-ordinating the range of Non-Core Tenders & Core Proposals (‘Opportunities’) as required to comply with Client mandated process and internal business governance rules (as amended from time to time), from enquiry receipt to contract award.



You will support the business by planning and managing the bid process and delivering tender responses in line with Costain’s brand and governance processes. You will work closely with sector and capability leads to translate winning strategies into smart, concise and compelling documents and presentations, ensuring bids go out on time, that all questions are answered and ultimately, place Costain in the best possible position for success.

Key responsibilities

The Proposals Manager will be the dedicated focal point for all opportunities, drawing on input from the MSP Project Delivery & Commercial teams, Supply Chain, Water Sector Proposals team and wider Costain business.Key elements of the role will be the formulation and co-ordination of the tender proposal team across each project opportunity, ensuring clear requirements and responsibilities are established, ensuring the necessary governance requirements are met, risks identified and communicated and delivering a robust compliant proposal to the client in line with agreed timescales.



Strategy

The Proposals Manager will provide the lead in the development of the winning tender solution, both Technically and Commercially with the wider Costain business to:

  • Review the Clients EWI and supporting information
  • Engagement with the Supply Chain, Water Sector Proposals team and wider Costain business to establish clear Win Strategy
  • Obtain approval from the management team for the Win Strategy
  • Communicate the Strategy with the Team and ensure compliance

Tender Co-ordination

The Proposals Manager will provide a central framework and Client account function to receive all Works order Enquires [MH1] and Invitation(s) to Tender (ITT) and lead the following:

  • Establish the initial tender strategy, liaising with both the MSP Operations Manager and opportunity Commercial representative
  • Engagement with the Supply Chain, Water Sector Proposals team and wider Costain business to establish clear requirements and responsibilities
  • Formulation of the overall proposal team
  • Lead a proposal Kick-off session involving all required parties
  • Develop the tender Programme, monitoring progress and ensuring milestones are met
  • Ensure clear and timely communication is maintained with the Client representatives through collaborative working and also formally via the Client procurement portal
  • Prepare relevant governance documentation in conjunction with the Sector Proposals Team Manager [AFB2] [MH3] and wider Costain business
  • Coordinate close-out of all governance actions on behalf of accountable parties
  • Population of Group / Sector Work winning information (Dynamics) associated with the MSP Framework and UU Customer Account


Commercial, Estimating & Tender Management

  • Coordinate efforts with the Sector Proposals Team Manager and wider Costain business in ensuring the development of associated indirect estimates, including welfare requirements & scope, staffing organogram & Bottom-Up Estimate (BUE), Testing & Commissioning BUE, Design BUE
  • Coordinate with the Estimating Team at each stage of the proposal phase to produce opportunity proposals in line with Customer mandated process and internal business governance rules (as amended from time to time)
  • Ensuring technical and commercial queries, both up and down the opportunity supply chain, are resolved to inform estimating and ensuring robust schedule of Technical and Contractual Clarifications are in place at time of Tender response to the Customer
  • Facilitate flow of information between Client / design team / estimators / supply-chain / Delivery Team / Sector Proposals Team and wider Costain business
  • Facilitate Technical Queries &/or Requests for Information to the Client (via the Client procurement portal), Suppliers and other internal/external Stakeholders
  • Develop the list of ‘Services & Other Things to be provided by the Employer for inclusion within project estimates or Company information
  • Review of Nett Direct Works scope and provide feedback to estimators
  • Ensure Compliance, Risk and External Constraints elements are documented and factored into estimates
  • Present and minute the required Governance review meetings for MSP Framework, Sector Leadership Team(s) and the wider Costain business, ensuring all governance gates are completed and actions closed
  • Ensure each tender response clearly identifies, articulates, and factors in risk and opportunity for consideration in the cost estimate, delivery programme and governance reviews

Risk Management

  • Ensure the provision of a tender stage risk register for each opportunity and undertake rating / scoring of risks and assigning suitable mitigations
  • Client Operations and other Stakeholders: Engagement & coordination with site operations to ensure the site-specific constraints / issues are known and mitigated for the tender and delivery phases of the opportunity
  • Ecological Constraints Management: Coordination with opportunity Delivery Team and Client /other Stakeholders to identify potential impacts and mitigations from the relevant 3rd Party, environmental and ecological constraints (such as protected species, vegetation and need for clearance, archaeology, UXO, etc...)
  • Work with the opportunity delivery team to identify potential Third-Party Land interfaces (such as access/egress to site, land purchase &/or leasing) and coordinate engagement through Clients’ Land Surveyor
  • Work with the opportunity delivery team to ensure other permits / licenses are identified and applied for to mitigate programme delay risks

Site Visits & Surveys

Work with the opportunity delivery team to identify, plan and manage site surveys required in support of each tender (where appropriate)

Where investigations are required, liaise with the assigned opportunity delivery team to establish a plan to implement any investigation works associated with the Tender Proposal; This may include but not limited to

  • Initial Site / Asset Condition Surveys
  • Topographical & Utility Mapping
  • Laser Scanning / 3D modelling
  • Ground Site Investigations
  • Trial Holes & other buried services/infrastructure investigations
  • Existing Utility Investigations (Power / Water / Comms / Drainage)
  • MCC & Systems Integration Investigations &/or Harmonics Surveys
  • Telemetry surveys
  • Materials Investigations (i.e.; Asbestos / Refurbishment & Demolition Surveys)
  • Ecological surveys & investigations

Essential skills

  • Degree level qualified or equivalent in an Engineering or Commercial related discipline
  • 5 Years’ experience working at a Level
  • Experience of pricing medium to large value Contractor in the water sector and/or highways, rail, nuclear could be an advantage
  • Customer Focused, Open and Honest, Safe and Environmentally aware, Team Players, Accountable, Improving Continuously, and so the Natural Choice
  • Good communication skills with other members of the team and with external contacts. Must be a good team player and adopt a positive “can-do” approach at all times
  • Must be able to manage administration support and other members of the team to ensure the successful delivery of the tender
  • Must be commercially aware and a lateral thinker with a knowledge of various Forms of Contract, I.Chem.E. and NEC Terms and Conditions both lump sum and Target Cost
  • Ability to manage and prioritise a high volume of work that requires completion within tight timeframes to meet the demands of the contract and the timely completion of multiple concurrent tenders with a fast turnaround in a Framework Environment
  • High level of competence using MS Word, Excel. PowerPoint and Teams

Desirable skills

  • Experience of water and / or utilities sector (minimum 5 years)
  • Experience of working within a multi-discipline engineering environment
  • Knowledge and appreciation of sewage treatment processes, water treatment processes and pumping systems
  • Holding a current relevant CSCS Card
  • Holding a current relevant Blue Card
  • Proven experience in Tender / Bid Management
  • A full driving licence


About Costain

Costain helps to improve people’s lives with integrated, leading edge, smart infrastructure solutions across the UK’s energy, water, transportation and defence markets. We help our clients improve their business performance by increasing capacity, improving customer service, safeguarding security, enhancing resilience, decarbonising and delivering increased efficiency. Our vision is to be the UK’s leading smart infrastructure solutions company. We will achieve this by focusing on blue chip clients whose major spending plans are underpinned by strategic national needs, regulatory commitments, legislation or essential performance requirements. We offer our clients leading edge solutions that are digitally optimised through the following five services which cover the whole lifecycle of their assets: future-shaping strategic consultancy; consultancy and advisory; digital technology solutions; asset optimisation and complex programme delivery. Our culture and values underpin everything we do.

Your application

At Costain we aim to be an accessible, diverse and inclusive organisation to continue to meet our customers’ needs. We will be industry leading in our approach and people from all backgrounds will be proud to work for Costain. Our goal is to have a workforce that is representative of society.


Should you require any adjustments to support you in your application, please do not hesitate to contact us: careers@costain.com

We will consider all applicants regardless of age, race, faith and socioeconomic background, including those from marginalised groups, such as (but not exclusive to):

People who identify as LGBT+, including non-binary people
People with physical or neurological disabilities
People who have mental ill health

We welcome you to ask about the flexibility you need for dynamic working, such as, working part-time, remote working, or compressed hours. In return, we will explore what is possible.

To find out more about our Inclusion strategy, please visit our ED&I page:

https://www.costain.com/our-culture/equality-diversity-and-inclusion/

Right to Work & Security Checks

Understandably given the nature of our business, everyone who is employed at Costain must undergo thorough referencing checks. We will need different information depending on the job we have offered you. For all roles, we'll carry out a criminal record check and we’ll ask to see evidence that you have the legal right to work in the UK.
For some of our roles, you may be required to obtain and maintain security clearance of at least Security Check level (or SC clearance). To satisfy the requirements, you will need to have been a legal UK resident for a minimum of 5 years and have successfully complete all stages of the vetting process.

Closing date

Please note that Costain reserves the right to bring forward the closing date of any of its job vacancies if we receive a suitable number of quality applications from which to make a shortlist. Therefore, we recommend at you apply as soon as possible rather than wait until the published closing date

This is an advert for our job vacancy, and therefore may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the role described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of Costain.


A Disability Confident employer will generally offer an interview to any applicant that declares they have a disability and meets the minimum criteria for the job as defined by the employer. It is important to note that in certain recruitment situations such as high-volume, seasonal and high-peak times, the employer may wish to limit the overall numbers of interviews offered to both disabled people and non-disabled people. For more details please go to For more details please go to the Disability Confident website:

https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/disability-confident-campaign

title: Support Worker (Kick Start Scheme)
description:
Job Reference: 002571
For more information on the role,
please contact Flintshire office
Email: hftflintshire@hft.org.uk
Telephone: 01244 831290

*Hft Flintshire is now welcoming applications from candidates who have been referred by their DWP work coach for a work placement opportunity via the Kickstart scheme*

Pay rates:

  • £8.20 – Age 21-24 years
  • £6.45 – Age 18-20
  • £4.55 – Under 18

The vacancies are for 25 hours per week, Monday – Friday between the hours of 8.30am and 4.15pm. We have 6 vacancies for Kickstart support workers across 4 of our day opportunity services.

Find your place with us and help change lives.

We are one of the largest learning disability charities in the UK, supporting over 2,500 people through our friendly, supportive, creative and diverse teams.

About the role
Hft Flintshire are seeking Support Workers through the Kickstart Scheme to join us and support adults with learning disabilities to live the best life possible. We recognise that the current pandemic means we have had to adapt to change and in many ways we are now doing things differently but what hasn’t changed is our passion for standards and doing all we can to look after the people we support both in these current challenging times and in the future.

To keep the people we support and yourself safe and in line with government advice, opportunities to go out and about are limited, instead our Support Workers are finding fun and creative ways to keep people occupied at home, promoting health and wellbeing. In this caring and creative role, everything you do will enable people to have choices about their own lives, providing flexible services that meet people’s needs, and always looking for the best way of doing things.

The purpose of your role is to give the highest possible standards of support to individuals with moderate to severe learning disabilities, in all aspects of their daily lives. You’ll be helping to ensure the people we support:

  • Build confidence to develop interests
  • Feel secure and safe
  • Are provided with any personal care needed with dignity
  • Increase their independence
  • Are enabled to make as many choices as possible
  • Achieve personal goals, which may include travel or holidays

About you
You don’t need experience of support work or any special qualifications for this job - you’ll get plenty of training along the way. Having the right values, a positive attitude to life and a desire to support people to live their life with as much independence, choice, dignity and control as possible is what matters most. You will need to have good listening skills and a practical, caring approach. You also need to have basic level IT skills to be able to use a computer as you will regularly need to record information about people you will be supporting.

We are currently restricting face-to-face training; therefore most of your training courses, including some aspects of your induction, will be online. But you will still be able learn from your colleagues in a supportive hands-on environment.

What we offer
We offer a range of benefits and career development opportunities. We’ll give you a comprehensive induction, full training, and support along the way. With Investors in People and Skills for Care accreditation we are committed to investing in you to ensure you have the specialist skills and expertise needed to support people to live the best life possible.

Benefits

  • Complete the All Wales Induction Framework
  • Access to the Hft Plus benefits package, which includes a great number of discounts and rewards across shops, restaurants, gym membership and days out; but also an Employee Assistance Programme, with telephone and face-to-face support options
  • Access to award winning training and development – Hft is one of only four charities to have achieved the Skills for Care ‘Centre of Excellence’ provider status
  • Annual staff award scheme – The Fusion Awards, and peer recognition through our GEM awards programme
  • 23 days holiday plus 8 bank holidays (pro rata for part time staff)
  • A contributory pension scheme & life assurance
  • Free DBS Check
  • As a “key worker” you will benefit from government incentive schemes

Join us and help change lives.

PLEASE NOTE - The Kickstart Scheme provides job placements for 16 to 24 year olds on Universal Credit who are at risk of long term unemployment.

STRICTLY NO AGENCIES PLEASE
Hft's usual terms and conditions apply.
Hft is committed to equal opportunities and welcomes applications from all sections of the community. As a Disability Confident Employer, Hft is helping to ensure that disabled people have the same opportunities to fulfil their potential and realise their aspirations that people without disabilities do.
Successful applicants will need to undertake an enhanced disclosure check against the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS). Having a criminal record may not bar you from employment.

title: Principal Stress & Compliance Verification Engineer
description:
Businesses Raytheon Intelligence & Space

Clearance type SC

Relocation eligible No

Ability to Telecommute Part time telecommuting

Job ID 174134BR

Date posted 03/23/2021

City Broughton

Country United Kingdom

Principal Stress & Compliance Verification Engineer
Broughton, Nr Chester

Job Description:
The Principal Stress Engineer will be part of a team and report to the Head of Stress within the Raytheon's Airborne organisation.
Also should be suitably qualified and experienced to perform as a Compliance Verification Engineer (CVE), under delegated authority from the Head of Airworthiness to support certification of modifications.

Responsibilities include:
Compliance Verification of modifications to satisfy stress certification requirements of the regulatory authorities; CAA, MAA & EASA.
Providing Stress analysis for modification proposals for Aircraft structural and mechanical modifications and enhancements.
Reviewing and approving structural substantiation documentation produced by other members of staff or by suppliers to provide assurance of compliance with relevant customer and regulatory requirements.
Progressing structural and mechanical design modifications in accordance with regulatory requirements, providing signature approval of all pertinent design documentation.
Overseeing of design process from concept phase through to completion to ensure regulatory compliance is achieved.
Liaison with other departments and OEM’s re damage/defect investigations and corrective actions
Ensuring all engineering activities undertaken under their control are conducted in accordance with RSL site procedures that reflects best practice and in accordance with RSL and external authority (Civil and Military) requirements
Supporting Airborne projects across several UK based sites, with possible overseas working
Support to formal customer reviews, including the Structural Integrity Working Groups, Local Technical Committee’s and Configuration Control Boards
Support/mentoring of other stress and mechanical engineers
Assisting on projects in the Bid/Proposal process to ensure robust Basis of Estimate (BOE).

Extensive experience required as Stress Engineer at a senior level within the Military and Civil Aerospace industry and able to demonstrate knowledge of and hands on capability of both classical longhand calculation procedures and Finite Element Methods.
Analysis experience/approval of wide range of aircraft structure required including cabin interiors and primary global airframe structure.
Extensive experience working with an Design Organisation at signatory level and able to demonstrate a comprehensive working knowledge of EASA Part 21Jand BACR A8-21 regulatory, airworthiness requirements.
A track record of CVE responsibility is essential.
Knowledge of design analysis methods for repair to metallic and composite airframe structure including internal and external repairs
A proactive team-player who can motivate and support peers
Established engineering capability and someone who can anticipate problems and plan to mitigate
An able communicator in verbal, written and presentational forms
A logical problem solver who can operate effectively under stretching project constraints
High degree of commercial awareness with the ability to recognise and manage change, during the project cycle.
Able to manage and work within agreed timescales and task budgets

Candidate Requirements:
Essential:
Degree or equivalent qualification and experience in engineering/science discipline
Track record of signatory responsibility within the aerospace industry including approval of technical reports, drawings and Compliance Verification
Experience of working with multi discipline technical teams and individuals
High level of integrity and experience
An in-depth understanding of the full lifecycle of development programmes for the UK MoD and the MoD customer acquisition processes
Knowledge and experience of working on MoD Aircraft Platform system operational, ISTAR Operational and Procurement Domains
Knowledge and experience of the theory and practical implementation of Structural Integrity (SI) Management on Military to ensure compliance with MAA regulatory requirements.
Experience of delivery of complex programmes to UK MoD and international customers
Ability to help shape and produce winning bids into the target customer community
Established customer and supplier negotiation skills
Strong interpersonal skills, team motivator, able to build strong relationships with customers and peers.
Excellent Communication skills – written and verbal at all levels within the organisation to Board level and with the customer
Commercially astute with excellent negotiation skills
Capable of managing and motivating a diverse team in the delivery of innovative solutions

Eligible for or holder of current SC security clearance (RSL will sponsor as required)

Desirable:
Knowledge of composite materials and associated analysis methods.
Bid and Proposal management, winning new, repeat or follow on business through leading and supplying winning proposals
Line management experience of technical teams and individuals
Experience of effective management of programmes using Earned Value Management (EVM)
Member of a relevant Engineering or Programme Management Professional Institution

About Raytheon Technologies
Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an aerospace and defence company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace Systems, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defence. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cyber security. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts.

Standard Benefits:
25 days holiday + statutory public holidays
Contributory Pension Scheme (up to 10.5% company contribution)
6 times salary ‘Life Assurance’
Flexible Benefits scheme with extensive salary sacrifice scheme’s.
Enhanced sick pay scheme
Enhanced Family Friendly Policies, including enhanced Maternity & Shared Parental leave.
37hr working week, with an early finish Friday/9 day fortnight (hours may vary depending on role, job requirement or site specifics arrangements).
Flexible working arrangements can be considered wherever we can (depending on the role) so please enquire or highlight any request to our Recruitment team to explore flexible working possibilities.

Raytheon Application Process
To apply visit the link to the website http://jobs.raytheon.com/united-kingdom/search/
and search for Req ID: 174134BR. Please complete the on-line instructions to create a profile and upload CV.


174134


Raytheon Technologies is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

title: Veterinary Surgeon (Fixed Term)
description:
Posted on 02/12/2020

The Role

Here at Celyn Vet Group we are looking to welcome a third Veterinary Surgeon to the Celyn Vet Group family on a fixed term contract.
  • Full and part time applications considered
  • 4 days per week
  • 8am-7pm
  • 1 in 4 Saturdays (8am-2pm)

Your role will be mainly based at our Holywell branch, but you may be needed to cover some days at our Prestatyn branch during periods of holiday cover for example. We are offering a varied, fulfilling, and exciting role that will see you being able to build great rapport with your clients and good case continuity.

At Celyn Vet Group, we are passionate about case continuity. This means that from the moment our vets see their patients, they are encouraged to investigate and work up their own cases from that initial visit onwards.

We also have a wide and varying case load, which means our vets are able to undertake a mixture of consulting and surgical days each week. These are usually set days each week so that our vets can also book in their own surgical cases to carry out.

About Us

Celyn Vet Group have two, well-established veterinary practices in Holywell and Prestatyn and offer high standards of first opinion care to small animals.

We really do value our team here at Celyn Vet Group and all of their hard work. We all pull together and support each other in the harder times and really are more like a family than co-workers. We are a team of 18 consisting of: 3 vets (one of which is our Clinical Director), Practice Manager, 2 senior nurses, 3 RVN's, 3 SVN's, 1 senior receptionist, 4 receptionists and 1 Groomer.

Not only are we blessed to have such a great team, but we also have a fantastic, loyal client base. We often see returning client’s throughout the years meaning we get to care for our patients from puppies/ kittens to seniors. We are passionate on preventative health care and nutrition. We mainly care for small animals and wildlife, offering high standard of first opinion care. This role would be great for a Surgeon with a strong GP interest, looking for a long term role, in an easy going practice.

Investing in our practice, patient care and team is important to us. We would therefore be really keen to support your expertise or learning goals and incorporate them into the services for the practice potentially. Both practices benefit from in-house blood and lab facilities for routine work, ultrasound and x-ray facilities.

We are situated in the beautiful area of North Wales. Being close to the border and the A55, it means we are well located for those who enjoy the more rural side of life, with plenty of countryside and hill walk areas, or those that prefer the city environment with Chester, Liverpool and Manchester situated not far away from us.

Applicant Requirements

The ideal candidate would enjoy general practice and feel comfortable with all first opinion procedures. You will be supported and encouraged to work to high medical and surgical standards. You must be RCVS registered. A UK driving license would be required to commute between our sites.

As a BAME and LGBT+ inclusive employer, we are keen to hear from candidates from all minority and diverse groups.

As a Disability Confident Employer we are keen to hear from candidates with disabilities and long term health conditions, and would be happy to discuss any reasonable adjustments needed during the recruitment process.


Any questions before applying?

Speak to Amy Cranfield from our recruitment team who would be happy to help you with any questions you have before applying for this role.

Amy Cranfield

Veterinary Recruitment Consultant

amy.cranfield@ivcevidensia.com07856426902

title: Optometrist (Part Time) - Denbigh,Denbighshire
description:
Optometry jobs at Specsavers

Optometrist, Denbigh, Denbighshire

Specsavers in Denbigh are looking for an Optometrist. We recognise that our people are the key to our success – that’s why we ensure our team get the best from us too: from market-leading training, access to cutting-edge technology and a personal development plan built around you. At Specsavers in Denbigh, we also appreciate that as committed as you are to Optometry, you have a personal life too, that’s why we also offer flexible working hours and no commitment to working weekends. Join us as our new Optometrist.

What’s on Offer?

  • Part Time role – 3 Days a week
  • An annual salary of up to £50,000 pro rata (depending on experience)
  • A welcome bonus of up to £10,000 (pro rata) (terms apply)
  • A strong performance-based bonus scheme
  • Holiday allowance of 33 days per year, including bank holidays (pro rata)
  • Pension contribution
  • Outstanding clinical and professional development opportunities
  • Support with CET
  • Access to the latest clinical technology such as OCT


We’re fully equipped with 2 test rooms, the latest clinical technology (including OCT), and a team of 9– which includes fully trained optical assistants, so everything is in place to let you focus on what you do best.

This would be a fantastic role that will allow you to develop and progress as a clinician in a small but busy practice with an ever growing customer base.

What we’re looking for
You’ll need to be a qualified and GOC registered Optometrist with the drive, passion and the willingness to build upon our customer-focused culture. As part of our team, you’ll need to be able to provide a unique blend of customer care and professional excellence. You’ll need to demonstrate good attention to detail along with a passion for the community. Teamwork also forms a big part of our culture, so the ability to work well with others is essential.

Find out more
If you like the sound of this opportunity, get in touch, we’d love to tell you more about it. Contact Ciara Mullaly on +447508 527405 or ciara.mullaly@specsavers.com

title: Level 3 Nursery Nurse/ Nursery Practitioner
description:
Busy Bees in Wirral Neston are looking for a Level 3 Qualified Nursery Practitioner/Nursery Nurse to join our Team working Full Time (40 hours per week).


The top 5 Reasons to join us!

  • Childcare provision with substantial childcare discounts
  • Excellent in-house training, opportunity to gain further qualifications, Virtual learning andcareer progression opportunities
  • Exclusive access to UP*; Busy Bees unique early years learning programme
  • Retail Discounts Scheme via an online benefits portal
  • Global exchange programme (short term secondment to another country)
  • Visit our website to find out more


We are offering a Welcome Bonus of £250 for anyone who accepts this role at our Wirral Neston Nursery.*

Our Nursery

Busy Bees at Wirral Neston Day Nursery and Preschool is set in a lovely converted barn in Liverpool Road just off the main Chester High Road. We are a popular choice with local families, offering a quality childcare service in a stunning setting, but with lower fees than other nurseries nearby.


Our Company

Established by 3 families in 1984 Busy Bees is now the UK’s largest childcare company with over 350 nurseries across the UK.


Our Vision

To give every child the best start in life


Our Mission

Deliver high quality childcare & Exciting opportunities for learning that gives every child a head start as they prepare for school


Your Mission

As a Qualified Nursery Practitioner, you will be role modelling your knowledge and best practice to colleagues.


Here is a snapshot of what your role will include:


Care: We take care very seriously

  • As a keyworker, you will ensure every individual child’s needs are met.
  • Safeguarding children is your priority.
  • Speak Up against practices that don’t support safeguarding or Our Core Values.

Service: We are an integral part of a parent’s support network

  • Get to know the families at the setting and attend parents’ evenings.
  • Update parents on their child’s day and development.
  • Support parents with any SEN/ASL needs

Quality: We set and maintain the highest standards it’s what children and parents deserve

  • Embrace and promote our Standards of Excellence in every part of your role.
  • Take pride in your planning observation and assessment procedure.
  • Adhere to our childcare policies.
  • Be a key player to ensure the nursery receives excellent outcomes in internal audits and those of external authorities such as Ofsted, CI and CIW.

Value: We ensure that we provide outstanding value for money

  • Create a setting that is clean and welcoming, with well-kept educational resources.
  • Ensure that children’s observations are detailed, reflective and provide developmentally challenging next steps.
  • Ensure we encourage and praise children’s development and achievements.

Your Qualifications and Experience:

  • NNEB or BTEC Nat Dip or CACHE Dip in Childcare or NVQ Level 3 or SVQ
  • Previous experience working and caring for children under 5
  • Passion to deliver high quality childcare and exciting learning opportunities

  • Bonus is at Nursery’s discretion and will be processed following satisfactory completion of probation period. Part time will be pro rata’d

We reserve the right to close a job prior to the initial closing date.

title: Residential Support Worker Liverpool
description:
Residential Support Worker

Liverpool, Merseyside

Full-time salary: £17,684-£19,793 plus approx. £3,000-£6,000 sleep-in allowance pa (£62.64 per sleep-in, working approx. 4-8 sleep-ins per month)

Full and Part-Time Opportunities Available

Excellent opportunity for Residential Support Workers to join our children’s home in Liverpool. Are you looking for a challenging yet rewarding career? We work with, for and alongside children and young people in residential settings who need a kind, caring and fun place to live despite the challenges they may bring. We are looking for energetic, caring candidates to support children and young people aged 8-18 years with Learning Disabilities and ASD.

We are one of the largest providers of residential childcare in the UK with more than 87% of our services rated ‘good’ or ‘outstanding’. Our EPIC values (Excellence, Passion, Integrity, Caring) underpin everything we do at Keys Group and we’re looking to recruit Residential Support Workers who can demonstrate these values. We have part and full-time opportunities available; and we are also recruiting Waking Night Support Workers and Senior Residential Support Worker’s within Liverpool and the surrounding areas.

You will be supported to gain vocational qualifications which will help to ensure you can carry out your work to the very highest standard, provide unmatched levels of care, as well enhancing your pay and career progression.

Our benefits include:

  • Entitlement to 28 days of annual leave (inclusive of bank holidays).
  • Enrolment onto vocational qualification courses.
  • Progressive pay scale
  • Access to a voluntary benefits including discounts at cinemas, restaurants and retail establishments
  • Enrolment into the NEST Pension scheme.
  • Refer a Friend scheme – recommend a friend to come and work with Keys and you’ll earn a £500 bonus!
  • Enhanced DBS Check paid for by Keys Group

Please note we reserve the right to close the vacancy early should we receive a significant number of suitable applications.

Keys Group is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of everyone in our care and therefore this post is subject to an enhanced DBS check.

title: Veterinary Neurologist
description:
Referral Neurologist – UK

ChesterGates Veterinary Specialists is a CVS multi-disciplinary referral centre in the North West of England offering referral services in a wide range of disciplines including Internal Medicine, Soft Tissue Surgery, Orthopaedics, Neurology, Cardiology, Anaesthesia, and Dermatology. The hospital is located just outside the City of Chester and offers excellent transport links to major cities including London, Birmingham, Glasgow & Edinburgh. Liverpool and Manchester airports are both nearby and offer convenient access to domestic and international destinations. Cheshire is a beautiful county and lies within easy reach of the coast, mountains and other areas of outstanding natural beauty such as the Lake District, Yorkshire Moors and Peak District.

The team of almost 100 veterinary professionals work together to deliver the very best in client and patient care. ChesterGates is a partner practice with University of Surrey School of Veterinary Medicine providing us with the opportunity to support and encourage those aspiring to join the profession.

The hospital has recently undergone an extensive refurbishment and facilities include a Siemens 1.5T MRI, a 16-slice CT Scanner, DR X-ray machine and a new Philips Zenition 50 fluoroscopy. A first opinion practice and dedicated night services is also on site and the hospital benefits from CVS Group support functions such as finance, HR, Health & Safety and IT.

We have an opportunity for a Diplomate or Residency trained colleague to join the neurology team ideally from Spring 2021. You will be working alongside other residency trained clinicians and Specialists, a team of interns and a highly qualified and experienced veterinary nursing team. The ideal candidate would be comfortable undertaking all aspects of Neurology/Neurosurgery and would benefit from the support of our Teleneurology service headed by Laurent Garosi and Simon Platt. Full time or part-time can be accommodated with hours and working pattern adjusted to suit the successful candidate.


This is a great opportunity for someone looking for a challenging and interesting role with Specialist colleagues in a referral environment.

The salary and benefits for this role are extremely attractive and include access to our sharesave scheme, up to 7 weeks holiday a year (+ Bank Holidays) with our Buy, Sell Holiday Scheme, private health care cover, bonuses, pet product discounts and subsidised membership at over 2000 participating health clubs.


Further information on the hospital can be found on our website at http://www.chestergates.org.uk. For an informal chat please contact laurent.garosi@vetoracle.com. For more information or to arrange a visit to see our facilities please contact Sarah.hibbert@chestergates.org.uk
