title: Shared Lives Carer
description:
Vacancy Summary
Employer:
Vivo Care Choices
Salary:
This is a self-employed position - you will not be employed by Vivo Care Choices. Please see advert text for information on allowances and discretionary payments.
Location:
Chester, Ellesmere Port, Northwich, Winsford
Contract:
Permanent
Working Pattern:
Evenings/Flexible Hours/Full Time/Nights/Part Time/Term Time/Weekends
Hours:
Various/Flexible hours. This is a self-employed position. Please see advert text for information on working hours.
DBS Check:
Enhanced
Closing Date:
31/10/2030 at 13:06 PM
Reference:
OP/20/135524
Vacancy Description

This is a self-employed position - you will not be employed by Vivo Care Choices.

Shared Lives Carer
Are you a kind, caring and compassionate person who enjoys being around people, helping make them happy? Have you ever thought about being a Shared Lives Carer?

What is a Shared Lives Carer?
Being a Shared Lives Carer is a unique experience and the type of support you offer can be flexible to meet your own personal circumstances. The role can fit around other work commitments and family responsibilities and can be provided right from your own home. A Shared Lives Carer helps make a real difference in the person’s life, offering their time and support.

The care provided by you could include having someone live with you, spend the week or weekend with you, or meeting up with someone once or twice a week. The support you would provide aims to enhance a person’s independence and wellbeing. You will help them grow, develop in confidence and enjoy tasks, activities and hobbies, such as walking, crafts, singing, sports, shopping, or going to the cinema, concerts and the pub.

The service is both flexible and personalised and can be offered in a variety of ways to suit both the carer and the person. This is all done with the training, supervision and guidance from Vivo’s Shared Lives scheme.

How to become a Shared Lives Carer
You can apply to become a Shared Lives Carer through Vivo’s job recruitment site and downloading the attached application form.

Everyone applying to the scheme will be assessed. This will include a full DBS check, home health and safety check and personal health checks. All information is kept confidential. During the assessment, you will build a relationship with your scheme worker, who will then represent you at a panel for approval. This can take three to six months.

Who are we looking for?
We welcome people of all ages and backgrounds who are married, single, living with a partner, with or without children, who own their own home or rent with or without experience of caring for people. Anyone over the age of 18 can become a Shared Lives Carer.

You can work from home or in the local community, choose your own days and hours.

Each Carer develops a personal profile, which is used to match them with an individual requiring support, based on common interests, location and support needs.

For long-term and respite support, a spare bedroom is essential.

Benefits of being a Shared Lives Carer
As a Shared Lives Carer, you are self-employed and you can receive tax benefits if you fit the criteria. Long-term carers benefit from four to six weeks paid respite a year to make sure that the match continues positively.

You will have the opportunity to become a Shared Lives Plus member, which can support you with advice about the legal and tax arrangements. You’ll also receive many discounts and access to a whole community of Shared Lives Carers for advice if you join.

Access to Vivo’s training courses, as well as peer group meetings, can be arranged by your scheme workers.

You will be part of a service regulated by the Care Quality Commission (CQC) and have a dedicated scheme worker to talk through anything you’re not sure about and celebrate your successes.

Allowance and discretionary payments information

  • An allowance of up to £416.03 per week for long-term arrangements (dependant on assessment needs)
  • An allowance of up to £59.44 per night for respite arrangements (dependant of assessment needs)
  • £20.73 for up to three hours day support
  • £41.46 for up to 6 hours day support

title: Psychologist
description:
If you are a committed Registered Psychologist looking for a rewarding job, where you can make a difference as you develop your expertise, then join The Spinney in Atherton and enjoy support from a regional network of psychologists.

Working 37.5 hours a week at The Spinney, a service that offers a range of care settings for male patients with personality disorder and/or mental illness. The purpose-built medium, low secure and rehabilitation wards, as well as a psychiatric intensive care unit (PICU) are all set within an 11-acre site with extensive woodland and landscaped areas.

With experience from the NHS and/or private sector, you will work alongside a multidisciplinary team to provide a variety of Psychological approaches including, CBT, EMDR and DBT to support men as they build a brighter future.

Reporting to Cayne-Lumley, the Lead Psychologist, you will be responsible for individual and group interventions, diagnostic and cognitive assessments, MDT working, training, risk assessment and facilitating staff reflective practice sessions. In-role training can be provided in any of these areas.

There is a strong emphasis on teamwork with regular supervision and CPD opportunities available to support you in reaching your career aspirations.

  • Part-time applications will be considered.

Your responsibilities:

  • Providing evidence-based psychological assessment
  • Provision of 1:1 and group interventions to patients to address a range of needs
  • Contributing to MDT care planning and review
  • Contributing to the CPA process
  • Development, delivery and evaluation of training
  • Contributing to professional development within the team
  • Contributing to audit and research as directed by the line manager
  • Engaging in CPD

To be successful as a Psychologist, you’ll need:

  • Accredited post-graduate qualification in Clinical, Counselling or Forensic Psychology
  • Registration with the Health Care Professions Council (HCPC) (or qualification pending)
  • A commitment to patient-centred care and to values-based and evidence-based practice
  • Some post-registration experience is desirable, though not essential
  • Experience of working with people detained under the Mental Health Act (1983/2007) and in a forensic mental health setting is advantageous

What you will get:

  • Annual salary of £45,000-£53,553 (DOE)
  • The equivalent of 33 days annual leave – plus your birthday off! (Pro Rata)
  • Free meals and parking
  • Wellbeing support and activities
  • Career development and training
  • Pension contribution
  • Life Assurance
  • Enhanced Maternity Package

There is also a range of other benefits including retail discounts and special offers, car leasing without a credit check and much more.

About your next employer

You will be working for an established, stable and agile company with a unique approach to the delivery of care. With a network of over 70 services across England and Wales, providing four services including: Mental Health, Neurological, Learning Disabilities & Autism, Children & Education, there is an opportunity for you to grow and move with Elysium.

Elysium Healthcare follows safer recruitment of staff for all appointments. It is a requirement that all staff understand it is each person’s individual responsibility and are committed to promoting and safeguarding the welfare of service users. Candidates will be subject to an Enhanced DBS disclosure.




Disclosure and Barring Service Check

This post is subject to the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act (Exceptions Order) 1975 and as such it will be necessary for a submission for Disclosure to be made to the Disclosure and Barring Service (formerly known as CRB) to check for any previous criminal convictions.



UK Registration

Applicants must have current UK professional registration. For further information please see applying from overseas.





To stay safe in your job search we recommend that you visit SAFERjobs (https://www.safer-jobs.com), a non-profit, joint industry and law enforcement organisation working to combat job scams. Visit the SAFERjobs website for information on common scams and to get free, expert advice for a safer job search.

title: Home Care Assistant - Waking Night Support
description:
Company Description


With care at home from Home Instead, older people can live independent and fulfilled lives in the place where they feel the happiest.

We provide a variety services which include companionship, home help, personal care and medication support. Our care plans are highly personalised and tailored to the needs and wishes of our clients.

Continuity of care and building relationships is really important to us, therefore our visits last a minimum of one hour and we match all our clients with the right CAREGivers.


Job Description


Are you a night owl that's looking for a job that will really make a difference? We are recruiting for a part-time care assistant to support our (primarily) older clients at home throughout the night.

Offering night support, you'll be there as a familiar face, offering reassurance and a friendly ear when they wake. You'll assist them with medication reminders, personal care, maintaining a clean, safe environment and preparing them a nutritious breakfast. Your support can really help to improve their quality of life and maintain their independence, keeping them living in the place they feel happiest for much longer.

The current position is on a part-time, rota basis working two nights a week plus one weekend in three.

Access to your own vehicle is desirable due to the location/timings of clients.

NB: Due to the nature of the role, applicants will be required to undergo a DBS check.


Qualifications


We don't expect you to have care qualifications when you join us - our CAREGivers come from a variety of different backgrounds. We are looking for people with the right qualities.

So if you are kind, caring, friendly, empathetic and can spark up a conversation easily then you're already off to a flying start as a successful CAREGiver.

Training is provided throughout your Home Instead journey - giving you all the relevant skills you need to provide a top-class service to our clients.


Additional Information


We offer well paid weekday rate, enhanced at weekends with paid holiday, paid travel time and mileage, pension scheme, award-winning training, peer support and lots of other benefits.

Home Instead Wrexham & Flintshire is an accredited Living Wage Employer.

We are extremely proud of the work we do, why not give us a call today and find out more about joining our team!

Please enter your details below to apply or if you'd like an informal chat about the role please call us on:

Wrexham Office - 01978 660423 Flintshire Office - 01244 735201

Home Instead Senior Care is an equal opportunities employer, encouraging applications from all sections of the community throughout Wrexham and Flintshire as we want to reflect the neighbourhoods in which we work.

title: Dermatology Consultant
description:
Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

Consultant Dermatologist x 2 - Full time (Part time/job sharing will be considered)

The Dermatology Service forms part of the Specialist Services Division at WWL and is based on the elective site at Leigh Infirmary. We welcome you to join the team at the Prosser White Dermatology Centre (PWDC). We are a busy unit staffed by a dedicated, friendly and enthusiastic team. The PWDC is a stand alone dermatology facility. We hold general and specialist consultant and nurse led clinics along with skin surgery performed in the in-house theatres and nurse led phototherapy offering TLO1 and hand and foot PUVA. We also host parallel clinics with our plastic surgery colleagues from St Helens and Knowsley Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust.

You will join the existing substantive Consultant, Medical team and Specialist Nurses. You will be involved in developing the way Dermatology care is provided to our patients and in maintaining our high quality patient centred service.

One of our current consultants is retiring summer 2021 and so one of the two posts will be a replacement to join our substantive consultant and the team.

Applications are welcomed from candidates wishing to pursue a specialist interest or general clinic at Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust as part of their contract with Wrightington Wigan and Leigh Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust. WWL currently has such an arrangement in place with one of our substantive consultant which works well for both organisations. This arrangement also fits in with the commitment in the North West Sector of Manchester to work collaboratively to attract, recruit and develop new consultants into the Dermatology Service across Greater Manchester.

Candidates must be on the specialist register or within 6 months of CCT. Consideration will be given to candidates who would like to work part time or job share. Hours of work are usually between 9 - 5 Mon - Fri. A demonstrative job plan is detailed within the job description but a final job plan will be agreed with successful applicants and there is some flexibility regarding working arrangements and hours of work.

As part of our recruitment drive WWL are offering recruitment and retention premium upon commencement which will be payable over 3 years, based on basic salary: 20% first year, 10% second year and 5% third year.

The needs of our patients are at the heart of everything we do but we are equally committed to the wellbeing of the teams who provide an impressive range of services for a population of about 325,000 across four major sites. You can be certain your contribution will be highly valued, and your personal and professional development encouraged. The Trust has excellent postgraduate and research facilities, supports study leave for CPD and provides assistance with funding.

The successful candidate will have an Enhanced DBS with C & A barred list undertaken.

The Wigan Borough is one of ten metropolitan districts in Greater Manchester and is situated on the edge of the West Pennine Moors, between the major conurbations of Manchester and Liverpool. The general environment in Wigan and the surrounding countryside is a pleasant one with 75% of the Borough being open land and countryside. An excellent motorway network provides easy access to neighbouring towns and countryside.

Proposed interview date is the 10th May 2021

Informal visits or calls to the panel members are encouraged prior to interview.

title: Commercial Contracts Solicitor
description:
A top 20 firm are looking for an ambitious Commercial Contracts Solicitor with 1-5 PQE to join them.

In this role, you’ll be part of a Legal 500-recognised team and be entrusted with a mixed caseload of non-contentious commercial matters.

To begin with you’ll work remotely, but you’ll then be based at the firm’s office in Liverpool for part of the week. Part-time working will also be considered.

This is an excellent opportunity for a proactive lawyer looking to handle top-quality work at a leading international law firm.

Commercial Contracts Solicitor – Liverpool / Remote

The company & role

  • A multi-award-winning law firm with a friendly and supportive culture

  • Working as part of the firm’s national commercial team, you’ll handle high-quality work on behalf of a range of clients including businesses in the manufacturing, technology and financial services

  • The firm has a very good track record of promoting its staff and offer a clear progression path

  • They are ranked as a Top 10 Employer for Working Families and Placed 16th in the Social Mobility Employer Index

  • They also featured in this year’s Stonewall Top 100 list which showcases the best places to work for LGBTQ employees

  • Commutable from Liverpool, The Wirral, Southport, Warrington and Chester

Added extras and benefits

  • Home working

  • An excellent benefits package including life insurance, share plan, a generous pension scheme and private medical insurance

  • Competitive salary

  • Generous holiday allowance

  • Genuine progression prospects

The ideal candidate

  • A Commercial Contracts Solicitor with 1-5 years’ PQE

  • Will have experience of providing Commercial/IP/IT/ Data Protection support in corporate transactions

  • Will have excellent drafting skills and technical knowledge

  • May have experience in manufacturing and/or financial services

  • An articulate and confident communicator

description:
We believe real value is powered by the unique skills and experiences of our professionals. The interchange of ideas from a diverse group of people gives our teams an expanded perspective and the ability to find better solutions for our clients.

Job Summary

Binnies is one of the UK's leading engineering and environment consultancies, specialising in water, energy and environment projects. We are seeking a full or part time Senior Environmental Consultants to join our growing multi-disciplinary Environmental Impact Assessment team in Chester, Redhill & Bradford-On-Avon.

Key Responsibilities

  • managing and writing all stages of Environmental Impact Assessments (EIA);
  • providing environmental support on a wide range of projects including fluvial and coastal flood risk management, water utility, rail, renewable/ energy projects and other large scale infrastructure;
  • managing consenting applications such as planning, Development Consent Orders, Transport and Works Order and Environmental Permits;
  • supporting business development and tenders;
  • liaising with project teams, clients, stakeholders and the public as required;
  • providing a mentoring/supervisory role to more junior members of our team.

Minimum Qualifications

  • have an environmental related degree;
  • be an EIA Practitioner with IEMA and/or chartered with another relevant institute (or close to achieving);
  • excellent written and oral communication;
  • enjoy innovation and embracing advances in technology and EIA;
  • hold a full UK driving licence.

All applicants must be able to complete pre-employment onboarding requirements (if selected) which may include any/all of the following: criminal/civil background check, drug screen, and motor vehicle records search, in compliance with any applicable laws and regulations.

Work Environment/Physical Demands

Normal office environment. May be subject to extreme cold (temperatures below 30 degrees for periods of more than one hour), extreme heat (temperatures above 90 degrees for periods of more than one hour), hazards (electrical currents, working on scaffold

0.4 Non-teaching SENCO, temporary in the first instance. M Scale

Christleton Primary school is a fantastic and vibrant place to work. It is a happy, energetic, forward thinking, and successful community school where values matter. We are situated in the heart of Christleton, a small village on the outskirts of Chester.

We are seeking to appoint a 0.4 non-teaching SENCO . The post will be temporary in the first instance with the view to becoming permanent and will be paid on the M scale . You will work in partnership with the head and deputy in the decision making and leadership of SEND across the school. This post is for two days a week (days are negotiable) and will start in September 2021.

Highly effective communication skills.

Confidence in the use of data to analyse and evaluate performance, presenting information to a variety of audiences.

title: Part-Time Consultant Psychiatrist
description:
Do you want to work in a friendly, committed and established Mental Health service where your knowledge and skills will be valued? Join the team at Ty Grosvenor as a part-time Consultant Psychiatrist and be the reason why lives change for the better.

Working 22.5 hours a week, you will join this experienced inpatient service to provide care for men and women with personality disorders and mental health conditions, where you will focus on equipping people with the appropriate skills for community living.

You will have overall clinical responsibility for the 24-hour management of in-patients, including implementing assessments for referrals, overseeing the Care Programme Approach, delegating responsibility and accountability to the Associate Specialists and other medical staff.


As a member of the Medical Directorate, you will be responsible for advising the wider team on psychiatric and medical concerns. This will see you design and deliver training to staff of all disciplines, in particular, the medical staff.

Ty Grosvenor is situated in the heart of Wrexham, commutable from Chester, Crewe, Ruthin, Whitchurch and surrounding areas.

When you work for Elysium Healthcare, you have access to a large and supportive peer group of like-minded professionals to engage and network with.

Other responsibilities:

  • Jointly, within the Medical Directorate, develop and review Directorate policies and procedures to meet requirements of statutory bodies
  • Participate in making appropriate responsible Medical Officer arrangements to cover the 24-hour operation
  • As a member of the Medical Directorate, to operationally manage within agreed standards, targets, timetables and constraints, following operational and strategic objectives in the Medical Service Level Agreement
  • Responsible for the administration of the Mental Health Act, Clinical Policy, Clinical Standards and associated administrative tasks in respect of patients
  • Exercise professional leadership and institute, manage and evaluate through audit a medical service, ensuring that clinical policy, practice and its application is research-based and of a good standard
  • Be jointly responsible with the General Practitioner for the provision of medical services appropriate to patients in this service

To be successful in this role, you will:

  • Medically qualified, MRC Psych or equivalent
  • Innovative and imaginative with the ability to initiate corporate decisions
  • Essential understanding of current developments in psychiatry and other aspects of mental health
  • Substantial knowledge of change management, relevant legislation, contemporary issues in mental health, recruitment and retention issues for doctors, knowledge of, and experience in purchaser/provider contractual issues
  • Previous consultant experience and in a management role

What you will get

  • Annual salary of £78,000
  • The equivalent of 30 days annual leave (pro-rata) – plus your birthday off!
  • Free meals
  • Wellbeing support and activities
  • Career development and training
  • Pension contribution
  • Life Assurance
  • Enhanced Maternity Package

There are also a range of other benefits including retail discounts and special offers, car leasing without a credit check and much more.

You will have the opportunity for regular career development to ensure you’re on the cutting edge and at the top of your game. You’ll have access to excellent CPD, plus access to a large peer group of enthusiastic and high-calibre consultants.

About your next employer

You will be working for an established, stable and agile company with a unique approach to the delivery of care. With a network of over 70 services across England and Wales, providing four services including: Mental Health, Neurological, Learning Disabilities & Autism, Children & Education, there is an opportunity for you to grow and move with Elysium.

Elysium Healthcare follows safer recruitment of staff for all appointments. It is a requirement that all staff understand it is each person’s individual responsibility and are committed to promoting and safeguarding the welfare of service users. Candidates will be subject to an Enhanced DBS disclosure.




Disclosure and Barring Service Check

This post is subject to the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act (Exceptions Order) 1975 and as such it will be necessary for a submission for Disclosure to be made to the Disclosure and Barring Service (formerly known as CRB) to check for any previous criminal convictions.



UK Registration

Applicants must have current UK professional registration. For further information please see applying from overseas.





To stay safe in your job search we recommend that you visit SAFERjobs (https://www.safer-jobs.com), a non-profit, joint industry and law enforcement organisation working to combat job scams. Visit the SAFERjobs website for information on common scams and to get free, expert advice for a safer job search.

title: Nursery Chef- Maternity Cover
description:
Busy Bees in Wirral Neston are looking for a Nursery Chef to join our Team working Part-Time (25 hours per week) on a 9-12 month Maternity Contract
Working Monday to Friday only with no evenings or weekends!


The top 5 Reasons to join us!

  • Childcare provision with substantial childcare discounts
  • Excellent in-house training, opportunity to gain further qualifications, Virtual learning andcareer progression opportunities
  • Exclusive access to UP*; Busy Bees unique early years learning programme
  • Retail Discounts Scheme via an online benefits portal
  • Global exchange programme (short term secondment to another country)
  • Visit our website to find out more

Our Nursery

Busy Bees at Wirral Neston Day Nursery and Preschool is set in a lovely converted barn in Liverpool Road just off the main Chester High Road.

We are a popular choice with local families, offering a quality childcare service in a stunning setting, but with lower fees than other nurseries nearby.

Our Company

Established by 3 families in 1984 Busy Bees is now the UK’s largest childcare company with over 350 nurseries across the UK.

Our Vision

To give every child the best start in life

Our Mission

Deliver high quality childcare & Exciting opportunities for learning that gives every child a head start as they prepare for school

Your Mission

As Nursery Chef you will be responsible for the overall food preparation, cooking and serving of food to children at various times throughout the day, this should be done using the highest levels of hygiene and cleanliness.

Care: We take care very seriously

  • Follow safe working practices for children and staff to comply with Busy Bees food hygiene and safety policies.
  • Play a role in the education of our children’s development by promoting good hygiene standards and spending time within the rooms teaching them basic cooking skills and promoting healthy eating.
  • Speak Up against practices that don’t support safeguarding or our Core Values.

Service: We are an integral part of a parent’s support network

  • Provide high quality, nutritious, freshy prepared meals and snacks in appropriate portion sizes and consistencies in line with food hygiene and safety regulations and Busy Bees policies.
  • Liaise with suppliers to ensure good levels of service are provided.
  • Accept deliveries and store away appropriately following correct manual handling techniques and effective stock rotation.

Quality: We set and maintain the highest standards it’s what children and parents deserve

  • Liaise with regulatory bodies during their inspection visits, ensuring action points and recommendations are addressed in a timely manner.
  • Comply with the company’s procedures relating to the Control of Substances Hazardous to Health (COSHH). Through understanding the principals of storing and using cleaning materials safely and taking precautions to protect yourself and others and ensure that records are up to date and available.

Value: We ensure that we provide outstanding value for money

  • Ordering food supplies to meet the menu requirements within budget.
  • Report any damages, repairs to the nursery management team so it can be logged with estates, take action to control any risk and make reference to this in your daily food safety book.

Your Qualifications and Experience:

  • At least 1 years previous experience working within a catering environment with an excellent understanding of food hygiene standards and allergens.
  • A good understanding of food standards requirements for the management of medical conditions, in particular allergies associate with food.
  • Food Hygiene Level 2 qualification (Essential)
  • Recognised catering qualification (Desirable)
All positions are subject to an enhanced DBS Check

title: Physiotherapists
description:
PAM Occupational Health Solutions is a highly experienced Occupational Health and Wellbeing specialist, providing services to more than 700,000 employees across the UK in both the public and private sector. We have over 15 years’ experience, working with clients to reduce absence and promote health and wellbeing in the workplace. Our senior management team are made up of highly experienced clinicians, who are there for ongoing support & growth of all of our colleagues.

About You:

You’ll be a Registered Member of CSP & HCPC. You will have a keen interest in MSK physiotherapy, as well as excellent communication skills and a passion for providing the best care and service. We would welcome applications from both experienced MSK physiotherapists as well as those who are newly qualified and are looking for a successful career within Occupational Health. Our permanent roles will be working 3, 4 or 5 days per week.

Our Values:

At PAM we are passionate about delivering our Everyday Things That Matter Values & Behaviours to our customers and our colleagues, PAM recognises that the successful delivery of its values is through its people. We’re looking for driven and ambitious professionals to join our team, who are just as passionate about our values as we are:

  • Hard Work & Enthusiasm – We believe hard work should be rewarded and we appreciate employees who go that extra mile to achieve their goals. Enthusiasm to us, comes from within, and shows a real passion for what we do.
  • Teamwork & Friendship – We want all of our colleagues to have a feeling of belonging, and we understand that collaborative working means better decisions making and supporting one another to achieve common goals.
  • Loyalty & Improvement – PAM Group are committed to its employees and dedicated to their personal and professional development. PAM Academy provides a range of training, awareness and educational support to colleagues to help them be the best they can be every day.


What We Can Offer You:

We have a fabulous benefits package available to all permanent staff.

  • Pension Scheme - We pay your auto-enrolment pension at 8% total
  • Health Scheme – Opticians, Dental, Physio & more!
  • 24/7 Doctor helpline – book a Telephone or Video Appointment with a GP
  • Employee Assistance Program – 24/7 telephone counselling helpline
  • Life Insurance Scheme – 4 x your annual salary
  • 33 Days Leave Including Bank Holidays, pro-rata for part-time hours
  • Professional membership registration fees paid
  • Support with CPD & training and development opportunities

title: Store Supervisor
description:
Job Ad

Store Supervisor (part-time 32 hours p/w)

Cheshire Oaks Designer Outlet, Ellesmere Port

We’re looking for an outstanding Store Supervisor to join our Kipling outlet team based in Cheshire Oaks designer Outlet, Ellesmere Port on a part-time (32 hours p/w) contract.

Today Kipling’s well-known bags and accessories are available around the world in over 80 countries. We are on a mission, to live a vibrant and colorful life – to go places you never been before. We lighten your step, powering your curiosity, to go your own way.

Kipling is a subsidiary of VF, the world’s largest apparel and footwear company comprised of over 30 brands.

If you are an active lifestyler then you are probably very familiar with brands such as Vans, The North Face, Timberland, Napapijri, Kipling and others. These are just some of the names we at VF produce and sell in over 1500 stores across 170 countries.

As a supervisor your input will be key, being the essential link between store management and the sales associates.

Let’s talk about the role!

As a Supervisor, your blend of sales and communication skills will contribute to the success of the store by ensuring everything runs smoothly day to day, by:

  • Support the management team to drive sales and profitability
  • Coach and motivate the team to deliver high levels of customer service ensuring the store is always customer-ready
  • Making your store look great, maintaining all retail operation standards in line with the brand’s visual merchandising guidelines
  • Ensuring operational policies and procedures are respected
  • Understanding your store’s KPIs and playing your part to ensure they are achieved

We believe that our supervisors have a great opportunity to develop their full potential with us and we are committed to preparing them for that next step up to store management.

Is this the right job for you?

  • You have experience working in retail with a fashion or lifestyle orientated brand alongside delivering great customer service
  • You are able to motivate people, creating a supportive, fun environment
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English – another language would be a plus
  • You are proficient in the use of MS Office and preferably had exposure to POS systems
  • You are flexible when it comes to working weekends, evenings and bank holidays when necessary.

What makes you the perfect Supervisor?

First of all, you LOVE interacting with people. You get your passion by helping customers finding the perfect product and you want every customer to leave your store happy. You understand that every customer needs a different approach and you know how to deliver it.

You share your passion and enthusiasm for the brand and you have the ability to lead the team on the shop floor by setting a positive hands-on example to deliver great customer service.

Work should be fun, so it’s important that our supervisors play their part in creating a strong, supportive environment. You are a great team player and are willing to do all it takes to contribute to the success of the entire team. For you, there is no such thing as “that’s not my job”.

When it comes to using your initiative your store manager trusts your judgement and knows that he or she can rely on you to keep things running smoothly. That’s the sign of a great supervisor!

What’s in it for you?

Most companies like to say they offer a competitive salary, an amazing bonus and pension scheme and staff discounts (btw we offer 50%!). And we offer the same. Only different. Because it’s not just our products which set us apart from others. It’s our people and we believe they deserve to be nurtured and looked after.

That’s why, on top of the usual benefits, we offer much more:

  • Career ownership, enabling you to build your knowledge and experience across different brands and even different countries
  • A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
  • Tailored training. From a thorough induction to ongoing online and face-to-face training, we are committed to helping you grow, both professionally and personally.
  • An inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together

And by the way, some of our other benefits include a contributory pension scheme, health benefits and much more!

If you liked what you have read and want to join our team then we would be keen to hear from you!

Due to the high volume of candidates we receive, we will only contact successful candidates for the interview stage.

title: Care Assistant (Day)
description:
About the Role

As a Healthcare Assistant for Maria Mallaband Care Group we ask for you to care for our residents like they are your own family, caring for their Physical, Psychological and Social needs. Assisting residents with personal care activities such as washing, personal hygiene, dressing and assisting with meals. We would love to hear from you if you have previously worked as a Care Assistant, Care Giver, Homecare Worker or Community Support Worker, but, as we provide full training, we also welcome applications from candidates who do not have previous experience including apprentice carers.

  • We offer our care staff flexible hours on full or part time over the 7 day week to offer a good work-life balance.

"Become a Key worker and make a difference"

  • Apprenticeship opportunities available

About You;

Above all, we’re looking for kind and caring people who want a job where they can really make a difference to people’s lives. You’ll also need:

  • Qualifications in Care is desirable but not essential. (Level 2, 3, 4 and so on) As training and support will be offered.
  • Previous experience working in a Care Home environment is desirable but not essential.
  • A committed and organised approach.
  • A confident communicator with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Flexible to work shifts.

If you would like to use your care experience and people skills in an organisation that provides the best quality care you’d expect for your loved ones, then MMCG is a rewarding place to be.


Our Benefits;

In return for all of this you will receive a competitive salary package plus:

  • Training support and development opportunities
  • 5.6 weeks annual leave
  • Fully funded training
  • Nurse and carer referral scheme
  • Rewards for 5, 10, 15, 20 and 25 years of service
  • Annual staff recognition through MMCG Care Awards
  • Simply Health cover after one year of service, inc. cashback on medical and dental expenses
  • Perkbox - a range of discounts and free monthly offers for a variety of high street shops and restaurants
  • Car through salary sacrifice
  • Cycle to Work scheme
  • NEST pension plan

“Maria Mallaband Care Group’s main priority is the welfare and wellbeing of its residents and staff. We have therefore adopted a Group wide policy across all our Homes requiring all new staff to confirm they are willing to receive a [Covid-19] vaccine. Prior to commencing employment, the successful applicant will be required to confirm in writing that they are happy to consent to receiving a Covid Vaccine when available, in accordance with the Government’s UK wide vaccination programme and that they are not aware of any reason why they would should not consent. We are happy to answer any queries any applicant might have about this policy.”

Birch Heath Lodge

Birch Heath Lodge is situated in the picturesque village of Christleton and is a short drive from Chester. The home is registered to provide care for up to 36 elderly residents. Christleton proves to be a popular residential care setting, with easy access to the town centre whilst being able to enjoy the natural beauty of the surrounding countryside. Birch Heath Lodge has three lounges, a dining area and a conservatory which leads out to the lovely gardens. Residents can now also relax in the home's new study. Care provider Maria Mallaband are well-known for a growing portfolio of luxury accommodation, dedicated to being adaptable to personal circumstance and to provide access to any necessary health expertise from a homely and comfortable environment.

title: Primary Teacher
description:
Primary Teacher - Wigan

Tradewind are recruiting!

Are you an experienced Year 2 Primary Teacher looking for your next role in Wigan?

Tradewind are currently recruiting for an enthusiastic and experienced Year 2 Primary Teacher to work in Wigan. This is a maternity cover role starting in September 2021 and will continue until the postholders return.

This 2-form entry Primary School is looking for an experienced Year 2 Primary Teacher to join their team. They place a great deal of emphasis on friendship, compassion, respect, and perseverance.

This Primary School is passionate about providing students with the skills and enthusiasm for Secondary School and offer a nurturing multi-faith environment. They provide a safe, happy, and well-disciplined learning environment and have a supportive SLT.

This "good "Primary school caters for approx. 454 pupils across ages 4-11, the school aims to work in partnership with parents to ensure all students are achieving the best they can in a high-quality learning environment. All staff at the school share the ambition and drive to keep improving the school and encouraging pupils to achieve the best results they can and enjoy their time in School.

The school is located on the outskirts of Wigan and is easily accessible via car and has free parking on site. The School is also accessible via public transport and has close bus links.

This is a full-time position, starting in September 2021 to cover maternity leave. You shall be responsible for a Year 2 class of up to 27 mixed ability pupils and have a supportive and experienced Teaching Assistant in class and a part time 1-1 TA in class in the mornings only. The successful applicant must have experience of Year 2 SATS and Read Write Inc.

You shall be required to plan, deliver, and assess work in line with the National Curriculum and be happy to partake in Parents Evenings, sports days, and school trips.

The ideal candidate for this KS1 Teacher role will:

  • Be a qualified teacher with QTS
  • Have experience of working within KS1
  • Have experience of year 2
  • Experience of year 2 SATS and Read Write Inc
  • Develop good relationships with students to ensure they have every learning opportunity
  • Offer a range of exciting, diverse lessons that all students can access
  • Have high expectations on students in both learning and behaviour
  • This position is subject to an Enhanced DBS Disclosure, Overseas Police Clearances (if applicable) and professional reference checks
  • Your CV must cover the last 10 years of employment history where possible and any employment breaks must be explained
  • You must have the legal right to work in the UK

The benefits of registering with Tradewind:

  • Online Portal for your timesheets and log your availability
  • Free social and networking events to get to know your peers and consultants

Click 'Apply Now' to be considered for this great position as a KS1 Primary Teacher in Wigan or for more information about the role, contact Chrissie on 01772 977333 or email- chrissie.hempstalk@twrecruitment.com

title: Consultant Paediatrician
description:
Consultant Paediatrician 10 session post (Full-time)

Glan Glwyd Hospital, North Wales

............

Applications are invited for the post of general paediatrician to join a team of eight other acute general paediatricians at Glan Clwyd Hospital in North Wales. We are seeking a new colleague ideally with an interest in diabetes and endicronology but are very happy to consider any applicant if you are someone who will fit in well to our department.

Our paediatric department comprises a children’s unit with a total of 20 inpatient beds plus six assessment beds, a dedicated paediatric outpatient department and a neonatal unit covered by a separate rota of neonatal consultants. We are a busy and cheerful department with a clear emphasis on delivering top quality care to our children and young people. We have excellent working relationships with our nursing and community colleagues and with our tertiary centre specialist services at Alder Hey, Liverpool. The department has a long standing reputation for providing excellent training for junior staff and medical students.

This post is for a full time substantive consultant in general paediatrics. Applications for part time working will also be considered positively.

title: Financial Controller
description:
The Company Overview:
Based on the outskirts of Preston in Leyland, this established dynamic and growing manufacturing business within the construction sector are recruiting a talented Management Accountant to support exciting times ahead. The business offers a bespoke and highly effective solution and product which has been the catalyst for continuous revenue growth over many years. With a unique and evolving product, they are established as market leaders and provide a quality of service second to none in this arena. Driven by a supportive, commercial and highly experienced senior management team the business continues to grow and look forward to exciting expansion plans in 2021. Part of the plans will see the site and business move to a new home in the local area, providing the opportunity to further enhance the business proposition and manufacturing capacity.

Your new role as Financial Controller:
As Financial Controller you shall support the Finance Director and Senior Management Team in the preparation and completion of monthly Management Accounts including P+L commentary. You shall ensure all financial transactions are recorded, filed, and reported accurately and be responsible for balance sheet reconciliations and Cash flow management. Supporting and developing a small team of 2 you shall review all financial plans and budgets and provide timely and accurate analysis to support commercial decisions. You shall be responsible for supporting year-end preparation and audit with further exposure to “ad hoc” accounts projects in support of new business ventures and further expansion. You shall support a migration of processes to Sage 200 and seek to develop internal process and controls to improve valuable commercial strength. Operating in a manufacturing environment, where no day is the same, you shall also be exposed to various departments and partner with them, providing financial analysis and commentary to support varying department heads in the decision-making process. Reporting to a Part-time Finance Director you shall deputise and take responsibility for senior decision making as and when required.

The Experience & Qualifications Required:
In order to be considered you shall be a fully Qualified accountant or actively working towards CIMA/ACA/ACCA. With experience of the manufacturing environment in a similar role, you shall be technically strong and have the capacity to provide analysis and commercial insight. With experience as a Management Accountant you shall have strong Excel skills with experience of a Sage accounting system, ideally Sage 200.

Your Reward & The Package On Offer:
As the business continue to grow you shall have the opportunity to gain valuable professional exposure across an expanding and dynamic business. Operating in an environment where no day is the same, and where the SMT continually seek growth, you shall work closely with market leaders in an exciting and astute business, providing the capacity to develop personally and further your career.

Who Are Butler Rose?

Butler Rose specialises in the recruitment of accountancy and finance professionals, from transactional and part-qualified appointments through to Group FDs.

With offices in Preston, Manchester, Leeds, Birmingham, Exeter, London, Milton Keynes and Southampton, we work with a range of businesses across the UK from SMEs and local accountancy firms to large Plcs and the Big 4, as well as many public sector and not-for-profit organisations. We are an ambitious and expanding business with great client relationships lead by a management team with long tenure in their markets. We are committed and focused to excellent candidate service.

Butler Rose is committed to equality in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer.
Butler Rose Ltd is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

title: Staff Nurse-Chemotherapy
description:
Part time: 29 hours per week

Permanent

An opportunity has arisen for a staff nurse to join our team. The Churchill unit is a friendly unit which provides oncology outpatient clinics and delivery of outpatient chemotherapy. In addition, the department undertakes CVAD care, blood transfusions and numerous other supportive activities.

We are looking for highly motivated nurses, with relevant experience and training in the delivery of Chemotherapy treatments for Cancer.

The successful candidates will be a proven team players as the post holder will work alongside other clinical colleagues in Oncology, Palliative care and Haematology.

You should have excellent communication, and interpersonal skills along with good IT skills. Effective time management and a flexible approach to working will also be a requirement.

You need to be a registered first level nurse with current NMC registration and have relevant further education/training in chemotherapy delivery.

title: Senior Care Assistant (days)
description:
About Us

Dovehaven are a family run care group providing quality residential and nursing care for the elderly. We have been providing quality care for our residents for over 30 years and pride ourselves on the happy welcoming atmosphere of our homes. Dovehaven provide a full range of care for residential and nursing needs, for both long term and respite periods.

About the Role

We have exciting opportunities for Senior Care Assistants at our Homes in Leyland (near Preston). As the Senior Care Assistant, you will be tasked with managing the care team within the Home and ensuring that care staff are adhering to CQC guidelines whilst providing exceptional levels of care to residents. You will promote and deliver high standards of care and supervise and instruct less experienced staff to enable them to fully contribute to the care provided within the Home. Part time or bank hours will be considered.

About You

You must have excellent interpersonal skills and be willing to take ownership for the delivery of quality care. You will have leadership qualities, a positive attitude and a desire to make a difference.

Self-motivated, resilient and well-organised, you will be a team player but able to work on your own initiative. You will be dependable, able to work well under pressure and flexible to meet the needs of the residents and the Home.

To be considered for this post, you must have previous supervisory experience within a care home setting and experience of working with the elderly. An NVQ level 3 in health & social care is essential along with a dedicated passion for providing exceptional care.

An enhanced DBS certificate is required for this role.

You must be fully eligible to live and work in the UK without the need for a work permit or sponsorship.
This company is committed to safeguarding and promoting the wellbeing of people using our services and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.

To apply for this role, please complete the form below, send your CV to recruitment@dovehavencarehomes.co.uk or phone 01704 546177.

title: Residential Support Worker - Young People
description:
Your New Employer:

The RK Group is proud to be supporting in the recruitment of highly motivated Residential Support Workers for Full or Part time contracts, (Immediate starts available). For a privately run organisation providing residential care for Children and Young People with Autistic Spectrum Disorders, Learning Disabilities, Physical Disabilities and complex needs with associated challenging behaviour.

Your New Job:

Your role as a Residential support worker will be to provide an emotionally secure, consistent, caring and supportive environment for the Children and Young People living within the service and to encourage their social, physical, emotional and intellectual development whilst participating in the running of the home. You will work with the other members of the team to provide a safe and happy home environment in which they can progress and achieve their maximum potential whist Keeping accurate, legible and up to date professional records.

Your Experience & Our Requirements:

You will ideally have experience of working in a similar role and have a clear understanding of the above listed duties, you will have 2 years’ experience of working within a residential care setting with Children and Young People and will hold a QCF Level 3 Children and young People (preferred). You will be an approachable, friendly and caring person with good communication skills, and a positive disposition. Skilled at empowering others through person centred approaches and an Innovative use of learned methods.

Your Future as The Successful Candidate:

You’ll receive a competitive salary of up to £23,983 per annum, (including enhanced qualified rates) Full, Part time or flexible contracts are available, a 2 week induction period, extensive training and development including fully funded QCF Level 3, free DBS check, free parking, free meals on shift and statutory pension (to name but a few)

Based on 42 hour per week contract. Shift work

OTE £23,568.24 Prior to qualification inc 6 sleeps per month.

OTE £23,983.20 Qualified inc 6 sleeps per month

As a recruitment specialist with over 8 years of local experience, I work closely with each Client and Candidate to understand each of their personal requirements. Should this position not fit your criteria as a Candidate, but you are seeking a new opportunity, please do not hesitate to get in touch for a thorough and confidential discussion on future roles and opportunities.

title: Obstetric Sonographer
description:
Hey Baby 4D is a private 4D ultrasound clinic based in Runcorn, Cheshire. We are currently seeking an experienced Sonographer to work on a part time, permanent basis, starting as soon as possible. You will be working in a beautiful, purpose built, modern baby scanning clinic with brand new ultrasound equipment.

We are looking for an experienced Sonographer who will promote a patient focused approach to care; ensuring all client areas are safe and fit for purpose. You will be required to undertake a range of duties using complex or sensitive information and will act as the customer’s advocate, maintaining their dignity at all times.

Hey Baby 4D Sonographer duties:

  • Conducting a range of non-diagnostic prenatal scans from early pregnancy reassurance and dating scans, to 4D scans and gender scans
  • Producing high quality ultrasound images and videos
  • Keeping accurate records and making high quality referrals to the NHS where necessary
  • Carrying out phlebotomy services for NIPT screening
  • Working with the management team to ensure a premium client experience
  • Working with senior management to develop new diagnostic services
  • Ensuring a high standard of patient care is maintained at all times
  • Adhering to fetal ultrasound safety guidelines such as ALARA
  • Maintaining high standards of cleanliness and hygiene throughout the clinic at all times

Qualifications and Skills:

In order to be considered for this position, you must be an experienced OBGYN Sonographer with an expert understanding of Obstetric Ultrasound practices and be registered with the HCPC, SoR, NMC or GMC.

Positioned in Runcorn, Cheshire, the successful applicant will demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills, coupled with a strong patient-centred approach. You must have at least 2 years’ experience working as an Obstetric Sonographer, with available references.

We are only able to accept applications from qualified and experienced Sonographers with recent work history and the right to work in the UK.

Required licence or certification:

  • HCPC (Health and Care Professionals Council), NMC (Nursing & Midwifery Council), GMC (General Medical Council), SoR (Society of Radiographers) or BMUS (British Medical Ultrasound Society)

So who are Hey Baby 4D, and why would you want to work for us?

Hey Baby 4D are a UK based private obstetric ultrasound group who provide pregnancy scans to expectant parents in many locations. We already have a number of clinics across the UK, with many more due to open this year. Each of our clinics are privately run and owner-managed, with experience and support provided from Hey Baby 4D Headquarters. All Hey Baby clinics in England are registered and regulated by the CQC (Care Quality Commission).

Our values are intrinsic to our business; Fun, Fair, Friendly & Family-oriented

Hey Baby 4D Runcorn are all about longevity – and that doesn’t just apply to our external partnerships, it applies to our employment strategy too!

With longer appointment times, you’ll have the chance to build rapport with your customers and perform all of the necessary checks before getting to the fun part. You’ll be an integral and respected member of a team committed to excellence and best practice.

Add to this the fact that we regularly invest in your CPD and offer an excellent benefits package with shorter working hours and annual salary reviews, and you’ve got yourself a great job in a lovely environment with like-minded people. What’s not to love?!

Visit our website

title: Clinical Psychologist/Neuropsychologist - Bands 7 – 8C considered
description:
TRU Ltd is a rehabilitation service working with adults with Acquired Brain Injuries (ABI). We have six residential units providing a rehabilitation pathway from post acute rehabilitation to community re-entry and vocational rehabilitation. As a Clinical Psychologist you will be working closely with the unit teams, to ensure our service users receive the very best quality of rehabilitation and care.
TRU provides our service users with person centred care to ensure their unique needs and rehabilitation goals are met. As the unit Clinical Psychologist you will provide specialist psychological assessment and therapy to service users. You will be supported by a specialist multi-disciplinary team including neuropsychology, neuropsychiatry, speech and language therapy, occupational therapy, physiotherapy and highly trained rehabilitation coaches. As part of this team you will offer advice and consultation on psychological care to the clinical and non-clinical team through teaching, clinical recommendations, reflective practice and supervision. This role reports into the Head of Clinical services however is predominately unit based, so gives a fantastic opportunity to offer support to the unit manager through recommendations to ensure the unit is safe and well run.

Requirements
  • Qualified and experienced Doctor of Clinical Psychology.
  • Registered with HCPC as a Practitioner Psychologist
  • Previous experience working within brain injury rehabilitation.
  • A keen interest in working with service users on a one to one basis.
  • To be striving for best practice for each and every individual accessing our service through commitment to effective, safe and responsive practice with consistency and learning lessons at all times to improve psychological care.
  • To always act in a calm and professional manner, even in more challenging situations.
  • Willingness to work as part of a multi disciplinary team.
  • To uphold our ethics and values.
  • Promote equal opportunities and the well-being of our service users.
  • Establish good relationships with our service users and staff.
  • Motivate and empower independence of our service users.
  • Manage time and schedules effectively, to ensure all responsibilities are completed to a high standard.
Responsibilities
  • To provide psychological expertise for service users from initial assessment through to community re-entry.
  • To formulate and implement person centred rehabilitation care plans for service users.
  • To regularly review and update care plans through assessment and using psychological expertise.
  • To work autonomously within professional guidelines.
  • To take a lead role in weekly client review meetings.
  • To manage and inspire assistant psychologists in their professional development.
  • To ensure that all current legislation is adhered to and updated where necessary.
  • To support the Head of Clinical Services where necessary.
  • To act as a role model to all staff and lead by example.
  • To work in partnership with the multi-disciplinary professionals; to ensure excellent service is given to our service users in all areas of their rehabilitation and care.
  • Always uphold high quality standards of person centered rehabilitation and support.
  • Follow company policies and procedures in all areas.
  • To uphold all standards, principles and policies of CQC.

Permanent, Full Time and Part Time Hours Available

We adopt a strong safeguarding culture of openness and honesty to best protect our Service Users and Employees. All successful candidates will be subject to DBS checks.

Benefits Include
  • 31 holidays per annum Pro Rata + 8 Bank Holidays
  • Discounted gym memberships
  • Tastecard Plus membership

title: Support Worker - female only - part-time
description:
Would you like to have a positive impact on someone's life? How about having some fun along the way? Then come and join us to support four women with learning disabilities.

We have part-time vacancies up to 24 hours a week.

The ladies we support live in their own flats. They have a range of interests, from swimming and walking to relaxing in the pub with a coke (once we're able to get out and about again). Their hobbies including making jewellery, listening to music and improvising on the drums!

They need help with their communication so that they can be in control of their own lives. They are all very different and a lot of fun to support.

"Our team says the ladies all have a brilliant sense of humour, they are engaging, energetic and fun to be around"

Lowri Bartrum, Area Manager

This is a place full of joy and we are looking for new people to join a very committed team.

We provide full training including positive behaviour support and physical interventions in order to equip you to be able to support them through periods where they may show behaviours of concern.

You'll work shifts including evenings, weekends and sleep-ins. Shifts are organised well in advance and worked on a rota basis.

About you

Experience isn’t always necessary. If you have the right attitude, good customer service skills, share our values and are willing to learn, you’re likely to be a great fit. We are looking for people who celebrate differences, and we strive to make all our staff feel included, valued and respected.

People who tend to do well in this service are fun and confident, positive and creative.

You MUST be a driver with a manual licence as you will need to drive service mobility vehicles when lockdown is relaxed

We are only able to accept female applicants for this role due to the operational needs of the service.


About us

MacIntyre is a national charity which supports over 1,200 people with a learning disability and/or autism.

We were founded in 1966 by the visionary parent of a child with disabilities and have been growing steadily ever since. We celebrate and develop everyone’s unique gifts, talents and contributions.

Training and Development

At Macintyre we fully support your training and development. We know it can be daunting to start a new job, and not everyone learns the same way, so throughout your probation we will provide you with a mixture of eLearning, face-to-face training and mentoring support whilst on the job.

But it doesn't stop there - throughout your career with us you will have access to our own dedicated in house Learning and Development team, Quality Specialists and HR Teams. These teams, along with your Manager, will provide you with opportunities to learn and develop professionally as well as enabling and supporting you to achieve professional qualifications and career progression opportunities - all free of charge.

Pay and Rewards

We provide a range of benefits to reward and thank our staff which includes:

  • Six weeks' annual leave including statutory public holidays
  • Workplace Pension scheme – MacIntyre will contribute 3% of your salary to all eligible employees
  • MacIntyre Staff Savings Scheme
  • Employee Assistance Plan (EAP) to support your health and wellbeing
  • Health Cash Plan which provides money back on core health treatments such as: optical, dental, physiotherapy, chiropody (at reduced cost)
  • MacIntyre Sick Pay (qualifying period)
  • Life assurance scheme offering valuable benefits to your dependents
  • MacIntyre Rewards Scheme which recognises and rewards staff
  • MacIntyre Perks which offers up to 6% discount off leading retailers including Tesco, Curry/PC World, Costa and many more
  • Access to the Blue Light Card which offers thousands of amazing discounts online and on the high street for emergency and social care staff.
  • Enhanced DBS Certificate (cost paid by MacIntyre)


How to apply

If this job sounds like the right fit for you, click on the Apply button on the MacIntyre website, complete some brief details and upload your CV.

Alternatively if you would prefer to complete a manual application form, you can either download one from the attachments on our website advert or phone us on 01908 357 016 and we will send an application form to you.

Please note: we reserve the right to close this advert early if we have received a sufficient number of applications, so don't delay, apply today.


Safer Recruitment and Diversity statement

MacIntyre safeguards and promotes the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults. Therefore we work with successful candidates to complete appropriate checks prior to joining. To work in the Social Care sector in Wales it is now a requirement to be registered with Social Care Wales. If you currently hold registration you are able to change the employer stated on your registration once you start working for us. If you do not hold registration you are able to start work with us once appropriate pre-employment checks are made but you are required to obtain registration with Social Care Wales within 6 months of starting your role. We will support you in working towards this: more information can be found on the Social Care Wales website..

MacIntyre is committed to promoting equality, encouraging diversity and embracing inclusion among our workforce. We want our workforce to be truly representative of all sections of society and the people we support. As part of this commitment, our accessibility toolbar allows you a number of options: read adverts in another language, including Welsh, change the font to Open Dyslexia, change the colours, and many others. Just click the button marked “Accessibility” at the top of the screen.

This post is exempt from the Equality Act 2010 (Schedule 9, Part 1) which provides for the application of a genuine occupational requirement.


COVID Information

During the pandemic we are following Government guidance regarding reducing transmission rates.

This means we are taking every precaution to keep you and everyone involved safe during the recruitment process.

It also means we are requesting that our current and future employees can commit to employment only with MacIntyre at present. Additionally, please be aware that if legislative or other requirements change in the future, we may need to make vaccination mandatory for staff joining us. These matters can be discussed at interview.

title: Optometrist Store Manager
description:
Job Overview:
At Vision Express, we are committed to providing our customers with outstanding service delivered by outstanding people. Across every role in our stores, everyone has a key part to play.

We have an exciting opportunity for a GOC/CORU registered Optometrist to join our store. The focus here is taking time to get things right from the warmth of the welcome, to the thoroughness of the eye examination. Being at the heart of the store, you’ll be a key ambassador for the business, so you’ll need to be at ease with engaging with people.

What can you expect from the role?

You’ll spend most of your day engaging with our customers, testing eyes, fitting contact lenses and delivering the standards of service and expertise that sets us apart. You’ll be a key part of the handover to the retail team, making the best recommendations for our customer’s needs.

However, you’ll see more than just the examination room. As a key part of our business, you’ll work closely with your store manager to build a successful team to deliver an unrivalled customer experience. This means always encouraging the best practice and the highest standards, with the team around you supporting you every step of the way.

You can expect a busy but highly professional culture where everyone’s working towards the same goal: providing a truly expert and individual service for every customer, leaving them looking and feeling great.

If you share our passion for providing the best customer journey and are looking for your next step, our structured training and development opportunities won’t disappoint you. There is no better place to express your potential.

Job Requirements:
What will we provide you?

One thing is for sure, you’ll find a rewarding, customer focussed culture with excellent training and opportunities to develop your career down your chosen path, whether that be professionally or into management.

And, if you have other commitments but are looking for a rewarding career, our part time contracts offer flexibility to suit you.

Alongside our career development programmes and a competitive salary, you will also receive:

  • Up to 38 days’ paid leave (dependent on length of service)
  • Free eyewear and generous discounts for you, your family and friends
  • Healthcare for you and your family
  • Company pension scheme
  • Flexible benefits including health, wellbeing and lifestyle options
  • Structured induction plan, including time at our Store Support Centre in Nottingham

If you are looking for a totally unique career, then we have the opportunity for you!

title: Digital Search Strategist (SEO / PPC)
description:
Salary: £24,000.00to£32,000.00/year

What's the purpose of the role?

This role is important because the results our digital marketing delivers influences whether clients renew and recommend Bespoke to others or not.

Your responsibility will be to increase the visibility of our clients in the places that matter to their target customer.

As the SEO and/or PPC specialist on the team, you’ll use your analytical thinking to build, monitor and optimise great paid and organic campaigns, and ultimately deliver leads.

What does the agency do?

Online-lead generation for service and manufacturing businesses in NW & London.

How many clients are there?

Normally 15-20 clients active with projects or retainers.

How big is the team?

The core team is normally 10-12 strong, supported by 3-4 contractors.

Where are we based?

Offices and workshop spaces are at the new Strawberry Fields Digital Hub in Chorley.

Can we work from home?

Yes, there is flexibility to work from home part of the week if you’d like to.

What are the hours?

Flexible around some core hours, we are more interested in outcomes than hours.

Job spec
Your goals

Generating leads/sales

Great feedback from customers

Account growth/retention

Common day-to-day activities

Developing lead generation strategies

Building, monitoring & optimising campaigns

Management for 3-5 key accounts

Some software you’ll use

AHrefs, SEMRush, Screaming Frog, GTM, GA

Google Drive (for writing and reporting)

Zoom & Loom (for liaising with clients)

Some secrets of success

title: Social Worker - Mental Health AMHP
description:
Out of hours AMHP Social Worker required for Liverpool hub Approximately 17 hours per week.

Duties include Mental Health Act Assessments - Complete Mental Health Act Assessments both in the community and in a hospital setting. All assessments are completed in accordance with the Mental Health Act and look specifically at whether a person has a mental disorder that requires compulsory admission in hospital. Responsible for coordinating and leading the assessment and ensuring it is completed both comprehensively and under the legal framework. Identifying a mental disorder is a key part of an assessment which is a key skill of an AMHP.

You must hold a recognised professional Social Work qualification (MA/BA/BSc in Social Work, Diploma in Social Work or CQSW) and be HCPC registered. Additionally, you must have at least two years post qualifying experience and be able to provide five years of references.

title: Pre Reg Dispensing Optician - Chorley, Lancashire
description:
Location: Chorley
Salary: Competitive basic depending on your experience.
Working Hours: Full-Time or Part-Time
Experience Level: Must have previous experience working in an optician and must have a GOC number.

Your future is clear at Specsavers Chorley, where there’s always something exciting ahead.

About us:
Specsavers has been going from strength to strength, ever since the business started back in 1984. We strive for the highest clinical standards – and believe that the customer should be at the heart of everything we do. We also recognise that our employees are critical to our past and future success – so we do everything we can to make sure they get the experience and career they’re looking for. From outstanding training and a personal development plan, to excellent benefits and unstinting support. The business has nearly 1,500 stores across 12 countries – and is still growing. We want you to be part of this outstanding success story.

With a business like Specsavers, the future always looks interesting for Dispensing Opticians. After all, we’re the UK’s number one provider of professional eyecare – and we’re still growing. That means your career has the chance to develop and room to progress. Join us now and who knows how far you could go?

What’s on offer?

  • Outstanding annual salary based on experience – we can talk more about this at interview
  • A highly-rewarding performance-based bonus scheme
  • Pension contribution
  • Support with CET
  • Exceptional clinical and professional development opportunities
  • Access to cutting-edge clinical technology, such as OCT

The Role in a Nutshell:

  • Ensure that you provide good levels of customer service to customers at all times.
  • Liaise with Optometrists to ensure that each customer you dispense receives a consistent quality handover.
  • Manage aftersales service (including complaints and problem solving) in a customer service focused ‘can do’ manner.
  • Contribute to achievement of individual and team sales targets by demonstrating effective professional sales techniques.

Then there’s you:
As a Pre-Reg Dispensing Optician in Chorley, you’ll use your skills to give customers an ophthalmic dispensing service of the highest clinical standards. You’ll be a role model for more junior staff, working your magic with customers, liaising with the optical, retail and lab teams, and giving clear, sound advice. Your efforts will help to drive overall store sales as well as customer loyalty – which will make you a key member of the team.

As a Pre-Reg Dispensing Optician registered with the GOC and good with people, you’ll be a natural when it comes to customer care. You’re friendly, polite and helpful – comfortable working as part of a team and able to answer questions and queries thanks to your excellent ophthalmic knowledge.

Platinum employer:
This store is an accredited Platinum Employer, which means you can expect an exceptional employee experience every single day you work here. The Platinum Employer Scheme is part of our drive to become a famous place to work. Stores with this accreditation have been verified on five key employer standards: Recruitment, Performance Management and Reward, Talent Management, Learning and Development and Employee Engagement.

For more information or to apply, please contact Megan Francis at Specsavers Recruitment Service on 01566 771899 or megan.francis@specsavers.com.

Tremendous opportunity to join this full service North West regional law firm and work as part of a successful conveyancing department. The conveyancing team is the largest & most profitable team within the business, as well as having one of the most well regarded teams within the North West. You will need to have gained at least 2 years' experience as a qualified conveyancer

The caseload in place is roughly 100 - 120 files however this is in a well managed environment with a modern case management and Paralegal support, so you won't be limited by time constraints or being bogged down by admin duties.
