title: Dementia Advocate & Companion
description:
Full & Part-Time, Dementia Advocate & Companion, jobs, Conwy & Denbighshire – No Experience Needed – We offer Award Winning Training – however, you do need to BE A CAR DRIVER with your own car due to supporting individuals in the community.

It is a pleasure knowing there are people like you that love nothing more than caring for others and brightening someone’s day. After all, there is nothing more rewarding than seeing someone smile and making their lives that bit easier, sometimes by doing the simplest of things.

Caring in your Community

If you live in communities of Abergele, Denbigh, Rhyl, Colwyn Bay, Prestatyn, Corwen, Llandudno, Deganwy, Llandulas, Ruthin, or nearby surrounding areas, then we would love to welcome you to the team.

Who will I support?

You will be carefully matched and introduced to the person you will be supporting, and you will share a great relationship together. Your visits will never be rushed, all calls are a minimum of 30 mins with a vast percentage being an hour or more, meaning you spend quality time with the person we match you with.

Because you get to know one another well, the care that you would provide is never awkward, just natural. Some people worry about personal care, but people also have the wrong idea what personal care means – if this is something you are unsure about, we can explain this to you once you apply.

As a Dementia Advocate & Companion, the Care & Support an individual requires varies greatly, after all everyone is unique! All our clients vary from being very independent to some that need much more care and support. You could -

  • Arrive with a smile for an early morning call.
  • Prepare breakfast and assist someone with their morning routine whilst chatting away!
  • Assisting with morning or evening routine, including toilet prompts, helping with washing, undressing, or brushing teeth.
  • Prompt to take medication.
  • Preparing lunch together, taking care of their nutrition is important.
  • Maybe prompting them to use the toilet, to keep their routine.
  • Going on outings, hospital visits or visiting the shops.
  • End of the day companionship, hot drink, and chat before bedtime.

Key Information

  • £8.80 - £9.30 per hour, plus mileage & Paid Travel Time.
  • Award Winning Training.
  • Enhanced rates for bank holidays.
  • Flexible, Full & Part-Time Hours available between 7am – 11pm.
  • Alternative Weekend working; however, this can only be a couple of hours.
  • A COVID-19 safe, aware, organisation, with access to the COVID-19 Vaccine.
  • We welcome applications from all age groups (No upper Limit) and previous occupations.

A Message from the Team

To us, care is personal. As a team we are all truly committed to making a difference and we want to lead the way locally in changing the way our older members of our community are looked after in their older years. When you join our team, you will instantly know what a special organisation we are. Everyone in our team feels valued and supported. Throughout your journey with us and we can offer you not just a job but a truly rewarding vocation! There is care… but then there is the way we deliver care.

title: Associate Specialist Psychiatrist
description:
Do you want to work in a friendly, committed and established service where your knowledge, experience and skills will be valued?

An Associate Specialist Psychiatrist position at Elysium Healthcare is available in Cheshire and Merseyside to join our team full time at either the locked rehabilitation service at Gateway Recovery Centre in Widnes or at Victoria Gardens, Huyton, Merseyside.

This is a substantive and permanent post (full time 37.5 hours per week or ten sessions), however we are also happy to consider applications from those wishing to work on a part-time basis.

You will join an established team of experienced, friendly and supportive consultant colleagues with an excellent CPD programme and peer-group.

You will be working with an established multi-professional team delivering individualised care and treatment of patients with severe and complex mental disorders. Each service is close to the major urban centres of Liverpool and Manchester with good public transport links, two major airports and excellent schools and amenities.

When you work for Elysium Healthcare, you have access to a large and supportive peer group of like-minded professionals – there are currently 18 consultants and 4 associate specialists in the Elysium Northwest who meet regularly. You will be supported with your appraisal and revalidation, and will receive regular clinical and managerial supervision.

There is an on-call element to this role (currently 1 in 5).

Your responsibilities

  • Ensuring an adequate handover to colleagues including out of hours.
  • Seeking collateral history from other professionals and family.
  • Completing discharge letters/reports/s62 forms as required in a timely manner.
  • Preparing First-tier Tribunal and Hospital Managers' hearing reports under the supervision of Consultant.
  • Depending on your experience, providing oral evidence at First-tier Tribunal and Hospital Managers' hearings under the supervision of the Consultant.
  • Contributing to the service development by participating in Clinical Governance activities by conducting audits, research and teaching.
  • Work effectively with colleagues to ensure that patients have access to appropriate medical cover at all times.
  • Providing prospective cover to other specialty doctors when they are on leave.

To be successful in this role, you'll need

  • Full GMC registration
  • Experience working in psychiatry within multi-disciplinary teams
  • To be in good standing with the Royal College of Psychiatrists
  • To have had an appraisal/RITA within the last year
  • At least 3 years' experience in Psychiatry
  • Experience working as a doctor within similar environment
  • MRCPsych
  • Section 12 (2) approval (desirable)
  • AC status (desirable)

What you will get

  • Competitive salary
  • Private medical cover
  • Car allowance or lease vehicle
  • The equivalent of 30 days annual leave (or pro-rata) – plus your birthday off!
  • Free meals whilst on duty
  • Wellbeing support and activities
  • Career development and training
  • Pension contribution
  • Life Assurance
  • Enhanced Maternity Package

There are also a range of other benefits including retail discounts, special offers and much more.

About your next employer:

You will be working for an established, stable and agile company with a unique approach to the delivery of care. With a network of over 70 services across England and Wales, providing four services including: Mental Health, Neurological, Learning Disabilities & Autism, Children & Education, there is an opportunity for you to grow and move with Elysium.

Elysium Healthcare follows safer recruitment of staff for all appointments. It is a requirement that all staff understand it is each person’s individual responsibility and are committed to promoting and safeguarding the welfare of service users. Candidates will be subject to an Enhanced DBS disclosure.






To stay safe in your job search we recommend that you visit SAFERjobs (https://www.safer-jobs.com), a non-profit, joint industry and law enforcement organisation working to combat job scams. Visit the SAFERjobs website for information on common scams and to get free, expert advice for a safer job search.

title: Senior Residential Support Worker
description:
We are seeking creative and caring people to join our children's home in Northwich as a Senior Residential Support Worker. Our home is a 3 bed children's home providing support for children and young people aged 8 - 18 with emotional and behavioural difficulties.

Because we want you to get off to the best start with us, we are giving you £250 when you first start with us, and then when you are settled in in 6 months’ time we will give you an extra £250 for your hard work.

As a Senior Residential Support Worker you will:-

  • Be a key member of our team, providing high standards of person-centred support and care to our young people
  • Build good relationships with both service users and their families and external agencies, supporting them in the planning of goals, daily routine and in living as independently as possible
  • Participation in activities, positive behaviour support and accurate recording and reporting of the day are key tasks for the role, so energy and initiative is vital.

Skills & Knowledge

  • Hold a relevant Level 3 qualification in Children & Young Peoples Workforce or Children's Residential Care
  • Have previous experience of working with children and young people with challenging behaviour
  • Hold a full driving license for at least three years
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Effective organisational capability
  • Good IT capabilities and writing skills to accurately record and report daily events and activities
  • Be flexible to work a shift rota system that will include compulsory sleep ins and some weekends and bank holidays.

Your Benefits

  • Priory Perks reward and discount scheme
  • Comprehensive induction
  • Pension scheme
  • We cover the cost of your enhanced disclosure check
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Commitment to your ongoing training and career progression
  • Employee recognition scheme.

Priory Education and Children’s Services is a leading company in the UK offering independent behavioural care for commissioners across the UK. With over 100 high quality schools, colleges and homes we focus on making a real and lasting difference for everyone we support.

title: Senior Nurse Practitioner

title: Registered Medical Practitioner – Functional Assessor - GP/General Practitioner
description:
Introduction:

Ready to make a difference?


As a doctor are you looking to change lives for the better, including your own? At Maximus, we believe you can have a great worklife balance and continue to help others too.

We employ 3,800 staff, including over 1,400 doctors, nurses, physiotherapists and other healthcare professionals. Operating from more than 270 locations across England, Scotland and Wales, as well as having a global presence, Maximus is one of the largest providers of employment, health and disability support programmes in the country. Our businesses include the Centre for Health and Disability Assessments (CHDA) along with Remploy and Health Management.
Job Summary:
We’re looking for a GMC Registered Doctor with broad-based post-registration experience, who wants to do impactful work as part of a team, to help people move forward with their lives.

We offer an annual salary of £72,000 plus an attractive benefits package.
You’ll carry out assessments to understand how a person's disability or health condition affects their daily life. After each assessment, you’ll produce a factual report enabling the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) decision maker to determine a customer’s eligibility for benefits. You may also find yourself working on more complex cases including customers with neurological conditions, Industrial Injuries, Respiratory Diseases and veterans.

We know that having the right people makes a big difference to our customers’ lives. That’s why we go to great lengths to ensure our colleagues feel valued and rewarded for the work they do as well as support their worklife balance.
Essential Job Duties:

As a Doctor within our CHDA business, you’ll undertake a combination of file-work and face-to-face assessments in relation to a variety of benefits. These assessments will focus on how a health condition or disability affects a person’s day-to-day life. You’ll then utilise various IT platforms to support you in the clinical decision-making and produce a written report for the DWP.

  • Undertake a combination of file-work and face-to-face assessments in relation to a variety of benefits.
  • Use IT software programmes to support clinical decision making when undertaking file-work and face-to-face assessments.
  • Provide comprehensive reports to enable decision makers at DWP to make informed decisions regarding benefit claims.
  • Ensure that professional practice standards and best practice are maintained in all areas of work.
  • Analyse and interpret clinical information and medical evidence and provide a professional and concise report.
  • Apply professional skills and manage own professional competence and accountability, in accordance with the GMC Code of Conduct.
  • Work unsupervised and use your own initiative; understanding own limitations and requesting support when necessary or required.
Education and Experience Requirements:

Our Doctors play a pivotal role in supporting our customers to move forward with their lives, so we’ll support you through a formal training programme to enable you to carry out quality, sensitive and respectful functional assessments.

We’re looking for a GMC Registered Doctor with broad-based post-registration experience. You will be comfortable working to targets, open to feedback and have good IT skills along with excellent communication skills, both oral and written, as well as being confident in working with a wide range of customers and the ability to handle challenging situations. We are looking for Doctors who are keen to learn and take a proactive approach.

You should demonstrate your GMC registration and continuous professional development in line with their requirements. Previous experience of functional or disability assessment is desirable but not essential.

Due to COVID 19 all our Doctors are currently undertaking telephone assessments until we can resume face-to-face assessments.

CHDA Statement: Maximus is committed to developing, maintaining and supporting a culture of equality and diversity in which our employees as well as candidates for employment are treated equitably. We understand that a diverse workforce adds to our competitive advantage; and as such, we aim to ensure that job applicants do not receive less favourable treatment on the grounds of sex, race, marital status, disability, age, part-time or fixed term contract status, sexual orientation or religion, or are disadvantaged by conditions or requirements that cannot be shown to be justifiable. Advertisements for posts will include sufficiently clear and accurate information to enable potential applicants to assess their own suitability for the post. Where reasonable, we will review and consider adjustments for those applicants who express a requirement for them during the recruitment process.

title: Learning Support Worker required

I am shortlisting for this role immediately, so please contact me now if you are interested. Email your CV to rosie.cullen@connex-education.com

All offers are conditional upon satisfactory background checks, including a DBS check. All appointments will be made subject to a DBS check. Connex Education Partnership is committed to a policy of equal opportunities. We respect and value cultural and religious diversity and will not discriminate based on age, gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnic origin, religion, culture or disability. Everyone is assessed on merit alone.

title: Full or Part Time/Weekend Registered Veterinary Nurse
description:
Surgery Information / Job Description

Our well-established Stockport practice is seeking enthusiastic Veterinary Nurses to join the team at our RCVS Tier 2 accredited surgery. We are a progressive practice, located just off M60 near to the Pyramid and enjoy an excitingly varied caseload as well as a great flow of potential new clients. Join us and we will help you develop your skills and expertise.

Person Specification

Our bright, spacious surgery is purpose-built to industry leading standards, with state of the art equipment, including Digital Xray and Ultrasound. We have a full refurbishment and expansion planned for the near future, which will include dental Xray and a High Spec. Ultrasound suite.

Practice Partners, Kobus Rautenbach MRCVS, Jack Ferrario MRCVS, John-Michael Maloney, Practice Manager and Sharon Blundell RVN, lead a vibrant team of colleagues including 9 Vets, 9 Nurses, 4 VCAs and a supportive client care team. By joining us you will be part of a great team who are dedicated to providing superb standards of client and animal care.

We can offer full or part time vacancies, there are no OOH or on call duties and weekends are on a shared basis with time off in lieu. We can also offer a weekend only contract if this is preferred.

You will need to be a dynamic and proactive Nurse with solid all-round skills. Key to your success in this role will be your ability to embrace all aspects of the veterinary nurse role, including running busy nurse clinics.

If you’re keen to develop, we will actively encourage and fully fund your CPD, and there is the opportunity to train as a Nurse Mentor/Clinical Coach for those wishing to take this route.

Benefits

For the right candidate, we can offer an excellent salary, fully expensed CPD, Higher tier pension, Private Healthcare, Enhanced Holiday entitlement and much more.

If you share our passion for delivering outstanding pet healthcare and great customer service then we would love to hear from you.

We are an Equal Opportunities Employer

For further information please email: AmyHill@vets4pets.com

title: Waking Night Residential Support Worker
description:
Arden College is situated in the heart of Southport, a vibrant and cultured town on the west coast of Lancashire. The college makes the most of its position and much of the extended and college curriculum is located within the community and vocational settings within the region. The college is a co-educational residential and day specialist college for students aged 16-25 years with learning difficulties and disabilities and or behavioural and social difficulties. Individual College programmes of day or residential support are available as either 38 or 52 week placements for up to a three year period and are subject to regular reviews to ensure student needs are being met. The focus is to ensure that learners are prepared for independent adult life as much as is possible.

Arden College provides an inclusive Communication Environment that supports learners with their individualised communication systems. This includes spoken words, signing, symbols and both high tech and low tech AAC systems.

Arden College is inspected by OFSTED and is graded as Good (June 2017). All of Arden’s residential units are inspected by CQC and are all rated as Good.

The main duties of this role are:

  • To ensure residents' safety during the night
  • Making regular checks when residents are asleep and offering support as required if they are awake
  • Administering medication as required
  • Keeping accurate records of any events and support delivered during the shift
  • Carrying out household duties such as cleaning and laundry
  • Maintaining effective communication with day staff, House Manager and On Call Manager as required
  • Address and report any Health and Safety or Safeguarding concerns immediately as per company policies and procedures.
  • Maintain up to date training compliance.

If you have been affected by coronavirus, or are tired of working from home we have care and education roles available across the country for temp, part-time and full time roles.

title: Rehab Care Assistant
description:
We are currently looking to recruit a Care Assistant at Broadfield House in Leyland to provide person-centred support to our residents.

Do you want to make a real and positive difference to the lives of older people? Are you kind, warm, reliable, committed, have a passion to help others and a desire to provide a high standard of care? Well, look no further, this job could be for you!

This is a part time, permanent position and you will be expected to work on the following days:


Week 1 – Sunday, Monday

Week 2 – Monday, Friday, Saturday


You will be expected to work every other weekend including bank holidays, if this falls on the weekend you are working. The hours will be 08:00 – 15:00

This position is part time. Please note that the salary quoted is full time equivalent and if successful the salary received will be paid on a pro–rata basis. The hourly rate, however, is £9.36.

You do not need to have any care experience to join our team and we welcome applications from all sections of the community. In return, in addition to paying 'living wage' pay rates, we will make sure we provide and pay for your training, disclosure and barring service (DBS) application and uniform.

Here are a few things we are looking for:

A caring nature - Do you have a genuine desire to make people's lives better?

Great people skills - Do you enjoy spending time with people and building relationships? Can you listen and put yourself in other people's shoes?

A team player – Do you work well with others?

Judgement and creativity - Can you use your own initiative and knowledge to deliver great care based on a person's individual needs? Can you use your creativity to make someone's day brighter and happier?

Ambition - Do you want to learn, develop your career and be even better at what you do?

If you can answer yes to these questions, we look forward to receiving your application.

If you want to know more about the role, please contact Adam Croad on 01772 457672 for an informal discussion.

The post you are applying for is covered by the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 (Exceptions) Order 1975 (as amended in 2013). If successful you will be required to apply to the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) for a 'disclosure'. Further information can be found on the 'Our Recruitment Process' tab.

This position is part time, please note the salary quoted is full time equivalent, the salary received will be paid on a pro–rata basis.

We reserve the right to close down a vacancy early, before the closing date, if we receive sufficient applications.

title: Senior Sales Assistant (Part Time - 16 hours contract)
description:
Senior Sales Assistant (Part Time), Myrtle Parade, Myrtle Street, L7 7EL, up to £8.91 (depending on age) enhanced to £9.43 per hour when carrying out management duties, 16 hours, plus benefits.


Heron Foods is a food retail business providing its customers with high quality, low priced products. As part of the Heron Foods and B&M retail business, we have continued with our ambitious and exciting growth plans, now with over 280 stores and with new store openings month-by-month. B&M Express offers the opportunity to work within a rewarding environment with excellent development opportunities. This an exciting time to join our business!


As the Senior Part Time Sales Assistant you will be responsible for the following:-

  • Helping to ensure the efficient operation of the store, supporting the Store Manager and Duty Manager
  • Leading, inspiring and motiving the team
  • Responding to customer queries and complaints whilst ensuring high levels of customer service
  • Maintaining an outstanding store condition ensuring cleanliness, health & safety legislation and visual merchandising standards
  • Maximisation of profitability, meeting of sales targets and motivating staff to do so
  • Working within the front and back of the store; working on the till, packing shopping and stock replenishment


Successful Senior Part Time Sales Assistant candidates will have the following:-

  • Previous success within a similar role as a Sales Assistant, preferably within a fast-paced retail or hospitality environment
  • Ideally have key-holder experience
  • An honest and energetic personality who is organised and responsive
  • A good work ethic and enthusiasm with an enjoyment that comes from working within a busy and sometimes demanding environment


In return, we offer the following:-

  • Pension
  • 30 days annual leave (pro rata) with accrual of additional leave for long service
  • Staff discount across both Heron Foods and B&M stores
  • Uniform
  • Exciting development opportunities


If you have the ambition and drive to succeed within a rapidly expanding business, we want to hear from you.


Please visit http://careers.heronfoods.com/ if you would like to know more about life at Heron Foods.

title: Ongoing KS2 Tutor
description:
Connex Education Partnership is currently recruiting for 2x KS2 tutors to work in a two-form entry primary school in Warrington, working mainly with small groups in preparation for next years SATs, The role is to commence ASAP and will be either full-time or part-time for the right candidate, this is not a catch up role as they will have a separate tutor for that programme, this is ongoing and will run for the remainder of this academic year and to re-start September 2021

Tutoring plays a vital role in allowing children to reach their potential and required expectations in preparation for secondary school . This role is open to anyone with experience in KS2 and holds QTS. Completion of our mandatory tutoring training is required before starting work.

This is an exciting role for any teacher looking to make a difference to a child’s life and see the impact 1-1 or small group tutoring can have on a child.

As a successful teacher you will possess:
– QTS or equivalent, and have recent experience in teaching and/or tutoring
– Good knowledge of the Maths and English Key Stage 2 curriculum
– Be able to explain key concepts fluently and accurately
– Be prepared to tutor face to face and/or online depending on any local lockdowns/closures
– The ability to work to the school’s scheme of work and provide constructive and effective feedback
– Good time management to fully utilise the sessions.

In return, Connex Education Partnership will offer you:
– Full, free training in tutoring, SEN, safeguarding and much more

title: Staff Nurse for Specialist Mental Health Bed Based
description:
Are you a caring and compassionate Registered Mental Health Nurse or are just about to qualify and are looking for a fresh or new opportunity? Why not come and work for CWP - we may have just the role for you. We have vacancies for permanent, full and part time opportunities for Staff Nurses within our Bed-based services for both adults and older people at Bowmere Hospital, Chester. We offer wards that cater for acute admissions, assessment and treatment of dementia care, psychiatric intensive care and rehabilitation inpatient services. You would be required to work on a rotational shift basis, which includes days and nights.

You will be part of a supportive multi-disciplinary team and have an ethos of collaborative working between individual service users, carers and other stakeholders.

We are proud of being caring, competent and compassionate, with patients at the heart of what we do. We aim to provide high quality, safe services which improve the health, well-being and independence of the people within our locality. We are looking for motivated nurses to join our team. You should possess commitment to team working and innovative delivery of excellent standards of care. You will be able to demonstrate a real enthusiasm for mental health nursing, as well as a desire for on-going professional development. You will receive excellent training and opportunities for development, clinical supervision and appraisal. We also offer our staff training packages, development and leadership pathways and a comprehensive preceptorship program for those who are newly qualified.

At CWP we are committed to supporting the wellbeing of our staff and we therefore have regular engagement events to support our teams and to share ideas across disciplines and teams. We are passionate about developing our staff and our services and in turn providing the best quality care to our patients.

Bowmere has the following wards:
Beech – acute admissions ward

Juniper – acute admissions ward

Cherry – organic admissions ward

Willow – PICU

Maple – Male high dependency rehabilitation ward

Rosewood – Male and female high dependency rehabilitation ward.

We also run the ECT department for all CWP inpatients and outpatients.

Further information please contact Louise Gill on 01244 397260.
company: Cheshire and Wirral Partnership NHS FoundationTrust

At Horizon, we live up to our values, and we value our people. We are proud to be one of the most innovative providers of young peoples residential care and education in the UK. Our success means that we are opening new residential homes and schools and making a difference for young people in a variety of new areas as well as continuing to support young people in our established services.

Therole of Bank Teacher/Instructor is integral to the success of our HEALprogramme. You need to be empathetic and creative in your approach to managing thelearning of our sometimes hard to reach learners and be dedicated to making adifference.

This post will need you to be able to plan and prepare teaching resources and deliver them, on a one to one basis, with a student, in a non-school setting. This could be the student's home or other alternative premises. You will have support from the Head Teacher of HEAL and access to a range of resources to help deliver the HEAL programme. title: Nursery Practitioner Level 3 Qualified- 30 hour- Contract
description:
Busy Bees in Wirral Arrowe Park are looking for a Level 3 Qualified Nursery Practitioner/Nursery Nurse to join our Team working Part-Time- 30 hours a week - on a 6-month contract, with the possibility of being extended.


The top 5 Reasons to join us!

  • Childcare provision with substantial childcare discounts
  • Excellent in-house training, opportunity to gain further qualifications, Virtual learning andcareer progression opportunities
  • Exclusive access to UP*; Busy Bees unique early years learning programme
  • Retail Discounts Scheme via an online benefits portal
  • Global exchange programme (short term secondment to another country)
  • Visit our website to find out more


Our Nursery

Recently having been acquired by Busy Bees Childcare, Daisy & Jake Arrowe Park offers welcoming and stimulating environments both indoors and out with a dedicated staff team nurturing each individual child’s interest to give children the best start in life.

The nursery is conveniently located just minutes away from Arrowe Park hospital and offers a discounted rate for NHS workers.


Our Company

Established by 3 families in 1984 Busy Bees is now the UK’s largest childcare company with over 350 nurseries across the UK.


Our Vision

To give every child the best start in life


Our Mission

Deliver high quality childcare & Exciting opportunities for learning that gives every child a head start as they prepare for school


Your Mission

As a Qualified Nursery Practitioner, you will be role modelling your knowledge and best practice to colleagues.


Here is a snapshot of what your role will include:


Care: We take care very seriously

  • As a keyworker, you will ensure every individual child’s needs are met.
  • Safeguarding children is your priority.
  • Speak Up against practices that don’t support safeguarding or Our Core Values.

Service: We are an integral part of a parent’s support network

  • Get to know the families at the setting and attend parents’ evenings.
  • Update parents on their child’s day and development.
  • Support parents with any SEN/ASL needs

Quality: We set and maintain the highest standards it’s what children and parents deserve

  • Embrace and promote our Standards of Excellence in every part of your role.
  • Take pride in your planning observation and assessment procedure.
  • Adhere to our childcare policies.
  • Be a key player to ensure the nursery receives excellent outcomes in internal audits and those of external authorities such as Ofsted, CI and CIW.

Value: We ensure that we provide outstanding value for money

  • Create a setting that is clean and welcoming, with well-kept educational resources.
  • Ensure that children’s observations are detailed, reflective and provide developmentally challenging next steps.
  • Ensure we encourage and praise children’s development and achievements.

Your Qualifications and Experience:

  • NNEB or BTEC Nat Dip or CACHE Dip in Childcare or NVQ Level 3 or SVQ
  • Previous experience working and caring for children under 5
  • Passion to deliver high quality childcare and exciting learning opportunities

We reserve the right to close a job prior to the initial closing date.

title: Temporary PT HR Senior Adviser – Human Resources
description:
What's involved with this role:
Flexible remote working. HR generalist required with proven casework experience, eg. discipline, grievance, dignity at work and capability. Previous local authority experience supporting Adult Social Care teams would be an advantage. To support effective People Management.
  • Ensure HR Leads are supported sufficiently in their role, actively liaising on casework, targeting sickness absence and deputising for them as appropriate.
  • Provide professional advice to service clients on all aspects and interpretation of HR strategy, policies, procedures, practice and terms and conditions of service to ensure that employees are managed in a fair and consistent way.
  • Undertake job evaluations, advising managers on job content, ensuring results are fit for purpose and producing robust and fair evaluations that comply with best practice.
  • Liaise with the Transactional Services as appropriate to ensure that administration activities and standards complement the professional HR service.
  • Analyse workforce information and provide responses to requests for management information so that accurate and up to date human resource data supports management decisions.
  • Advise and support managers on recruitment and selection techniques and processes so that employees of the right number and calibre are recruited, deployed and retained and the workforce reflects service needs.
  • Advise managers on identifying training and development needs, working collaboratively with OD colleagues where appropriate, and resolving performance issues through development solutions.
  • Deliver briefing sessions and participate in workshops to support wider understanding of people management within the Council.
  • Undertake project work as required, including change management, and represent the service on interdisciplinary working groups to ensure the integration of services with HR.
  • Collaborate with HR Advisors and delegate appropriately in line with operational needs.
Produce effective management/staff communications on HR issues as required. Commission, analyse and interpret information from a variety of sources, including participation in National Benchmarking Initiatives to ensure that the service has all the internal and external measures it requires for review and improvement activity and to deliver value for money. Support managers as needed where agency worker and recruitment advertising needs additional input or an alternative approach, ensuring cost effective service delivery. NB: If you have previously applied to one of our vacancies and have already sent the required supporting documentation to us, please make this clear when you re-apply as this will help speed up your application.
Please quote the Job Title & Vacancy Reference No. in your application, or we will be unable to match your CV to the role being applied for.

“Essential Requirements” – Please check to ensure that your CV addresses the following items:
  • Our clients are generally seeking applicants who are reasonably local, so on that basis we would ideally like you to supply us with your address (or at least your post code) and a telephone number so that we can reach you during working hours.
  • Your recent UK working experience going back at least 5 years, or full employment history if you have been working for fewer years than this.
  • Your availability to work either immediately, or at short notice.
  • Qualifications:
    • Graduate Member of the Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development
    • Evidence of continuing professional development
  • Knowledge & Experience:
    • Generalist Human Resource Management experience in a unionised environment
    • Managing, supporting and developing a team - desirable
    • Up to date working knowledge of employment legislation, Codes of Practice and Human Resources Policies and Procedures
    • Knowledge of how to analyse and manipulate data
  • Skills & Abilities:
    • Able to communicate concisely and effectively, both verbally and in writing
    • Able to explain and present proposals and ideas in a structured and understandable manner
    • Able to influence, persuade and negotiate with others in a positive way whilst maintaining relationships
    • Political awareness and sensitivity
  • ICT Skills: IT skills including Microsoft packages or equivalent (e.g. G Suite)
Other preferable/desirable details to include on your CV, if applicable:
  • Any local authority/public sector experience
  • Any relevant qualifications held or being studied for
N If you would prefer to send a CV straight to us rather than by way of an on-line application, you are very welcome to do so via jobs@tclrec.com but please quote both the job reference and job title exactly as they appear below:

Job Ref: W Cheshire 5167478

Anticipated Length of Assignment: Unless otherwise stated (we do carry the occasional permanent vacancy) all of our roles are technically temporary, though opening assignments can be and often are, extended by clients on a longer term basis and can sometimes become permanent. Please do try to resist contacting us with requests for progress updates. We really do read every CV sent to us. All applications will be acknowledged by a human, not a robot, provided the job remains live and provided your CV meets the “Essential Requirements” listed. Please note that we do our level best to take down ads as soon as roles have been filled. We are not in the business of harvesting CVs. Important: We will interpret your application as being permission to submit your CV to this role (with the right to represent you) unless you advise us to the contrary.

title: Disability Assessor
description:
Disability Assessor - Wigan
Starting salary: £35,000 Per Annum
Permanent contract – full and part time available

Meridian Business Support is a permanent recruitment agency and we are currently recruiting Disability Assessors (RGN, RMN, RNLD, Physiotherapist, Occupational Therapist and Paramedics) for an exciting opportunity working on the DWPs disability contract. The role requires you to use your broad-based medical experience and clinical knowledge to conduct independent health assessments and write reports for the DWP. You will not be required to make any decisions within this role but simply assist with the health assessment of the claims process.

As an Assessor, you will utilise your clinical knowledge and broad-based medical experience by carrying out face to face assessments and examinations in a holistic manner. Such assessments focus on how a person's health condition(s) may have an impact on day-to-day life. The role will require you to use IT systems and software to write clear and concise medical reports which will later be used for decision making purposes.

This is a permanent position with both full and part time available. The standard working hours are Monday – Friday, office hours. No weekends, nights or bank holidays are required.

Previous experience as an Assessor is not required as full comprehensive training is provided. We will consider applications from all levels of Nursing. However, the minimum requirement is 2 years post graduate experience. The ideal candidate will have excellent interpersonal and customer service skills as well as the ability to communicate effectively with the general public.
Benefits

25 days' annual leave, with the option to buy and sell annual leave
At 9-month mark, performance related £1000 increase will be put in place and again at 18-month mark
Pension scheme, matching up to 10% of your contributions
Life assurance, private medical insurance and medical indemnity insurance
Reimbursement of your annual NMC/HCPC registration fee
Health screening every two years, after one year's service
Thorough in-house and professional training and development, covering well over the required CPD hours to revalidate and maintain your professional registration
All flexible benefits can be tailored to your requirement and lifestyle: travel or dental insurance, child care vouchers, cycle to work scheme and many more The recruitment process
Meridian Business Support is a multi-sector employment agency with branches across the UK and 30 years recruitment experience. We have a branch based in Liverpool that specialise in disability recruitment. The team of Senior Consultants in Liverpool have an in-depth knowledge of the sector and a track record of placing candidates into these roles. You will have a dedicated consultant who is on call to answer any questions and take you through the application and interview process as well as arranging your start date/training date.
If you are interested in the Disability Assessor position and would like to start an application, then please apply to this advert and a member of recruitment team will be in touch. Alternatively, to find out further information or to have a confidential conversation please call or email Ged Walsh – 07 464 542 015 / Liverpool_resourcers @ meridianbs.co.uk

title: Physiotherapy Lecturer - MSK
description:
Part time - 22.2 hours per week

Permanent

Are you an experienced Physiotherapist looking to utilise your skills in a role that truly challenges you? Are you wanting to build and expand your Physiotherapy career? Perhaps you are looking for a new opportunity. Here at Wrexham Glyndwr University we are looking for a motivated individual to join our team that has a high degree of enthusiasm and commitment. We are excited to invite a new member of staff to join our energized, dynamic teaching team. The role is best suited to an experienced and passionate physiotherapist seeking a change of direction from their current career path. For the right individual, these roles presents an exceptional and unique opportunity.

An enthusiastic and dynamic specialist in the field of MSK is sought to join an innovative and experienced team of academics. This post may be of interest to applicants who have a background and passion for working in MSK with the desire to extend their professional skill into an academic context. You will have demonstrable organisational and leadership skills and be committed to the student experience.

The post holder will demonstrate the ability to design and implement innovative approaches to enhancing student learning experience. The post-holder will also engage with research, scholarly and enterprise activities in accordance with the Universities strategic framework and participate in wider academic-related activities.

For further details please contact Julie Wilkins at julie.wilkins@glyndwr.ac.uk .

Applicants are advised to apply early as we reserve the right to close a vacancy prior to the closing date if a high number of applications are received.

The ability to communicate in Welsh is desirable for this post.

title: Occupational Therapist - Community Rehab
description:
Occupational Therapy locum position available in the Merseyside / Cheshire region to work with Community Rehabilitation services. Part time hours available over 3 days per week.

The position is for a qualified and HCPC registered Occupational Therapist to provide assessments in the community around the Knowlsey, St Helens and Widnes areas.

As a Band 6 Occupational Therapist you will carry out assessments of need for people who have a disability or have been ill. Your assessments will assist in their discharge from hospital back into the community. This may be rehabilitation in an intermediate care environment or to promote independence so they can return to living in their own homes.

We would like to hear from you if you are a committed, enthusiastic person, with a passion for Occupational Therapy. This position is working for a busy services so you will be expected to pick up an active caseload and to hit the ground running under the guidance and supervision of your manager.

To apply for this role you must hold a professional qualification in Occupational Therapy, hold full HCPC registration and have access to your own vehicle for community working.

Working with Eden Brown Synergy offers you a team with extensive Occupational Therapy recruitment experience. Access to a wide selection of Allied Health Professionals vacancies across the UK. The choice of PAYE or limited company or umbrella schemes and excellent rates of pay.

This position is to start immediately, so if you are interested please apply today by contacting Richard Parkin on 0161 233 1600 or email r.parkin@edenbrownsynergy.com

Don't forget...Eden Brown Synergy offers a £200 referral bonus for Occupational Therapists. If this role isn't for you but you know someone suitable, ask them to get in touch. £200 could be on it's way to you! Your expert recruitment consultant is Richard Parkin. Call today on 0161 233 1600 or email Eden Brown Synergy.

Eden Brown Synergy is committed to equality in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. Eden Brown Synergy is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

title: General Practitioner job Ormskirk
description:
Job Description:
GP Jobs Lancashire
General Practitioner Jobs - Ormskirk

Full or Part-time - Fixed term
Salary: up to £78,000
NHS Pension
Support with clinical training

Flame Health are currently working with a very popular Healthcare company who are looking for a General Practitioner in the Ormskirk area

As a General Practitioner you will provide high quality primary care GP services to the practice population and temporary residents as necessary. Such high standards will be achieved by working as part of a multidisciplinary team with other members of the practice and community teams.

Working within a large team, you will work alongside a multi-disciplinary team of other dedicated and highly skilled healthcare professionals to care for patients and their families in the way that you believe is best, delivering our clients high service standards, sharing best practice and actively improving the way we work.

Responsibilities

Maintaining the highest clinical standards at all times and in accordance with accepted good medical practice and the various clinical policies of the practice/centre.

In accordance with the practice timetable as agreed, the post-holder will make him/herself available to undertake a variety of duties as expected from a GP including surgery consultations, telephone (or other) consultations and queries, visiting patients at home, checking and signing repeat prescriptions and dealing with queries, paperwork and correspondence in a timely fashion.

Making professional, autonomous decisions in relation to presenting problems, whether self-referred or referred from other healthcare workers.

Assessing the healthcare needs of patients with undifferentiated and undiagnosed problems.

Screening patients for disease risk factors and early signs of illness
In consultation with patients and in line with evidence-based best clinical practice.

Developing treatment and any associated care plans.

Providing counselling and health education.

Admitting or discharging patients to and from the caseload and referring to other care providers as appropriate.

Recording clear and contemporaneous consultation notes to agreed standards.

Requirements

  • GMC registration.
  • Hold a MRCGP.
  • On the medical performers list.
  • GP Vocational or additional experience in general practice.

In order to be considered for this opportunity, in the first instance you will need to have a confidential conversation - please contact Clare Brazill 0115 8114365 Flame Health Associates on 0800 0850858 or alternatively email careers@flamehealth.com

Flame Health Associates LLP operates as an Employment Agency & Employment Business

title: Museum/Heritage Front of House
description:
Previous experience of working as a Front of House Receptionist within a historic/tourism lead environment ideal, also knowledge and experience of working with the public required. Previous work involving cash handling and till systems would be beneficial as well as experience in offering tours to groups.

Will be responsible for greeting visitors, taking bookings and offering verbal instructions and guidance to all visitors as well as cash handling, end of day reports and shop stock replenishment.

The ideal candidate would have the confidence to speak and lead tour groups and have a friendly and engaging personality. Full training on the history of the building and the context will be given, we do not expect the ideal candidate to have a full understanding of WW2 history, however, an interest would be an advantage.

Ideally, we are looking for someone who enjoys working within a team and is an ‘all-rounder’ and would appreciate working within such a unique building, which plays an important part in Liverpool’s tourism scene.

Out of hours work maybe required as and when to assist with special events/private hire.

Part-time hours: 30 per week to be spread across 7 days a week including weekends ideally Saturday, Sunday, Monday and Tuesday.

Application deadline: 23/04/2021

Expected start date: 03/05/2021

title: Family Solicitor
description:
A specialist family and private client boutique in Wilmslow is looking to take on a Family Solicitor with 1-4 years' PQE. As part of their close-knit family team, you will handle a varied caseload of family matters, including complex child-related divorce cases, some of which will involve high-net-worth individuals.

The firm is very flexible in their approach and would consider taking on the right candidate for this position on a part-time basis.

Family Solicitor (1-4 PQE) – Cheshire

The company & role

  • A leading Cheshire firm that specialises exclusively in family and private client matters

  • A down-to-earth, friendly team of solicitors, some of whom have been recognised by the Legal 500 and Chambers & Partners

  • The firm has a clear progression structure in place for lawyers looking to develop their career

  • Commutable from Wilmslow, Manchester, Alderley Edge, Altrincham, High Peak and Stockport

Added extras and benefits

  • Flexible working (part-time available)

  • Clear progression prospects

The ideal candidate

  • A Family Solicitor with 1-4 years’ PQE

  • A solicitor comfortable running their own caseload of private family matters and who is committed to delivering a quality service and excellent client care

  • A personable and confident communicator

  • Resolution accreditation will be welcomed but is not essential

How to apply for this Family Solicitor role

If this sounds like the job for you, you can apply via this website by clicking ‘Apply’ above.

Alternatively, to learn more about this opportunity or to register your interest, contact Paula on 03300 245 606 or email paula.pawlowska@realmrecruit.com.

Paula is a senior consultant here at Realm and our family recruitment specialist. She works with family solicitors at all levels and has connections with family departments across the North West, Yorkshire and the Midlands. As a result of her in-depth knowledge of the family law market, she is perfectly placed to help you take your next step.

Know someone else who might be suitable?

If so, get in touch – if we find your referral a job, we’ll reward you with up to £500 in vouchers of your choice. Find out more here.

Please note: any references to salary and/or experience in our adverts are intended as a guide only.

Realm is committed to supporting disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. Applicants are invited to contact Realm to identify any additional support they might require to enable them to make an application.

title: SEN ASD Specialist Teaching Assistant
description:
Are you a SEND Support Specialist?

Are you looking for a new challenge within secondary schools?

Protocol Education is looking to recruit experienced support staff to work with pupils with various needs such as:

  • Autism (ASD) - pupils may need support in class to maintain their routine, handle sensory overload, and to engage in learning in a way that resonates with them.
  • Moderate Learning Difficulties (MLD) (including Down Syndrome) can mean pupils don't reach their potential , become isolated from friends and need support to adjust and work at a pace to suit their ability
  • Specific Learning Difficulties (SpLD) such as Dyslexia can mean a pupil needs support understanding work set and keeping on track - special adjustments may be required and extra time to embed new topics and learning is often supported with learning support
  • Physical Disability - may require access, personal care or mobility

Do you have experience in one or more of these needs or Do you hold any relevant qualifications wanting to apply it in practice?

What Protocol Education can offer:

  • Protocol Education is a national company with strong and long-standing links to Schools across the country.
  • Optional CPD Training
  • Competitive salary
  • A dedicated consultant

Protocol offers flexible roles; daily supply, long-term placements and a choice of part-time or full-time roles.

What we require from you:
  • References from two of your most recent employers.
  • Have a valid DBS, which is on the update service or be willing apply for a new one
  • Have the right to work in the UK

If this sounds like you then we want to hear from you. Please apply online today for the role and we will be in touch .

title: Room Attendant
description:
We are looking for Room Attendants to join our team.

Situated in the thriving Georgian quarter of Liverpool, we are a privately owned, award winning hotel with a 2 AA Rosette restaurant, The London Carriage Works. A recent expansion has taken the hotel to 151 bedrooms and suites (Best UK City Hotel – the Sunday Times 2020) extensive luxury spa, and eight first-class private dining, conference and events spaces including a cinema.

This is an exciting role for a talented individual who is looking for a new challenge and wants to join a fast paced and high performing hotel team renowned for their approach and delivery of impeccable service. A passion for customer service is essential to ensure that every guest and visitor receives a personal service that is consistent and in line with Hope Street Hotel's standards.

Main duties & responsibilities
Main responsibilities of the role include but are not limited to:

  • Clean and maintain the hotel bedrooms with pride set to the company standards taking ownership and keeping caddies, trolleys and cupboards neat and presentable and stocked at all times
  • To report any maintenance faults and deal with lost property assisting with guest's queries as required, referring them to the Supervisors and/or Head Housekeeper
  • Be a team player and have a team spirit mentality.
  • To make sure that Company Policy, H&S and Departmental Objectives are followed and utilize at all times line with Hope Street Hotel's standards
  • Assist in training & development of Colleagues as required

Experience is preferred however full training will be provided and we are always looking for people with passion for the industry.

Reference ID: RA

Part-time hours: 25 per week

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: £8.91 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Overtime
  • Weekends

Experience:

  • housekeeping: 1 year (preferred)

Work remotely:

  • No

COVID-19 precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process
  • Personal protective equipment provided or required
  • Plastic shield at work stations
  • Temperature screenings
  • Social distancing guidelines in place
  • Virtual meetings
  • Sanitisation, disinfection or cleaning procedures in place

title: Medical Doctor, Functional Assessor - Wrexham
description:
Medical Doctor, Functional Assessor in Wrexham

Role Description: Medical Assessment and Reporting Opportunity for Doctors

Location: Wrexham

Starting Salary: £72,000 + Comprehensive Benefits Package

Hours: Monday to Friday, Full-time (37.5 hours) or Part-time (3 days+ p/w)

Exciting opportunities are now available undertaking the role of Functional Health Assessor in Wrexham.

sjb medical are recruiting experienced Registered Medical Practitioners to work with a leading provider of functional health assessment and reporting services on behalf of the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP).

All roles commence with a comprehensive induction programme and full sector of state approved training is provided with opportunities of working towards accreditation.

Full-time and part-time positions are available, working a minimum of three days per week - Monday to Friday with structured 9am-5pm working hours.

Role Overview:

  • Undertaking thorough face-to-face functional health assessments, reviewing medical evidence and writing subsequent detailed reports, enabling the DWP to make informed decisions about eligibility across a range of benefit types
  • Carrying out file-work and providing comprehensive reports for a broad range of clinical conditions
  • Participating in a local multidisciplinary team, in one of over 150 offices nationwide

Your Excellent Benefits Package:

  • Comprehensive training for initial 2 months with certification once accredited as a Functional Assessor
  • Excellent career growth and promotional opportunities
  • No nights, weekends or bank holidays, no on-call and structured working hours
  • GMC fee reimbursement and revalidation support
  • Contributory pension, cycle to work scheme and private medical insurance
  • Medical indemnity cover and protected CPD
  • 25 days annual leave plus option to buy more and sell back days

To be considered for this role, the minimum requirements are as follows:

  • Full registration with the GMC as a Medical Practitioner and a valid licence to practise
  • Minimum 2 years general medical experience (post FY1), working primarily in patient-focused roles dealing with a wide range of clinical conditions in the last 5 years
  • Eligibility to live and work in the UK (unfortunately no sponsorship opportunities are available)
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills and basic IT abilities (MS Word)

This is an excellent opportunity to work within a large and successful organisation. To apply, please upload your CV online, email sjb medical or call 020 7832 1980for further information.

title: German and French Teacher - ASAP Start
description:
MFL Teacher (German and French) –Chester – March 2021

Are you a passionate and experienced MFL Teacher?

Are you looking for a great new opportunity?

Academics North West are recruiting for an excellent school in Cheshire West and Chester who maintain a good quality of education and have a strong senior leadership team.

They are looking to appoint a MFL Teacher (German & French) to start ASAP on a part-time basis until the end of this who is able to teach German and French across KS3 and KS4.

This role would suit both an experienced Teacher and an NQT who have the passion and dedication to make an impact on their pupils by planning fun and engaging lessons so that pupils of all abilities are able to progress and achieve.

The successful applicant will need to have:

  • QTS or QTLS
  • Must have recent experience of teaching German and French to GCSE
  • Have a proactive and can do attitude
  • Be available to start ASAP

In return Academics can offer you

  • Excellent rates of pay (£95 - £150)
  • Your own dedicated consultant who will endeavour to meet all of your needs
  • Access to other roles
  • Free online CPD training

If you are a qualified MFL Teacher looking for a new role APPLY NOW!

All successful applicants are subject to a registration interview, List 99 Check, an Enhanced DBS check and 2 years’ worth of referencing.

description:

Support Worker - Supported Living

Job description
Have you been inspired during the ongoing pandemic by our national key worker heroes to consider a career in care? Then this could be the perfect opportunity for you.

Working in partnership with Inclusion Housing, Making Space Charity are proud to launch The Academy, a new supported living service in Warrington town centre.

The Scheme is based in a newly refurbished Warrington landmark building on Bridge Street and consists of 22 apartments providing supported independent living for people over the age of 18.

We are looking for support workers and waking night support workers to provide care and support to tenants living in their own apartments.

As an award winning care provider Making Space is seeking applicants who are able to provide tenants with the best possible care. We are looking for people who can demonstrate a natural caring nature, can listen well, communicate compassionately and at all times ensure care provided meets the needs and aspirations of people supported. You will become part of a brand new team who are on hand 24/7 to support tenants to live independently, and you will play a key role in establishing this exciting new service.
Salary: £8.87 per hour

Hours: Part time, full time and bank contracts are available. Day shifts are 7am – 10pm, night shifts are 10pm-7am and the service is open 7 days a week.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Provide the agreed level of support at the highest standard to tenants which could include personal care, check in visits, administering medication, daily living & domestic tasks and supporting with paying bills and correspondence.
  • Promote independence.
  • Maintain accurate administration and reporting records and ensure any changes and concerns are reported appropriately.
  • Encourage tenants to make use of communal areas.
  • Respond to tenants who use the staff call system.
  • Lone working.

About You:
  • Enthusiastic and outgoing with a larger than life personality
  • Have a positive outlook on life and a passion to care for others
  • Be creative and resourceful and able to think out of the box
  • Adaptable and versatile be able to work alone and within a team
  • Take pride in your work, exceptional attention to detail and reliability are essential.
  • Previous mental health experience and an NVQ level 3 in health and social care would be an advantage although not essential as a robust induction and continuous training will be provided.
  • Willing to work flexibly.
In Return:
We offer a comprehensive benefits package including
  • A stakeholder employer contribution pension scheme.
  • Career development, including professional qualifications and access to various training opportunities.
  • 28 days annual leave.
  • Ability to buy annual leave
  • Love 2 Shop Recognition & Reward Platform
  • Recognised external Cycle to Work scheme
  • Confidential Employee Assistance Programme

To Apply:
Please apply online or forward your CV to Recruitment@makingspace.co.uk quoting job requisition number R02098.

title: Bartender (Full and part time available)
description:
Bar Tender (full and part time)

Want to be involved in something new? We are opening an new outdoor bar in the Liverpool City Centre.

Based on Seel Street we are looking to provide the right environment for people to enjoy after being cooped up all year. At 50 seats we are going to be small but busy serving throughout the day until 12am (so not extra late finishes). We aim to be creative yet familiar having something for customers know what they like but ready to introduce people to something new.

We are looking for someone with passion for the industry. A good knowledge of spirits and cocktails with a keenness to learn more. A team player who can lead and use an eye for detail to keep on top of all the little things.

Cocktail experience will be preferred but not essential

Start will be early April aiming to open for the 12th April

title: Business Services Senior/ Client Manager ET54
description:
A highly reputable independent firm of Chartered Accountants in Warrington are seeking a Business Services Senior or Client Manager to join their growing team. Our client is flexible and part time will also be considered.

This is an exciting role where you would be working closely with one of the Partners, assisting with and ultimately managing a portfolio of clients. The role would suit a candidate who is ideally ACA/ ACCA Qualified (Part Qualified, AAT Qualified or QBE also considered) with a significant background in accountancy practice.

The successful individual will be proficient in the preparation of year end accounts, management accounts, tax compliance and ideally have experience of supervising junior staff. The ability to deal with ad hoc client queries is required and a good working knowledge of Xero is desirable.

Salary is dependent on experience and flexible/part time hours will be considered for the right individual.

The role can be seen in more detail below:

Responsibilities:

Managing a portfolio of clients
Accounts preparation for a mixture of sole traders, partnerships and limited companies
Preparation of management accounts
Resolution of client queries and provision of advice
Corporation tax computations
Review of VAT returns and bookkeeping
Personal Tax compliance
Reviewing the work of junior staff

Requirements:

ACCA/ ACA Qualified
Part Qualified/ AAT Qualified/ QBE also considered
Practice experience is essential

title: Primary School Tutor
description:
Connex Education are currently recruiting for Primary Intervention Tutors to work with primay ages pupils in Leigh, there are both full and part time roles available , working both 1-1 and in small groups with a variety of different children. Tutoring pays a vital role in allowing children to “catch up” and bridge the gap created by recent school closures. This role is open to anyone with experience in tutoring primary aged pupils and holds QTS. Completion of our mandatory Tutoring training is required before starting work.

This is an exciting role for any teacher to make a difference to a child’s life and see the impact 1-1 or small group tutoring can have on a child.

As a successful teacher you will possess.
– QTS or equivalent, and have recent experience in teaching and/or tutoring
– Good knowledge of the primary curriculum
– Be able to explain key concepts fluently and accurately
– Be prepared to tutor face to face and/or online depending on any local lockdowns/closures
– The ability to work to the school’s scheme of work and provide constructive and effective feedback
– Good time management to fully utilize the sessions

In return, Connex will offer you
– Full free training in Tutoring, SEN, Safeguarding and much more
– Competitive rates of pay
– Ongoing assignments
– A dedicated consultant to help to after all your needs
– A weekly PAYE scheme, including employer pension contributions, subject to minimum requirements

If you are interested in the role of Primary Tutor or would like to discuss any other opportunities, please do not hesitate to call the office on 01925 320420 or email me on warrington@connex-education.com

Connex Education is a high quality, service-led education supply agency which puts its people – not its profit – first. We concentrate on finding the right people, with the right skills and attitudes, for our schools. We hand-pick our staff, put them on our own payroll, and give them the same dedicated attention and support that we give our schools. Looking after people is central to our business: it’s what has earned us our excellent reputation.

title: Sales Assistant Part Time Tessuti
description:
Sales Assistant

Established in 1985 with a single store in Chester, Tessuti has since grown rapidly with stores opening across the United Kingdom, including iconic cities such as Liverpool, Manchester, Glasgow and Leeds. Tessuti is a modern premium fashion destination, housing over 100 men’s and women’s designer collections from established fashion houses and up-and-coming designers. Our curated selection of premium fashion brands is available both online and in-store.



Role Overview:

Being part of the team you will be responsible for ensuring our customers receive the best possible service each time they visit your store. You will assist in maximising store profitability by exceeding your sales targets and utilising the in-store devices while contributing to a successful store team.


Customer Service

  • Greet all customers in a warm, genuine and friendly manner.
  • Ensure that customers receive the best possible service every time that they enter the store.
  • Understand the process of the Customer Service measuring programme.

title: Part-time Staff Nurse or Paramedic (Police Custody)
description:
Company Description


Care & Custody – a Mitie Company are looking for highly skilled Nurses and Paramedics to join our existing Custody healthcare teams working with National Police Forces.

Care & Custody HCPs are RGNs or Paramedics who are qualified Healthcare Professionals working in partnership with 12 National Police Forces & 4 Sexual Assault Referal Centres, to pro-actively reduce re-offending and care for detainees in police custody. We are looking for exceptional people to join our teams where you can become a key member of a highly respected organisation.


Job Description


Health Care Professional

Registered General Nurse / Paramedic

£17,000 per annum

21 hours a week

Working in nursing, you will already have a passion for caring for others and achieve great satisfaction from seeing an unwell individual returning to health. In Care & Custody, that passion is of even greater importance to us: we care for some of the most vulnerable people in society who are taken into custody suites. Operating with a much higher level of autonomy and independence to the NHS, your actions can be life-saving when you consider the physical and mental challenges of people with who often have a high dependency on drugs and alcohol, and exhibit difficult behaviours.

Your impact on their lives should not be under-estimated: many of our staff are most proud of how their care and support, particularly with young people, can change the direction of their lives for the better. It’s not just about the highest clinical standards, but also your ability to listen, understand and help people: they will often open up to you, more than they would to a police officer, giving opportunity to identify root causes and connect them with relevant services that could truly help them.

You would be joining an HCP-Led mission that is growing nationally, as the market-leader in health care support for police services: and viewed as a front-line hero by the police and some of the detainees you bring back from the brink.

You will desire to work independently, in a fast-paced environment like in A & E ideally, where people look up to you and you’re in charge of the situation or the ambulance service however broad clinical experience in varied settings will also be considered. But you are not alone – joining a team of over 260 nationally, we pride ourselves on continuously raising our clinical standards, with development programmes accredited by Teesside University, including the opportunity to achieve The Faculty of Forensic and Legal Medicine’s Licentiate Award and / or PGCert in Advanced Nursing in Forensic Practice.

What’s involved:

  • Assessment & care of detainees and staff in custody suites.
  • Forensic sampling, including road traffic offence bloods.
  • Mental health and substance misuse assessments and management.
  • Providing substance misuse therapies whilst in custody.
  • Healthcare promotion, brief interventions & self-harm reduction.
  • Referrals and Signposting to support wider vulnerabilities the reduction of re-offending.
  • Working collaboratively with Liaison and Diversion colleagues to identify wider vulnerabilities.

You could be a good fit for this role if you:

  • Are a qualified Adult RGN or Paramedic with a real passion for developing your clinical and wider skills in an environment that is ever changing.
  • Have a minimum of 2 years post qualification experience as an Adult RGN or Paramedic with PIN
  • Have a flexible approach working within a team that encourage new ideas and opinions on how to improve the service.
  • Thrive working autonomously
  • Show initiative when it comes to handling a wide range of situations


Qualifications


Police Vetting Requirements

You must have:

  • Right to work in the UK
  • Continuously resided in the UK for the previous 3 years, with no more than 3 months spent overseas at any one time.
  • Full UK driving license.
  • Active PIN & full membership of the HCPC (Paramedic), or NMC (RGN) with no restriction on practice.
  • Flexibility to move across Custody Suites

Care & Custody, a Mitie company


Additional Information


As part of Mitie Group, and organisation with over 77,000 employees, there are opportunities to progress and learn to manage others with competitive salary (no enhancements), comparable to Band 6 nursing, with the option for overtime, salaries increase if you achieve Senior and Lead roles. You’ll join the MiDeals discount scheme with over 3000 offers available from your favourite retailers, leisure and utilities companies.

title: Shop Assistant/ Warehouse Operative
description:
We are looking to hire a hard-working, customer-oriented Shop Assistant/ warehouse operative to ensure the smooth running of in-store retail operations. The Shop Assistant’s responsibilities include welcoming customers to our shop, monitoring customer activities to prevent incidents of shoplifting, and processing customer refunds. You should also be able to identify customers' needs and recommend suitable shop items that best satisfy their needs.

To be successful as a Shop Assistant, you should be well-organized and adept at using pricing and labeling equipment. Ultimately, an outstanding Shop Assistant should demonstrate effective communication skills and achieve exceptional customer service at all times.
Shop Assistant Responsibilities:

  • Receiving, processing, and organizing shipments and deliveries accordingly.
  • Restocking depleted or low shop items and ensuring that the sales floor is organized according to established guidelines.
  • Assisting customers in locating desired shop items.
  • Informing customers of shop promotions to encourage purchases.
  • Performing regular price audits to identify and correct price discrepancies.
  • Performing end-of-day cleaning duties, which includes wiping down windows, mirrors, and fixtures as well as sweeping and mopping the shop floor.
  • Addressing and resolving customers' complaints in a professional manner.
  • Processing customer payments using the shop's Point of Sale (POS) system.
  • Maintaining an in-depth knowledge of store items to provide advice and recommendations as needed.

Shop Assistant Requirements:

  • Proven retail sales experience.
  • Sales focused
  • Excellent telephone manner
  • The ability to stand for extended periods.
  • The ability to use labeling and pricing equipment as well as Point of Sale (POS) software.
  • The ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong organizational skills.
  • Strong sales skills
  • Effective communication skills.
  • Exceptional customer service skills.
  • Detail-oriented.
  • Help maintain our inventory system adding and updating the product catalogue.
  • Knowledge of Horticulture or hydroponics industry. Growing of plants, gardening items
  • IT literate on Microsoft packages
  • Bonus skills - knowledge of inventory management, stock-taking system, online platforms such as Amazon and eBay, previous experience using systems such as Shipstation and WordPress

We are looking for both part-time (2-3 days a week Monday to Friday) and full-time candidates. Please send us a cover letter and CV to highlight why you are suitable for this role. We are looking for both part-time and full time workers

title: General Cover Teacher - Cheshire East
description:

Or are you a newly qualified teacher who is looking for your first role in a new school?

description:
Hospital
Ref: HUJ626

£27,000 p/a + Enhancements | FT or PT – Internal Rotation | Great Benefits | Surgical & Day Case Ward
A vacancy has arisen for an experienced RGN/Registered Adult Nurse with a background in acute ward nursing to join a leading Cheshire hospital.
The ward caters to predominantly elective surgical patients who have undergone cosmetic, orthopaedic and general surgical procedures.
What this Ward Nurse role will involve and what the hospital is offering:
  • A permanent contract of 37.5 hours per week, with shifts on an internal rotation (part-time hours will also be considered)
  • A competitive annual salary of £27,000, or the pro-rata equivalent for part-time hours

  • Free on-site parking
  • A range of training, development and career development opportunities
  • Childcare vouchers and cycle to work schemes

  • Free uniforms
  • A private pension scheme and life assurance
  • Staff assistance and support programmes
  • A range of programmes to support staff wellbeing, including company sick pay and private healthcare schemes
As Surgical Ward RGN, you will manage a patient caseload and will be responsible for ensuring the highest standards of patient care and safety through the effective planning, implementation and evaluation of patient care plans. You will demonstrate a commitment to ensuring the best possible customer service and patient experience.
The skills, experience, qualifications and qualities we are looking for in a Ward Nurse:
  • NMC registered Adult Nurse/RGN/RN1/RNA
  • Demonstrate current experience working in a surgical or acute ward nursing environment, ideally with orthopaedic/cosmetic/general experience

About Disability Confident
A Disability Confident employer will generally offer an interview to any applicant that declares they have a disability and meets the minimum criteria for the job as defined by the employer. It is important to note that in certain recruitment situations such as high-volume, seasonal and high-peak times, the employer may wish to limit the overall numbers of interviews offered to both disabled people and non-disabled people. For more details please go to Disability Confident.
