title: Student Teacher
description:
The role: Student Teacher / Newly Qualified Teacher
Location: St.Helens and surrounding area

As a Newly Qualified Teacher, or Student Teacher, we appreciate that you have so much drive, enthusiasm and an abundance of skills to offer in a busy learning environment; shaping up to be the most inspirational educators. So we want to help you out!


We are urgently looking for Primary Teachers / Student Teachers to working in St.Helens and surrounding area.

If you are a Student Teacher due to complete your final placement you can work for Tradewind as a Student Teacher / Teaching Assistant between now and the summer gaining valuable experience in a range of Primary Schools and get a head start for September!

As an NQT, you will no doubt be weighing up what type of teaching role you want and what / where your ideal setting will be. Would you prefer a small, rural primary school, or a large academy in a bustling city? Or a specialist SEN provision?

The beauty of registering with us is that you we can help you gain exposure to as many different settings and teaching roles as you like, helping to develop your experience and enhance your teaching skills - all whilst still being able to work towards your Induction whilst on supply / long-term positions.

So, can you complete your Induction whilst on supply?

Yes you can! You can complete your Induction over three terms in three different schools or should we be able to secure you a long-term position of a full academic year in one school, this will also enable you to complete your Induction. Only placements of one full term will count towards your Induction, and you need to complete the full time equivalent of one full academic year. For example, if you work part-time on supply then you will need to serve induction for two academic years.

CPD for NQTs

We have developed our CPD courses to help hone the necessary skills in the classroom you'll need as an NQT, such as:

Interview Techniques
How to plan a good lesson in accordance with OFSTED
Effective Questioning in the Classroom
Keeping Children Safe in Education (KCSIE) and Safeguarding
Supply Teaching Bible; for everyone new to supply
Creating Behaviour for Learning

Click 'Apply Now' to be considered for this great position as Student Teacher, or for more information about this or any other position, contact us on 0151 221 9666

Tradewind Recruitment is a Sunday Times Top 100 employer - stopping at nothing to ensure our candidates, clients and employees come first. At Tradewind you will have access to 35 fully certified CPD courses, that's 28 more than our next nearest competitor, all focused on making you the best you can be. We have the very best people available to take your call and look after you every step of the way. We pride ourselves on exceptional service and take the time to really get to know you. Put simply; we listen, we learn, we deliver. Why? Because our people matter most.

We specialise in matching Teachers and Support Staff to their dream job, and help Primary, Secondary and SEN schools recruit for a wide range of roles across our 11 offices in the UK, including: Liverpool, London, the West Midlands, the North West, East Anglia, the North East, the South West, Yorkshire, the Midlands, Herts and Bucks.

Awarded REC Audited Education gold standard - Tradewind Recruitment are committed to Safeguarding and are also a proud Equal Opportunities Employer.

title: Mobile Optometrist
description:
Need to know

Boots Opticians Chester, Foregate St are looking for a friendly and passionate Optometrist to join our team. If you are looking for part time, full time or flexibility on the weekends - we can tailor the role to suit your requirements & lifestyle.

You will have fantastic support from an experienced store and area leader and a great team of people to work with every day, supporting our loyal patient base.

Chester today is a diverse and vibrant town to explore and discover, with a range of quality national and independent shops, wonderful dining experiences and a unique history and heritage.

We are easily accessible by road, the main motorway that thinks to Chester are through the M6, M56 and M53. Public travel links are great, National Express coaches run frequently throughout the day and stop in the town centre. Chester rail station serves the town and is only a short walking distance to the store.

We would love to hear from you and discuss what is on offer - get in touch for a confidential chat!

Resourcing@boots-opticians.co.uk

About Boots

This is your chance to be part of something a bit different. You’ll use your outstanding qualifications and passion for your role to provide an exceptional level of care to our patients.

Our patients are also our customers and they are everything for Boots Opticians. Working with the Practice Manager, our Optical Teams and Clinical Governance Optometrists, you’ll create a culture where everyone is passionate about doing the right thing for them. Together these elements will play a big part in making us No 1 for Customer Care.

What you’ll be doing day to day.
  • Using your leadership skills and passion for your patients to inspire your colleagues to deliver a really memorable customer journey.
  • Bringing your vibrant personality into the day to day running of the practice – setting high standards to ensure everything runs professionally
  • Building firm and longstanding relationships – not only with colleagues and customers but with healthcare professionals in the local community
  • Listening to our customers – and provide the right, up to date information at all times
  • Selecting the best products for each customer
  • Ensuring that you effectively lead your team so that our customers receive an excellent service in a great environment
  • Ensuring that we uphold the highest possible standard of clinical care
What you’ll need to have.

You will need to be a fully qualified GOC registered Optometrist with additional registration with the relevant NHS body, but in addition to this we’re looking for really inspiring people, with a friendly professional personality. It’s all about working together as one great team – after all, it’s our people that are at the heart of our business.

It’s a fantastic opportunity to add to your own professional development, and a chance to learn more about us as a business. It could open up even more opportunities for you with Boots Opticians, as we believe we can offer you the best professional development in the business. But it isn’t just about experience, we’re interested in developing you a bit more, the real you – and that is what makes us all feel good.

What’s in it for you?

On offer is a generous salary, a competitive company pension scheme, excellent staff discount, 33 days including bank holidays with the option to buy more, discretionary bonus, along with having access to additional flexible benefits that allows you to create a package that suits your individual needs.

In addition, care and attention is paid to your personal and professional career development as a clinician, providing you with a range of interactive CET events throughout the year and genuine career opportunities across the business.

Please click on the following link to apply or if you would like a confidential chat or get in contact with us at resourcing@boots-opticians.co.uk, we would love to hear from you.

We offer a number of flexible working options to suit our colleagues needs including job share and part time working. Our website shows examples of colleagues enjoying different working patterns. If this interests you, please talk to us about it.

This role is subject to a DBS/PVG check, Boots is a Ban the Box employer and will consider the suitability of applicants with criminal convictions on a case-by-case basis. You will have the opportunity to discuss the matter with us before we make a decision.

title: Corporate Tax Manager ET146
description:
We have been instructed on a unique opportunity with a leading and highly reputable firm in Northwich who are seeking a Corporate Tax Manager to join their team.

This opportunity would suit a CTA or ACA qualified individual who is looking for career progression and the opportunity to develop and consolidate their advisory expertise.

You will manage a diverse portfolio of clients including OMB’s, PLC’s and UK subsidiaries of International companies. You will be responsible for answering any queries and assisting with the provision of bespoke tax advice to the firm’s clients.

You will review tax computations prepared by the accounts & audit department, manage client relationships, identify tax planning opportunities, manage WIP and provide training to more junior members of the team.

You will also have good experience of managing a team, reviewing their work, providing technical support to the Partners and supporting them on ad hoc projects.

This is a client facing role so you will be the first point of contact and be responsible for meeting new clients, building strong client relationships and growing the tax services offered by the firm.

The successful individual will be rewarded with a highly competitive salary, holiday entitlement, and an outstanding benefits package and a pathway to future parternship. Part time will be considered

title: Senior Family Solicitor
description:
Are you a senior family solicitor looking to take your next step and improve your work-life balance?

A small and friendly family boutique in South Manchester is looking for an experienced family lawyer to join their team. In this role, you will handle a quality caseload of complex financial matters, often on behalf of high net worth individuals. The firm is open to considering part-time hours for this position.

Senior Family Solicitor – South Manchester

The company & role

  • A specialist family law firm in South Manchester

  • The team is relatively small but incredibly well-respected

  • Their focus is almost exclusively on high-value divorce and associated ancillary relief and children matters.

  • Commutable from Manchester, Warrington, Wilmslow, Macclesfield, Tameside, High Peak

title: Cafe Assistant
description:
At Total Fitness, we are made of more. We provide more ways to get fit, stay in shape, and more support to keep our members focused. Our 17 health clubs across the North of England and Wales provide a full service fitness offering; guided by our knowledgeable and supportive fitness teams, we work hard to meet the individual needs of our members.

We began in 1993 with a strong belief that everyone is better fitter, and our belief is stronger than ever today. We know that true fitness needs variety to keep workouts fresh and engaging, that’s why our large health clubs offer a range of facilities to stay fit- extensive gym floors, three swimming pools, over 70 classes a week, indoor running tracks, ladies only gyms and family facilities. Variety provides our members a route to all-encompassing fitness that lasts longer than a one off spin class.

Over 600 staff, with support from our fitness partners, deliver our purpose daily to over 95,000 members.

We’re made of more, because you are.

Reporting to the Cafe Manager you will be making our members feel great by cooking and serving our tasty food and drinks and giving them your excellent service every day. We're currently looking to recruit for a 16 and an 18 hours per week positions.

What will I be doing?

  • Cooking and presenting our ‘Thrive’ food and drinks to specification every time and ensuring a fast service.
  • Keeping our kitchen and Cafe clean, tidy and presented to Thrive standards
  • Knowing food hygiene and health & safety standards and making sure me, my team members and members are always safe.
  • Keeping to the food hygiene standards, carrying out the necessary checks, maintaining accurate records and reporting any contraventions to the Cafe Manager immediately.
  • Keeping the deli filled up to Thrive Standards.
  • Using every opportunity to smile and talk to our members.
  • Working the till with speed, accuracy and efficiency.
  • Knowing our menu and encouraging members to try things.
  • Knowing the health benefits of our menu and being able to offer advice.
  • Checking back with members to make sure they are happy.
  • Focusing on energy conservation/cost reduction, particularly with gas and water.
  • Taking ownership to resolve member’s queries or complaints.
  • Sharing knowledge and expertise with team members.
  • Knowing our club and engaging with members about their activities.
  • Following the Thrive Ways of Working.

What qualifications, skills and experience do I need?

  • Basic Food Hygiene desirable.
  • Experience of preparing and handling food is preferred
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment.
  • Can show a genuine passion when engaging with individuals.
  • Strong listening and collaboration skills.
  • Team player.

In return we will offer you:

  • Training and development opportunities that will enable you to advance as far as your talent and determination will take you
  • Free gym membership with a plus one and 2 discounted memberships for family members or friends
  • Workplace pension scheme
  • Discount on retail and café products
  • 28 days holidays including public/bank holidays (pro-rata for part-time staff)

Job Type: Part-time

Licence/Certification:

  • DBS Application (preferred)

title: Registered Physiotherapist
description:
Introduction:

Ready to make a difference?


As a Physiotherapist are you looking to change lives for the better, including your own? At Maximus, we believe you can have a great worklife balance and continue to help others too.

We employ 3,800 staff, including over 1,400 doctors, nurses, physiotherapists and other healthcare professionals. Operating from more than 270 locations across England, Scotland and Wales, as well as having a global presence, Maximus is one of the largest providers of employment, health and disability support programmes in the country. Our businesses include the Centre for Health and Disability Assessments (CHDA) along with Remploy and Health Management.
Job Summary:
We’re looking for a HCPC Registered Physiotherapist with broad-based post-registration experience, who wants to do impactful work as part of a team, to help people move forward with their lives.

We offer an annual salary of £38,760 plus an attractive benefits package. Our Physiotherapists have the opportunity to move into the Extended Healthcare Practitioner role after 6 months with a salary increase to £40,800. There’s further progression opportunities into an Advanced Practitioner role too.

You’ll carry out assessments to understand how a person's disability or health condition affects their daily life. After each assessment, you’ll produce a factual report enabling the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) decision maker to determine a customer’s eligibility for benefits. You may also find yourself working on more complex cases with customers who have neurological conditions.

We know that having the right people does make the difference to our customers’ lives. That’s why we go to great lengths to ensure our colleagues feel valued and rewarded for the work they do as well as support their worklife balance.
Essential Job Duties:

As a Physiotherapist within our CHDA business, you’ll undertake a combination of file-work and face-to-face assessments in relation to a variety of benefits. These assessments will focus on how a disability affects day-to-day life in performing work-related activities, you’ll then utilise various IT platforms to support you in the clinical decision-making and produce a written report for the DWP.

  • Undertake a combination of file-work and face-to-face assessments in relation to a variety of benefits and provide a report to the DWP.
  • Use IT software programmes to support clinical decision making when undertaking file-work and examinations.
  • Provide comprehensive reports to enable decision makers at DWP to make informed decisions regarding benefit claims.
  • Ensure that professional practice standards and “best practice” are maintained in all areas of work.
  • Analyse and interpret clinical information and medical evidence and provide a professional and concise report.
  • Work as part of a multidisciplinary team and build positive working relationships with both medical colleagues and administrative support staff.
  • Apply professional skills and manage own professional competence and accountability, in accordance with the HCPC Code of Conduct.
Education and Experience Requirements:

Our Physiotherapists play a pivotal role in supporting our customers to move forward with their lives, so we’ll support you through a formal training programme to enable you to carry out quality, sensitive and respectful functional assessments.

You’ll be a HCPC Registered Physiotherapist with a recent broad-based post-registration experience. You will need to be comfortable working to targets, open to feedback and have good IT skills along with having excellent communication skills, both oral and written, as well as being confident in working with a wide range of customers and the ability to handle challenging situations.

We are looking for Physiotherapists who are keen to learn and take a proactive approach. Previous experience of functional or disability assessment is desirable but not essential.

Due to COVID 19 all our Physiotherapists are currently undertaking telephone assessments until we can resume face-to-face assessments.

CHDA Statement: Maximus is committed to developing, maintaining and supporting a culture of equality and diversity in employment in which our employees as well as candidates for employment are treated equitably. We understand that a diverse workforce adds to our competitive advantage; and as such, we aim to ensure that job applicants do not receive less favourable treatment on the grounds of sex, race, marital status, disability, age, part-time or fixed term contract status, sexual orientation or religion, or are disadvantaged by conditions or requirements that cannot be shown to be justifiable. Advertisements for posts will include sufficiently clear and accurate information to enable potential applicants to assess their own suitability for the post. Where reasonable, we will review and consider adjustments for those applicants who express a requirement for them during the recruitment process.

title: Support Worker - Full time & Part time - Liverpool City Centre
description:
The Phoenix Foundation is an independent charity committed to supporting homeless people in Liverpool. Unlike other homeless services in Liverpool, we are completely self-funded. We house 25 homeless people in their own rooms and we assess their needs and support them every step of the way to ultimately be able to leave the shelter to lead an independent life, clean of any addiction, and ready to take on employment and live in their own property.

We are helped to deliver our services by a dedicated team of skilled support and outreach workers and, of course, our volunteers whose support is invaluable in assisting us to provide an excellent service.

The aims and objectives of the Phoenix Foundation are as follows:

  • To provide each resident with their own private accommodation.
  • To create tailored plans for each individual on a case by case basis rather than one size fits all.
  • To work towards eradicating homeless in Liverpool by working with other partners and organisations.
  • To create a community within the shelter where the residents socialise, support and assist each other and form friendships.
  • To undertake outreach at street level to be aware of individuals in need and to assist and signpost as and when necessary.
  • To always treat each individual with dignity, respect and with acceptance of their need.

The post holder will provide:

  • A flexible approach and be available to work weekends and evenings to support activities within Phoenix Foundation on a rota system. To work and seek flexibly to allow for direct service provision / organisational duties including early morning, evening, bank holiday, weekend, and Christmas/New Year.
  • Support to people to enable them to maintain their tenancies and to achieve sobriety, employment and/or training and their aspirations for independent living. Depending upon the residents need, the support provided may be to people with physical or sensory disabilities or people with addiction issues or people mental health related support needs or a combination of these.
  • A person-centred approach to everyone.
  • Enrichment activities.

Visit our website for details - www.phoenixfoundation.co.uk/joinus

title: Advanced Nurse Practitioner Role, Part-Time near Flint
description:
An excellent part-time opportunity has opened for an Advanced Nurse Practitioner near the town of Flint in Flintshire.
This is the ideal opportunity for an Advanced Nurse Practitioner that is looking to join a friendly practice in Flintshire for 3 days a week. Situated off the A55, this is the perfect location for those coming from Chester and the surrounding areas.
The practice is very well organised with an extensive managerial and secretarial structure in place to ensure that your clinics are efficient and focussed on patient care. There is a small patient population of around 10,000 which is cared for by the 5-Partner strong GP team and Nursing team, making for a very well managed workload.
The practice prides itself on the happiness of its staff and patients alike. It is a training practice that seeks to maintain excellent standards in all of its clinicians. Outside of work, the team is very social and enjoys making time for activities together. If you are an experienced ANP then please read on and see if this is the role for you.


Key Duties

  • As one of two ANPs in the practice, you will be running minor illness/injury clinics and assisting in the assessment of elderly patients in their homes.
  • 3 days per week available
  • Minor illness clinic
  • Autonomous working
  • Home visits
  • Elderly patient assessments
  • No Out Of Hours


Package and Benefits
There is an excellent package on offer in return for your commitment to the practice:

  • Circa £45,000 (pro rata)
  • 3 days a week to begin with, possibility to extend in the future
  • 30 days holiday/6 weeks, plus Bank Holidays too
  • Private healthcare enrolment for all staff
  • Parking on-site
  • Situated off the A55, very well placed for Chester and the surrounding areas


Key Skills, Qualifications and Client Requirements
The successful candidate will:

  • Have MSc in Advanced Practice
  • Be an Independent Prescriber
  • Be comfortable working autonomously, though responsible to the Lead Nurse
  • Have experience in Primary Care and/or Out Of Hour work
  • Be comfortable assisting in home visits


What Happens Next?
If you wish to find out more please click the 'Apply' button. This will send a notification to the consultant looking after this vacancy who will get in touch at a suitable time to share further details on this opportunity.


Any communication will be in complete confidence, without obligation and we will NOT send your details to any practice unless you give us your permission, so there is nothing to lose in finding out more.


Alternatively, if you wish to talk to us directly about this opportunity or any other suitable positions, please email us at gp@prospect-health.com or call our General Practice Team on 01423 813454


Please attach a copy of your most up to date CV to any emails sent for ease.

title: Male Senior Support Worker
description:
Are you looking for a rewarding role in care?

We’re currently recruiting for a Male Senior Support Worker in Wrexham to provide person centred support for our service users in a supported living accommodation.

The purpose of this role is to provide support to 3 individuals that live in their home with 24 hour support. Individuals have learning disabilities that require them to be supported by staff for aspects of their daily life. This includes practical and emotional support, assisting individuals to carry out everyday living tasks such as cooking, shopping to enable them to live safely and as independently as possible.

  • Access the community
  • attend social activities
  • Maintain their home / tenancy
  • Personal care
  • Meal preparation
  • Promote independence where possible.

More specifically as Senior Staff you would be required to deal with staff rotas, supervisions and to make sure the person centred support is adhered at all times. Apart from that you will also be responsible for staff holiday requests and keep a holiday record for staff, to keep a training matrix up to date and inform staff and office when training is required, to keep on top of medication ordering and any other appointments our clients have.

  • Develop and maintain support plans and risk assessments
  • Manage a small team of staff with support of coordinator
  • Attend meetings with multi-disciplinary teams

Previous experience working with people with disabilities and challenging behaviour is desirable. Full time hours including days and evenings and every other weekend. The ideal candidate would also be a driver.

NVQ Level 3 in Health & Social care is required or Level 2 but must be willing to sign up for Level 3; we are open to passionate candidates who share the same commitment and values as ourselves. Full training is available and we will continuously provide the training and support you need to succeed and grow.

What we can offer:

-Access to our Industry leading Training and Development programme including NVQ’s and QCF’s as standard
-Flexible full or part time Permanent Contracted Hours to suit you
-Competitive rates of pay (inc hourly paid sleeping nights)
-Weekly Pay

-An experienced, supportive and hands on management team who genuinely understands your role and the needs of our service users.

Our Support Workers perform exceptional value of care to the people we support in their own homes to live the lives they choose by supporting them with their everyday life. We are looking for Support Workers who are outgoing, have an enthusiastic and passionate approach to support.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Take an active approach in the service users rehabilitation programs
  • Support with planning and organising daily/weekly and monthly activities
  • Promoting the service user’s independence
  • Working closely with other support staff
  • To identify and accurately communicate and record any observed changes
  • Support and assisting with personal care needs.
  • Administering Medication

If this sounds like the role you are looking for and you would like to join our team in providing first class support and interested in making a real and positive difference in people's lives then we're keen to talk to you.

title: Maths Tutor
description:
Are you passionate about reaching out to students who are disengaged from their education due to SEMH difficulties? Do you enjoy independence over your working hours and lesson planning?

Here at SEND Recruitment, we are seeking qualified teachers (QTS) to inspire hard-to-reach children through our Specialist SEND Tutoring service. Utilising a bespoke curriculum, our team of tutors create fun and engaging lesson plans around the child and their interests to guide these students back into education.

These particular students are looked after children (LACs) in Y11 with significant gaps in their learning. Tutoring will be focused on exam prep/past papers and identifying the gaps in their knowledge.

Experience working with SEMH/SEND students will come as an advantage to applicants, but resilience, passion and flexibility comes as a must.

Those successful will benefit from a subscription to Twinkl online teaching resources, as well as flexibility over their working hours.

All candidates are subject to a face to face interview, references to cover the last two years and a full enhanced DBS on the update service.

For more information about this role or any other roles supporting SEND in schools please contact a member of our specialist SEND team at 01925 906 500 or send in a CV.

title: Night Nurse - RGN or RMN - Nursing Home
description:
Night Nurse - RGN or RMN - Elderly and Dementia Nursing Home - St Helens - Up to £18 per hour

Working Hours: Full-time or Part-time

We are recruiting for a Night Nurse (RGN or RMN) for a permanent opportunity in a Nursing Home in St Helens. The home is part of one of the county's leading providers of nursing homes and they are looking for a passionate and dedicated individual to join their existing team.

The Nursing Home provides specialist nursing care for up to 40 older people. The home is part of Britain's largest social care charities, which was voted Charity of the Year 2019 at Charity Times Awards.

The Nursing Home is committed to delivering the highest possible standards of care to its residents, including nursing, dementia, residential and respite care. The staff takes pride in supporting each resident to enable them to live fulfilled lives.

Benefits of this Night Nurse (RGN or RMN) role include:

  • Fantastic pay rate up to £18 per hour
  • Relevant training and development
  • Access to local public transport facilities
  • Generous pension scheme
  • Free DBS and uniform
  • 28 days holiday

As a Night Nurse (RGN or RMN), you will be responsible for:

  • Ensuring optimum client care is maintained by managing patient care plans and risk assessments
  • Providing a highest standard of quality care of patients
  • Promote and maintain high standards of clinical practice
  • To assess, plan, deliver and evaluate resident care to achieve the highest standards of contemporary care

Essential requirements of this Night Nurse (RGN or RMN) role include:

  • A RGN or RMN qualification
  • Current registration with the NMC and a legal right to work in the UK
  • The ability to use your skills to develop care plans and risk assessments

For more information please email hcpapplications@liquidpersonnel.com

title: Supervising Social Worker in Chester
description:
We have an opportunity for an experienced, energetic and self-motivated Supervising Social worker who is passionate about meeting the needs of children within a family setting, to join our innovative team. We are looking to recruit a full time Supervising Social Worker to cover maternity leave on the Connected Peoples Fostering Team.

As a Supervising Social Worker on the Connected Peoples Team, you will safeguard and promote the welfare of Cheshire West and Chester’s Children by delivering a high quality service, keeping Children’s wellbeing and safety at the heart of your approach.
The Connected Peoples Team undertake detailed assessments and provide support to family and friends carers who are applying to look after children known to them including Special Guardians.
The majority of the work is Court directed and you will be required to have a sound understanding of Court processes, care proceedings work and permanence options for children.
As a Supervising Social Worker on the Connected Peoples Team you will be involved in undertaking assessments that are robust and completed in a timely manner which may entail out of county travel and overnight stays.
The post requires a Social Work qualification, extensive knowledge of legislation underpinning delivery of social care including fostering regulations and standards.

You must have:
A professional qualification in social work and experience of working with Children's, in particular previous experience of Assessment work
Social Work England registration.
Post qualified experience.
Enhanced DBS/Update service.
References required for the last 5 years of employment.

Free on-going training opportunities upon registering as part of our commitment to you.
Competitive Rates of pay
In house payroll, providing weekly payments and support
Enhanced DBS completed.
Support and expert advice from an approachable, dedicated and friendly team
An assigned dedicated & experienced consultant
Various employment opportunities in your preferred geographical area
Flexible hours to meet your needs, full or part time
Recommend a friend bonus scheme
“Find your own job” bonus – get £250 for bringing your own position to us *

title: Adult Social Care Lawyer
description:
Are you an Adult Social Care Lawyer who would be interested in joining a well-resourced and Lexcel accredited legal team? This could be for you!

As an Adult Social Care Lawyer, you will be responsible for:

  • Providing advice on and the conduct of cases involving adult social services issues including general advice to the client department in respect of their obligations under the Care Act 2014
  • Dealing with matters arising under the Mental Capacity Act 2005 and managing Adults Social Care cases including:
    • Deprivation of liberty safeguards and Court of Protection cases
    • Displacement of nearest relative
    • Ordinary residence
    • Responding to letters before claim
    • Coroners Inquests

Although Local Authority experience is desirable, my client is happy to consider those who are more junior or from a Private Practice background.

Whether you are seeking full time or part time, my client is happy to be flexible. This will be over a 3 month initial contract with the likelihood of extension thereafter, completely remote. So if you are knowledgeable within this field then please do get in touch!

title: Physics and Engineering Teacher
description:
BioGrad Examination Centre are looking for an enthusiastic Physics and Engineering Teacher to join their expanding team.

As a Physics and Engineering Teacher you will be responsible for developing and engineering Physics practicals and the upkeep of all equipment. You will test course equipment and troubleshoot any problems to ensure that the practicals are fit for purpose and are adequate for students. You will also be involved in the physics/engineering aspects of end point assessments and complete all student assessments in line with the relevant qualification body guidelines.

About BioGrad Exam Centre

BioGrad Examination Centre work in partnership with examination centres across to the UK, assessing scientific based practical examinations as well as providing training to PGCE science teachers in the management and implementation of practicals.

Job Specification

Qualifications, Training & Knowledge

BSc in any of Physics, Engineering or similar, or a relevant science teaching degree -Essential - Application / Interview

PGCE or equivalent, and QTS - Essential - Application / Interview

A Level Practical Endorsement Certification Desirable - Application / Interview

MSc or PhD in a relevant science subject - Desirable - Application / Interview

Experience

A minimum of 2 years’ experience in teaching Science subjects at KS5 level - Essential - Application / Interview

Experience of working with laboratory equipment - Essential - Application / Interview

Experience of working with SEN students and adapting lessons to their need - Essential - Application / Interview

Experience of managing a laboratory - Desirable - Application / Interview

Experience of leading a team and manging their professional development - Desirable - Application / Interview

Experience of assessing A level Science practicals - Desirable - Application / Interview

Experience of working in a multi-cultural setting - Desirable - Application / Interview

Experience of writing risk assessments - Desirable - Application / Interview

Skills & Behaviours

Strong communication skills with proven ability to use them to convey complex information to students and colleagues - Essential - Application / Interview

Well-developed organisational skills with the ability to coordinate a team, ensuring appropriate cover is provided - Essential - Application / Interview

Ability to take initiative and work without supervision - Essential - Application / Interview

Confidence in making decisions - Essential - Application / Interview

Ability to review documentation and make amendments appropriately within set guidelines - Essential - Application / Interview

Ability to analyse and solve problems - Essential - Application / Interview

Ability to work calmly under pressure, and adapt readily to changing circumstances - Essential - Application / Interview

Able to work efficiently and co-operatively as part of a team - Essential - Application / Interview

Strong negotiation skills, with ability to reach agreements - Essential - Application / Interview

Circumstances

0.6 to 1.0 FTE - Essential - Application / Interview

The post requires a flexible approach and willingness to carry out working hours across set teaching schedules (working bank holidays) - Essential - Application / Interview

title: Reservationist
description:
Our Restaurant teams are made up of talented individuals.

We are very proud of Moor Hall and the team we have assembled to support it, led by chef patron Mark Birchall.

Key Skills

We are looking for a strong, motivated part-time Reservationist, someone who has worked in a similar role within the hospitality industry. The person will be a team player who is an avid learner, adaptable and has exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.

Other skills that will need to be demonstrated include:

  • Strong customer care skills
  • Good computer literacy skills
  • Ability to work under pressure
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • A high standard of personal presentation
  • Confident, professional and welcoming personality
  • Ability to deal with high profile clients in a professional manner
  • Fluent in English

Day to day

As a Reservationist you will be responsible for dealing with incoming reservations by telephone, email and in person for both Moor Hall Restaurant, The Barn Restaurant and our Guest Bedrooms. You will be involved in welcoming restaurant guests as well as checking in and checking out our guests and escorting them to their rooms.

You will be dealing with guests queries and be required to compile accurate reservation information for the restaurant and kitchen. You will be responsible for taking and balancing payments and using our online booking systems.

This role is part-time, 25 hours a week.

Benefits

Salary package of £11,583 annually, additional service charge bonus, summer and winter closure holidays, Christmas closure holidays, staff discount, meals provided, company pension contribution.

title: Sales Assistants
description:
We are currently seeking two pro-active, results driven Sales Assistants to join the team in our Wrexham store offering 8 hour contracts. If you’d love to be part of a high performing team who provide world-class service then we'd love to have you join us.

THE ROLE

We are currently recruiting for two part time Sales Assistant to work 8 hours per week. Sales Assistants work on a rotational shift-basis, including weekends and Bank Holidays

Our Sales Assistants are our brand ambassadors, and the essential link between our products and our customers. Coached by the store management, our Sales Assistants lead the success of the store by influencing sales, excelling in customer service, and sharing their knowledge of the product and brand. The store teams shape the look, feel, and atmosphere of their store. Our stores are often very busy, so really enjoying a fast-paced, sometimes high-pressured sales floor environment is essential.
Our store teams must demonstrate the ability to apply our Company values of Pride, Passion and Performance to their position. They are expected to use the values to help the business reach its vision, in accordance with the strategy.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Influence and increase sales in a one to one selling environment
  • Achieve and exceed individual and store sales targets by using effective selling skills; focusing on up-selling, UPT, ATV and productivity
  • Build the bond between our brand and our customer, by answering queries, providing exemplary service and adapting your approach depending on individuals personalities and needs
  • Learn and confidently share PANDORA product knowledge to maximise sales and provide an unforgettable customer experience. This includes the PANDORA history, production process, our Company values, product composition, trends and best sellers
  • Encourage customer loyalty - discussing upcoming collection launches, obtaining customer data by offering e-receipts
  • Assisting with product and POS deliveries; unloading and storing in the correct spaces in store
  • Complete PANDORA online training modules, to develop yourself and flourish as PANDORA team member, with the support of your Store Manager
  • Lead by example; coach and train newer members of the team
  • Be a brand and store ambassador by maintaining a stylish and well-presented appearance
  • Merchandising the store and maintaining high shop floor standards; taking pride in your environment
  • Operating the till system, handling financial transactions including returns and exchanges
  • Always being alert while on the shop floor and following company security policies and procedures, to keep the wider team and customers safe

THE INDIVIDUAL

We look for passionate and motivated team players. We encourage our team members to express their individuality by styling PANDORA jewellery in their own way, and sharing these ideas with our customers. This means that a love for our product is vital.

Ideal candidates will have:
  • Strong selling skills, with experience in a luxury environment with 1-1 sales experience preferable
  • Excellent communicator – Sales Assistants needs to initiate contact and communicate confidently, so articulate spoken English is essential
  • Ability to work well under pressure, in a fast-paced, sales driven atmosphere – our stores are often very busy, with long queues of customers waiting to be served
  • A positive, “can-do” attitude, an individual who enjoys as working as one part of a successful team
  • Customer focused
  • Flexible approach; Sales Assistants work on a rotational shift-basis, including weekends and Bank Holidays

THE REWARD

Our people are an integral part of our success. Our commitment to unforgettable career progression is just the start. We offer a competitive rewards package that is second to none.

Our generous benefits package including;
  • A highly competitive salary and bonus potential
  • Generous 55% employee discount on all Pandora product
  • Winniperks - our personalised online benefits platform
  • Company pension scheme
  • Parties and incentives throughout the year

If you are looking for a new challenge and feel you have the relevant experience then we’d love to hear from you!

title: Hire Controller Warrington
description:
We are looking to recruit a passionate, motivated and focused individual, for the role of Hire Controller to provide effective support and service to our Key Customer based in Haydock.

Contract type: Permanent
Working Hours: Part Time 18 hours (2 days per week - Mon & Tue)

Nixon Hire Overview

Established 52 years ago, Nixon Hire is a UK leader in the provision of construction equipment. Our core product offering includes plant, accommodation, welfare facilities, toilets and modular buildings.

With over 24,000 assets and 300 product lines, we supply products and services to commercial and domestic customers. Nixon Hire operate from Depot locations nationwide, from which our products are prepared and dispatched for hire or for sale and are refurbished or configured as required.

Job Role

This position is based in the Customers premises and although this position will not be based in Nixon Hire premises the support and communication network will be constant. As a Major Account Coordinator, your main responsibility will be to provide an efficient and effective service to a Key Account.

Someone who has prior knowledge of the Hire industry is desired, however full training will be given to the successful candidate.

The main responsibilities of this position are:

  • Receiving order and request for collections / off hires
  • Dealing with enquiries and converting them into hires
  • Liaising with the Depot Network to ensure orders are fulfilled efficiently
  • Providing Quotations
  • Develop Relationships with the Key Customer
  • Dealing with damages, calculating costs, liaising with customers regarding damages and ensuring payment is received

The core skill requirements of this role are:

  • A professional manner with good communication and people skills
  • Strong Customer Service Experience
  • PC literate with experience of Microsoft Systems
  • Ability to prioritise work load and work to tight deadlines
  • Motivated self-starter with good administration, time management and organisation skills

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Workplace pension
  • 23 days holiday plus 8 Bank Holidays on starting

To apply please send your CV to hr@nixonhire.com

title: Part Time Sales Assistant
description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a part time sales assistant to join our team at Geoffrey and Joy Children's Footwear and Clothing Boutique in Tarleton.

We are looking for an enthusiastic individual with excellent people skills and experience in retail sales, with a proven track record of boosting sales through personal initiative.* Training in shoe fitting will be given; prior experience in this would be beneficial but not essential. Experience with working with children is also preferred. The most important aspect of our business is excellent customer service*, and having the ability to build a great rapport with customers, providing a personalised and memorable experience to every customer is crucial. We have an on-line shop and therefore excellent computer skills are necessary to enable the website to be updated and stock control to be managed - training will be provided.

The successful applicant will be offered a minimum of 16 hours per week , however this will increase during busier periods, such as school holidays and also when covering other staff member's holidays and staff illness.

Therefore, the applicant must be flexible and able to work Saturdays and school holidays. As the Summer school holiday period is our busiest time, holidays are not permitted to be taken during this period (special events or occasions may be permitted). Please do not apply if this does not fit in with your personal circumstances.

Duties include, but are not limited to:

  • the day to day running of the shop
  • stock control
  • merchandising - rotating stock regularly and adapting displays to suit the weather or outside events
  • dealing with customer queries and complaints
  • website and social media updates and maintenance
  • dealing with brand representatives overall queries
  • end of day duties, including cashing up and closing down the shop
  • Providing ideas and initiatives to boost sales and on-line sales

About our shop:

We are an independent store opened in August 2017, offering a large selection of quality footwear and designer clothing brands for all occasions, specialising in providing an expert shoe fitting service and excellent customer service.

Our aim is to provide a one-stop , stress free and enjoyable shopping experience for parents with children, offering a play area, baby changing and toilet facilities as well as a fantastic loyalty scheme.

Please send your CV and covering letter (detailing your relevant experience) through Indeed.

Application deadline: 28/03/2021

Expected start date: 05/04/2021

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

Salary: Up to £8.91 per hour

  • Are you able to commit to a minimum of 16 hours per week, including Saturdays, during term time and increase up to 26-30 hours during holiday periods?

title: Veterinary Nurse
description:
Pets and people at the heart of what we do.

About the Role:

We are looking to recruit a Qualified Veterinary Nurse (VN) who will provide a high standard of customer service and clinical care whilst promoting pet wellbeing, supporting Veterinary Surgeons to deliver preventive services and to treat sick and injured pets of eligible clients.

Working as part of a team that supports in theatre, provides inpatient care and carries out consults, admissions and discharges, our Veterinary Nurses are also involved in dispensing medication, encouraging financial contributions from clients and maintaining the hygiene and cleanliness of the hospital and equipment.

Depending on the needs of the hospital we have Veterinary Nurses working both full and part time hours, with opportunities for career progression at PDSA for the right candidate.

We are happy to discuss hours of work as we have a variety available.

We also offer great benefits which include (pro-rata for part-time roles):

  • Allocated CPD funding of 15 hours
  • Opportunity to perform Schedule 3 surgery with full training and support encouraged
  • Excellent career opportunities/development
  • 37.5hr working week
  • 5 weeks holiday per year
  • Paid bank holidays
  • Life assurance 4 x annual salary
  • Contributory pension scheme

Our Kirkdale Pet Hospital is bright and modern with fully equipped with state of the art facilities. This comes complete with a happy and hardworking team with a passion for pet welfare. VSs typically work 1 full weekend in 10 (Saturday 9am-6.30pm and Sunday 8.30am - 6pm). Time in lieu and a shift allowance is given for weekend working. VNs work the same hours at the weekend but on a 1 in 9 basis.

About You:

The successful candidate will be a Qualified RCVS Registered Veterinary Nurse, expected to keep your professional knowledge updated by taking part in continuous professional development and will be committed to the vision and mission of PDSA.

The closing date for this vacancy may be brought forward should we receive sufficient candidates.

  • Please note that this vacancy has an extended closing date so we may not be able to respond to you as promptly as we normally would. We will be in touch ASAP, thank you for your patience.

About PDSA:

As the UK’s leading veterinary charity, with 48 Pet Hospitals, we strive to improve pets’ lives – through prevention, education and treatment. Every year our dedicated vet teams carry out 2.7 million treatments on 470,000 pets. Our national network of around 120 high street shops help us to provide these treatments through selling both donated and new goods.

We believe that we work better together, so everyone from our vets, volunteers, shop teams and to our office support colleagues – we are driven in our dedication and passionate about pets. Join us and help improve the lives of every pet.


PDSA is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, adults at risk and all our colleagues and expect everyone who works for us to also share this commitment and to treat people with courtesy and respect.

To support this commitment, our recruitment & selection processes are robust and rigorous and all appointments will be subject to satisfactory references and appropriate background checks

We are proud to be one of the Sunday Times 100 Best Not-For-Profit Organisations. Our fantastic people have a genuine affinity with our cause which empowers them to make a positive difference to the world we live in every single day! Join the team and find out what it’s like to be in the Top 100!

title: Secondary School Teaching Assistant
description:
Are you enthusiastic about working as a Teaching Assistant in a secondary school? Do you have the experience we're looking for? Then please consider an application toRandstad Education!

We currently require Teaching Assistants to join our books to undertake supply booking in a Mainstream Secondary school in the Sefton area. The role will be full time, term-time only; Monday to Friday and is a great opportunity to work as part of a committed department. The role will involve supporting learners with their educational needs.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Working with students on a 1-1 basis to support them with their educational needs
  • Support the class Teacher.
  • Keep students on task.


BENEFITS

Our staff have a well-deserved reputation as being the best in Merseyside and as a reward for your hard work and commitment you will benefit from:

  • a dedicated, professional and friendly consultant and a branch with 24 hour on-call facility
  • competitive rates of pay paid weekly, which are fully compliant under the Agency Workers Regulations (AWR, 2011)
  • commitment to your continuing professional development through free training including safeguarding
  • being part of a highly respected supply team and developing your own reputation within it, especially through various rewards like 'Candidate of the Term'
  • 'recommend a friend' bonus worth up to £300

REQUIREMENTS

As the successful Teaching Assistant candidate you will have:

  • Level 2 or higher Teaching assistant Qualification or equivalent
  • Experience of MLD (moderate learning difficulties)
  • Experience in delivering Literacy interventions and reading comprehensions
  • A strong knowledge of working 1:1 Pupils in a mainstream setting
  • Excellent behaviour management skills
  • A strong work ethic and a professional attitude

ABOUT US

Randstad Education is the UK market leader for recruitment within education. We have been helping teachers and support staff to find temporary and permanent roles in schools, colleges and nurseries for nearly twenty years. Working with over 2500 schools each week, our staff support over 135,000 children every day across the country, so we can find the right match for your skills. The Liverpool branch is one of the oldest and busiest in the country and has a dedicated team of consultants working across primary, secondary and SEN. We now also have a dedicated section looking after school support roles such as technicians, administration and finance.


WHAT NEXT?

We are proud to support a diverse portfolio of schools across Merseyside, so even if this job or location is not suitable, we would still like to hear from you regarding your relevant experience, as we may have other roles available in schools, temporary or permanent, short-or long-term, full or part-time, which may be a better match.

If your application is deemed suitable for this position a telephone interview will be offered immediately, instead of the normal face to face meeting, to observe current social distancing measures. Documents will be submitted and checked online and our consultants will guide you through how to do this. All candidates will be required to undergo child protection and UK eligibility checks, and be subject to an enhanced DBS check. Randstad Education is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and require all applicants to share this commitment.

To discuss this in more detail, please contact Heidi McGreary, your specialist secondary consultant via email on heidi.mcgreary@randstadeducation.co.uk, call our Liverpool branch on 0151 255 1666.

If this sounds like the opportunity for you, please Apply Online Now!

title: Support Worker (RM)
description:
We are currently recruiting for a 1-2-1 support worker that will include working with a male in the Mold area.

To apply for this role you must be

· Animal friendly

· Driver (to obtain business insurance)

· Non-smoker/vaper

Preferable:

· Similar interests - all sports but in particular football

· Enjoys watching sports

· Enjoys days out to National Trust places

Hours required:

Three days weekly; ideally Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday but can be flexible.

Ability to offer overnight support.

It is possible that at some point in the future there may be additional hours, although this is not yet confirmed.

Training that is required of Support Workers:

· As per the Care Certificate:

Duty of care, Work in a person-centred way, Communication, Privacy and dignity, Awareness of mental health, Safeguarding adults, Basic life support, Health and safety, Handling information.

· Additional training:

Brain injury, Food hygiene, Fire awareness, Capacity and consent

Client information and summary of difficulties

My client is a 29-year-old gentleman, who was involved in a road traffic accident . He suffered physical injuries down his left side as well as a brain injury.

There is no personal care required as he is able to manage this himself but would benefit from assistance with domestic tasks as mentioned previously.

The role of the support worker would be to engage with my client in a structured programme of activities in the home and in the community in the following areas;

· Assisting with developing routine and promoting a balance of activities. Planning weekly/daily activities, encouraging use of planners and strategies to assist planning.

· Assisting to identify leisure activities and plan them into the week. Encouraging and supporting plans to be carried out.

· To support and prompt my client to utilise rehabilitation tasks, systems and strategies as directed by professionals involved.

Are you who we are looking for?

A career in health and social care offers instant job satisfaction and rewarding experiences everyday by improving the quality of life of those individuals in your care. There is nothing more fulfilling than being the reason why someone smiled today because you helped them take one step closer to reaching their personal goals.

Candidates must be able to demonstrate that they have the 5R’s:

u Respectful – ensure that the service user is treated in a polite, considerate, and professional manner with respect given to their dignity and privacy

u Reliable - there may be a need to fulfil “sleep-in” duties and a flexible approach to working times

u Responsible – you will be responsible for ensuring you undertake the required training to fulfil your role effectively and the health and safety of those under your care.

u Reactive - the ability to deliver support to service users in response to their needs and wishes, if necessary, this may be refining support daily

u Role Model – the ability to form effective relationships with service users and act as a positive role model

Why are we the right choice for you?

· We embrace the diversity of our clients; no two circumstances are the same and therefore you can fulfil a normal of roles in a range of different adult and child services.

· We want you to feel safe and confident in your role, so we offer a free comprehensive training package which includes both face-to-face and online training.

· We offer flexibility. You choose when and how many hours you work each week.

· Tired of a long recruitment process? We aim to turnaround our recruitment process from the initial interview to completing compliance checks within two weeks so you can start straight away.

· We pay competitive rates and on a weekly basis.

· Take advantage of our referral scheme and earn £100 for every friend that you recommend who completes 100 hours with us – refer 10 friends and earn £1000!

· All our contractors are treated individually, by your name, not a number. You will have the opportunity to build a great rapport with your branch manager, who will maintain regular contact and offer support and encouragement as you progress in your health and social care career.

title: Residential Conveyancer (Solicitor/Fee Earner)
description:
Experience: 2 - 6 years of experience

Perhaps one of the North West's leading and most reputable full-service commercial law firms has an exciting opportunity within its award-winning Residential Conveyancing department for an ambitious and confident Residential Conveyancer.

The role will initially be working from home. However, long term it will be an office-based role, working in the firm's modern commercial offices in Wigan - but with the option to work from home on a part-time basis.

The department is recognised across the North West for its outstanding level of service to clients, and for dealing with high quality Conveyancing transactions. You'll be joining a dedicated and well-established department, which consists of both qualified and non-qualified fee earners.

Your new role will see you taking on responsibility for your own portfolio of Residential Conveyancing transactions, including, but not limited to, sales and purchase, both leasehold and freehold, shared ownership, transfers of equity, right to buy and new build work etc. You will have full support from assistants and secretaries within the team to ensure that each case is dealt with as smoothly and efficiently as possible.

You'll be an experienced Residential Conveyancing Fee Earner (Solicitor, Paralegal, Licensed Conveyancer or CILEX) with circa 3 years' previous experience handling your own transactions from instruction through to completion.

If you are an ambitious and confident Residential Conveyancer in Greater Manchester, looking to take the next step in your career, please apply today.

title: Home Care Worker
description:

title: Crisis Care Worker
description:
Supporting Together are now looking to recruit Full or Part-Time Support Workers to join our team in Fylde, Wyre and North Lancashire.

At Supporting Together our care workers are as important to us as the people we care for. You are individuals with different needs and aspirations too and we respect that. In fact, we actively encourage it as a diverse workforce allows us to provide care to high standards.

We are different to other workplaces, valuing our community workers, recognising the hard work that they do every day to ensure service users get the best outcomes. We listen, respect and constantly engage with our teams so that we can learn from each other allowing for continuous improvement.

We offer real progression opportunities meaning you can make Care a Career not just a ‘job’. Experience is preferred but NOT essential for this role as FREE training will be provided and you will be fully supported within your role.

The position is to support individuals living in their own homes across North Lancashire who need temporary care for several different reasons. You will play a key role within the health and social care system and your knowledge and skills will be utilised to ensure service users receive the right care once leaving our service. Visit duration ranges from 30 minutes to 12 hours.

The position will include supporting individuals with a wide range of needs such as personal care, medication support and meal preparation whilst promoting independence and a 'can do' attitude.

Supporting Together offer a 24-hour service, so we have numerous positions available such as full or part time hours, mornings, evenings and over nights.

Please note it is essential that you have a full driving licence and access to a vehicle for work. You will also require a smart phone.

This position requires alternative weekend working.

What we offer

· £9.15 per hour plus 20p per mile

· Employee recognition bonuses

· Variety of shift patterns to suit your needs

· Career development and progression to higher roles within the company

· FREE DBS Check

· 5.6 weeks holidays per year

· Free Induction training

· Regular refresher training

· Regular supervision

What we are looking for in our support workers:

· Caring Attitude

· Good communication skills

· Be responsible and able to work unsupervised

· Respectful towards others

· Reliable and punctual

· Empathetic and Understanding

· Passion for helping others

· Professional attitude and detail to work

· Flexibility

· Able to work alternate weekends

All roles are subject to proof of eligibility to work in the UK, enhanced DBS checks, satisfactory references.

Salary: From £9.15 per hour

We provide full quality PPE, weekly COVID testing, a support helpline, regular communication regarding changes in guidance and a support from an experienced and friendly community team. Weekly testing and access to vaccine

title: Community Crisis + Reablement Health Care Worker- Trafford
description:
We are pleased to announce an exciting opportunity to work as a Rapid Response and Reablement Care Worker!

Reablement Role:

You will be working as part of a close team, including working closely with the local authority and social workers. You will work in partnership with individuals to support them to regain or gain skills that will enable them to remain in their own homes as independently as possible.

Rapid Response Role:

Again working closely with the authority alongside our health colleagues, you will be supporting individuals that may need a little extra support at home when returning from hospital. During a short time your feedback will form part of a social work assessment, informing decisions about longer term care. This role is a real opportunity to use your skills and knowledge and support the health and social care system.

The role will include supporting adults over the age of 18 living in their own homes with activities of daily living, to be happy and healthy and to access social and leisure opportunities.

Your skills, experience and knowledge as a care worker will be really utilised in this role as your feedback will help determine what support individuals may need longer term.

title: Primary Teaching Assistant, Year 2 Behavioural Support
description:
Axcis Education is urgently looking to recruit a primary teaching assistant to provide 1:1 support to a child in year 2 that has Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and Social, Emotional, Mental Health needs (SEMH) on a full-time or part-time basis in Warrington. The school is located in central Warrington and has a supportive SEND team and SENCO who provide outstanding support to students that have a range of learning and behavioural needs. The position is due to start on the 19th April so please enquire as soon as possible to register your interest and to avoid disappointment. The school is ideally looking for someone who is adaptable, kind and naturally calming. The successful candidate will have dedicated passion to nurture the child's needs inline with their EHCP. Desirable although not essential qualities include knowledge or training of Read, Write Inc; Makaton Signing; PECS; TEACCH; Social Stories; Smart Moves, Team Teach and Sensory Programmes. Transferrable skills and qualities from a care or support worker background would also be deemed valuable when cross referenced with this role. If you have the innate ability and desire to make a difference to young people's lives then we would love to hear from you. Please get in touch with a copy of your CV on why you would be perfect for this role. Please note each applicant must have an enhanced DBS on the update service. Why work for Axcis? In addition to offering competitive rates of pay as standard we are an agency who takes great care. We offer our candidates a range of training and development opportunities, from Team Teach, Autism Awareness, to Behaviour Management and Moving and Handling, among others. As we develop as a company at the forefront of SEND educational recruitment we recognise that our candidates need opportunities to develop their careers too. What's it like to work with me? "So far a great experience joining Axcis, Matthew from the Liverpool branch has been fantastic. Finding placements for me from the very first day I attended the interview, he is both attentive and helpful, having weekly contact with him is priceless. So professional to be treated with respect, you can tell Axcis care about all of their clients". Axcis is an equal opportunities employer. The company is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. All staff will be subject to our stringent vetting procedures, which include an enhanced DBS, full work history, references and a face-to-face interview. Axcis Education is an employment agency offering temporary supply work for daily, short-term and long-term assignments in addition to permanent positions. If you are interested in this position, then please contact Matthew at Axcis Education on 0151 448 2810. INDJOBS

If you are not interested in this role but know someone else who might be, don't forget that we offer up to £250 in shopping vouchers if you refer a friend to us and we place them in the job. For more details, contact your local Axcis office.

This is a temporary position.

Axcis is an equal opportunities employer and as such we do not discriminate based on age, gender, disability, race or any other equal opportunities criteria.

The company is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.

title: Level 3 Children's Social Worker (Locality Teams) - Wigan...
description:
Our locality teams are sat across the Wigan borough and we have opportunities across all of our teams

We are looking for creative and knowledgeable social workers who are able to support our most complex families supporting them through effective intervention, direct work and assessments in line with children who are being worked at threshold of child in need, Child protection and children who are being supported through Care proceedings. We are looking for passionate and dedicated social workers who have insight in working within these areas and who we would love to have as part of our teams.

About you:
You will have two years statutory social care experience either in Duty and Assessment or a locality team, be an excellent communicator who understands the value and importance of integrated working.

You’ll be a strong team player who is used to working in a person-centred way, allowing you to be efficient in time management, report writing, completing assessments and providing both written and verbal evidence in care proceedings.

You will have a holistic approach to work, with a keen focus on reducing inequalities and supporting individuals to develop their resilience and improve outcomes.

You will be HCPC registered and have a thorough knowledge and experience of legislation, statutory guidance and regulations relating to children in need of support or protection.

You will also need to have experience of safeguarding and court work.

Your role:
The Locality social work team at Wigan Council are currently looking to recruit social workers within the service. There are vacancies across different bases; covering the breadth of the Local Authority, working within locality social work teams who manage a range of cases to ensure the best possible outcomes for both children and their families across the borough.

You will be working in a busy and friendly team and will work predominantly with children in need, child protection, care proceedings and private law applications, working on a longer-term basis with children, young people and their families, providing help and support to help families make effective change.

You will ensure the delivery of a high quality and effective social work service to facilitate, empower and promote independence, strengths and assets of both individuals and local communities.

You will work in partnership with children, young people and parents, some of whom can be difficult to engage.

About us:
Wigan Council has been voted ‘Council of the Year’ at the 2019 LGC Awards and has recently published The Deal 2030, our ambitious plan for our borough.

Wigan is an energetic and dynamic council widely celebrated for being innovative and forward thinking in a backdrop of established relationships with our partner agencies.

We are an enthusiastic team, who are fully committed to helping our residents by providing robust mechanisms to safeguard and protect the most vulnerable members of our community, implementing a person-centred approach to achieve the best possible outcomes.

What's on offer for the Social Worker?
Excellent competitive pay rate
Excellent management structure with experienced leaders
Desirable location with excellent transport links
A stable and well-supported working environment

You must have:
A professional qualification in social work and experience of working with Children, in particular previous experience of Assessment work
Social Work England registration or Social Care Wales registration for North Wales.
Post qualified experience.

Benefits of working with Semester.co.uk :
Free on-going training opportunities upon registering as part of our commitment to you.
Competitive Rates of pay
In house payroll, providing weekly payments and support
Enhanced DBS completed.
Support and expert advice from an approachable, dedicated and friendly team
An assigned dedicated & experienced consultant
Various employment opportunities in your preferred geographical area
Flexible hours to meet your needs, full or part time
Recommend a friend bonus scheme
“Find your own job” bonus – get £250 for bringing your own position to us *

If you would like to find out more information about this role, or the other opportunities Semester.co.uk have available feel free to click the 'Apply' button below or contact the team on 0161 4199285**

title: Welsh Speaking Cover Supervisor
description:
rTriibe are currently recruiting Welsh speaking Cover Supervisors to work on a full, part time or ad hoc basis in local secondary schools.

This is a great way to start a career within education whether that’s going down the road of becoming a Teacher or a career in support within schools.

We have daily requests for our Cover Supervisors from local Secondary schools to cover all subjects.

We can offer work to fit around your lifestyle whether you are available for one or two days per week or all week, we will work hard to find you suitable work to fit your availability and preferences.

The role will include the following:

  • All subjects lessons will be covered but work will be set, therefore you will need to follow the lesson plan set.
  • Explain the lesson plan to the students and ensure they understand and complete this work.
  • Ensure Students are working effectively and controlling behaviour following school behaviour policies.
  • Collect work at the end of the lesson and report back to the cover manage.

Requirements for this role:

  • Welsh fluency.
  • At least 4 weeks of experience either in a voluntary or paid position working with children between 4 to 18 years old (working in a school, coaching, workshops, Scouts Leader, Camp America etc).

title: Registered Nurse (RMN / RNLD)
description:
Job Title: Staff Nurse.

Rate: £17 per hour.

Night Shifts: Part-Time & Full Time shifts available.

Here at Willing Care we are seeking a Registered Mental Health Nurse (RMN) for one of our very established clients.

Our client is seeking a talented Registered Mental Health Nurse (RMN) for their service situated in Liverpool.

The successful RMN / RNLD will look after the physical, psychological and social needs of patients providing them with the quality care that they deserve. The nurse must be a hands-on nurse, someone who is capable of leading from the front and making independent decisions when required.

About The Service:

Located in Liverpool, this house is a purpose-built specialist residential service for adults with learning disabilities, Brain Injuries, who may also present with co-existing conditions. These include sensory impairment and epilepsy.

The service consists of 4 units, 8 residents in each unit, 1 x nurse for every 2 units.

Company Benefits:

  • 2K Welcome Bonus.
  • No uniforms work in your own clothes.
  • Overtime and additional training is available.

The role of a Registered Nurse (RMN / RNLD) within the home involves:

  • Ensuring the care, welfare and safety of all patients is maintained at the highest possible standard.
  • Completing physical/psychological assessments of new patient on admission.
  • Creating individualised care plans for patients.
  • Updating care plans daily.
  • Safely administering and recording of medication.
  • Liaising effectively with external suppliers and health care providers.
  • Monitoring and developing performance of care staff.
  • Ensuring effective rotas are in place.
  • Use a person-centred approach to ensure every individual’s needs are understood and met with the greatest privacy, dignity, and respect.

To be considered for this role:

  • Have a Registered Mental Health or a Learning Disabilities Qualification (RMN /RNLD)
  • Have an active NMC PIN
  • Have a clear DBS.

We are seeking Registered Mental Health Nurses (RMN) and Registered Learning Disabilities Nurses (RNLD), who are passionate about the standards of care they provide, if this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you. Please apply today.

title: Community Disability Assessor - Work from Home
description:
Community Disability Assessor

Wrexham

£34,000 - £38,000

Donard Recruitment are currently recruiting for Community Disability Assessors based in the Newport Area.

You will be given the opportunity to work with the Department of Works and Pensions making sure that people get the support they require when applying for PIP (Personal Independence Payments)

The successful candidates will have the following:

  • Qualified Nurse, Paramedic, Physiotherapist or Occupational Therapist
  • Valid NMC or HCPC registration
  • 2 years post registration experience
  • A full UK or European driving licence and access to a vehicle
  • Excellent IT and communication skills

Salary & Benefits:

  • Part-time and Full-time available
  • Salary: £34k (potential to earn £38k)
  • 33 days’ holidays (inc. Bank Holidays)
  • Company phone & laptop
  • Company pension scheme, life assurance & NMC/HCPC registration
  • Full training is provided (7 weeks)
  • Additional Benefits including Mileage, Expenses and more

Duties of a Disability Assessor:

  • Complete an assessment of an individual who is submitting a claim, taking into account all of the information provided including any third party evidence.
  • Complete a report (Word based) established on your findings and the information provided.
  • This report will contain a detailed information of the condition(s) including information gathered on the impact of their health condition on their daily living and mobility activities along.
  • The report then will be submitted to a government body for an outcome.

Ordinarily these assessments are conducted face to face, either in a local clinic or in the community. Due to the current pandemic this role is now working from home, with the aim for face to face assessments to return in 2021.

The first four weeks are training, which will be done remotely from your own home.

Following training, you will commence carrying out assessments over the phone, again remotely from your own home.

If you are a qualified healthcare professional and this is something that is of interest, please feel free to contact Michael on 02890 996195 to discuss in more detail.
