title: Domiciliary Care Assistant
description:
We are currently recruiting for Domiciliary Care Workers to provide care and support to service users within their own homes in the Liverpool area.

POSITION: DOMICILIARY CARE WORKER

MUST- Be able to provide personal care to both Male and Female clients.

  • Own transport is Desirable but not Essential.
  • Experience preferred but not essential as full training can be provided
  • All successful candidates will be subject to an enhanced DBS check.
  • Salary: £8.00-£10.00p/h depending on experience

Purpose of Position

  • To enable and / or assist individuals to remain in the community, to be supported and maintained safely in their own homes and thereby enhance their quality of life.
  • To enable the service user’s individuality and independence
  • Assisting other care workers and professionals to provide care for the service user

Some of the main Responsibilities

Visiting nominated Service Users, at times directed by the Care Coordinator and management

  • Being particularly vigilant for signs of distress or anxiety in Service Users; any deterioration in their physical and /or mental health, or safety of the environment, and to report these as a matter of urgency to the Registered Manager or Coordinator in her absence
  • To carry out all tasks in a way that demonstrates respect for the privacy, dignity and value of all users, irrespective of severity or disability or personal circumstances

Personal Care(only where specified on the care plan and subject to appropriate review)

  • Assist Service Users in/out of bed, chairs, etc., using agreed procedures. Assist Service Users in turning, to relieve pressure areas
  • Assist Service Users in (un)dressing, care of aids and personal equipment (hearing aids, glasses, dentures, prosthesis, etc)
  • Assist Service Users in all aspects of personal hygiene, i.e. washing, shaving, showering etc.
  • Assist Service Users in feeding

Social duties

  • Actively encourage Service Users, according to their capabilities, to participate in all aspects of daily living activities
  • Develop and maintain personal contact with the Service User through talking and listening
  • Provide support as part of a caring team, liaising with informal carers, other agencies

Sports Coach

Active Sports Group is a Fun, Healthy and Inclusive coaching organisation that offers a variety of sports based services across the UK for children aged 18months - 11 years.

Now in its 15th year and with continued growth and success, Active Sports Group are recruiting enthusiastic, reliable and qualified sport coaches to join the team and support the delivery of primary school and holiday based services across the North West.

We are proud of what we do and welcome coaches who wish to join a fun, healthy and inclusive team with a passion for sport and a desire to inspire children lead a fun and active lifestyle!

title: Autism Support Worker - Wigan (JK)
description:
Amore Complex Care is a care provider of support provisions to adults and young people with varying care and support needs in the Wigan area. We provide support services for people with diverse and often complex needs within the individuals own home and community. Our ethos is to create a person-centred environment and enhance the personal skills of the individuals within our care, empowering them to lead a rich and fulfilling life as independently as possible.

Do you want to support people to help them achieve their goals, dreams, and aspirations?

Then apply to Amore Complex Care today!

We have an exciting new opportunity for dedicated support workers to work within a home environment in the Morecombe area. You will be working exclusively with a person who has a diagnosis of Autism on a 3:1 basis in their own home.

Candidate requirements:

-Preferably a driver as the client has a vehicle for the staff to drive
-A good listener and adaptable
-Able to take guidance
-Has previously worked with clients with Autism
-Able to work as part of a team and under own initiative
-Flexible, reliable and trustworthy

-Able to support the individual with goals and aspirations

-Free Enhanced DBS referral if not transferable

COVID-19 considerations

title: Registered Nurse (Full Time/Part Time)
description:
Double shifts, night shifts, working all weekend? Sorry, we don’t offer any of these at SpaMedica…

What we do offer are friendly teams, first-class hospitals and time for you to give all your focus and attention to each one of your patients.

SpaMedica knows work/life balance is vital for our nurses and so we work 4-day shifts and only ‘1 in 4’ weekends. And, you’ll get a great salary plus two bonuses per year, for, hopefully, doing a job you love.

You may not have heard of SpaMedica, so it’s important to understand who we are. Please visit our website and/or read some of our fantastic reviews on NHS UK – where we now have over 900 5-star ratings.

Here’s a little about us to begin with:

  • We are privileged to be able to support the tens of thousands of NHS patients that come to SpaMedica each year.
  • We are dedicated to reducing NHS waiting times for cataract surgery, YAG capsulotomy and AMD treatments.
  • We are proud to deliver excellent care and support thousands of patients to achieve better vision – our outcomes are some of the best in the UK, with low complication rates.
  • We want our staff to enjoy coming to work and provide a friendly and supportive environment for you to work in.
  • In 2018 we became the largest provider of NHS cataract surgery – 24.000+ surgeries per annum.
  • We have 15 hospitals and will be opening 7 new hospitals over the next 12 months.

Our nurses’ package includes:

  • Some of the best salary bandings in healthcare
  • Continuous training and development programme
  • Bonus 1 – June - Up to 5% individual performance related bonus
  • Bonus 2 – February - hospital/company related bonus
  • Annual pay reviews and increases
  • 4-day shifts – no evenings and 1 in 4 weekends
  • 25 days holiday (33 days including bank holidays)
  • Company pension scheme

To be considered for this role you will hold a current NMC/HCPC registration and have at least 12 months post-registration experience.

This role will be predominantly based in Wolverhampton with travel to other sites required on occasion.

Please call us for an informal chat if you’d like to find out more about working at SpaMedica. Or if you’re interested in this role, please apply now.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Practice Nurse
description:
One of our practices in Wigan is looking to expand their team by adding a part time Practice Nurse to work 3 days per week on a permanent basis. The salary is dependent on experience, in the band 6-7 region and the surgery is open to molding the role around the successful candidate, so salary and benefits are open to negotiations (which we will do on your behalf).

You'll be joining a friendly and robust team, consisting of Practice Nurses, GPs, Nursing Associates and an attentive and supportive management team. This is a positive and bustling site to work at; looking after just under 10,000 patients, the surgery is large enough to keep your day varied and ensure workloads are shared, and support is always on hand, however the surgery work hard at maintaining a close-knit environment for their staff too!

The surgery is purpose built and has an attached pharmacy, car park and newly decorated rooms and facilities. It's a training practice so is a supportive and positive environment, and career progression is taken very seriously by the GPs and management here.

Other benefits of this role include 5 weeks annual leave plus 3 extra day if no sick leave taken the previous year, NHS Pension contributions and paid group indemnity.

If you'd like to be considered for this attractive position you will be a Practice Nurse, already working in this role with a GP Surgery, holding formal training in the following areas:

  • Cytology
  • Baby and Travel Immunisations
  • Chronic Disease/QoF experience

Does this sound like your next career move? If so, then get in contact with Sarah at Chase Medical today! You can put your application in by clicking APPLY now, or by calling us on 0114 2757421 asking for Sarah on the permanent team.

Chase Medical

Here at Chase Medical we care about your nursing career! We help Practice Nurses, ANPs and other clinicians to secure the hours and salary they deserve in their permanent roles by sourcing the best vacancies out there and negotiating salaries and employee terms on your behalf. We work exclusively with GP Surgeries so all of the work we have will be relevant to you and your skill set. All of our services are free of charge to applicants so get in contact today and let us know what you're looking for in your next post!

Want to earn extra cash?

As well as offering up to £500 cash for each successful referral we receive, we also offer locum work nationwide, with Practice Nurse locum rates starting at £25.00 per hour (including holiday pay).

Get in contact today if yourself or anyone you know would be interested in our locum or permanent opportunities!

title: Science Teacher West Yorkshire
description:
Looking for a Science teaching role in West Yorkshire? Then CER have the perfect 'formula'! Matching teachers to their ideal schools is in our 'DNA'.

Join an educational 'force' to be reckoned with.

CER are looking for experienced and enthusiastic Science teachers for roles in schools in our client schools in Leeds, Bradford, Huddersfield and the surrounding areas.

Ideally you will be an experienced Science teacher, capable of delivering challenging yet engaging Key Stage 3 and 4 Science lessons, but Key Stage 5 would be a bonus as some of our West Yorkshire schools have Sixth Form cohorts. However, applications from hungry Science NQTs would also be welcomed and we could get you that all-important first step on your teaching career in your specialist subject.

We are looking for both specialists in Biology, Chemistry and Physics as well as solid all-rounders.

You will possess a UK-recognised teaching qualification, with an ability to demonstrate proven behaviour management skills when called upon. You will encounter learners with mixed ability levels and so a flexible, friendly and patient approach to teaching is key. Most of all, you will have a passion for your subject and a desire for the learners in your care to succeed.

CER are an established education recruitment agency, with over 20 years' experience in the primary, secondary and SEN sectors, with many schools working with us on an exclusive supply basis, meaning we can unlock doors that other agencies can't open for you. This is what 'divides' us from our competitors.

When you join us you can expect access to 'outstanding' CPD training to develop your skillset, competitive rates of pay and a dedicated specialist secondary consultant with close relationships to the major secondary schools in the Leeds, Bradford, Huddersfield and surrounding areas who will work tirelessly to match your experience and specialisms within Science to the right role for you. We offer both flexible working for those looking for part-time roles and full-time Science teacher roles for those looking for a more long-term opportunity.

If you are sick of 'experimenting' finding the right school for you, and you possess the relevant skills, experience and passion, we would love to hear from you by applying to this advert or calling 0191 244 2600 and asking for Chris Mahon (bonus points for the correct pronunciation!).

I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Registered Nurse - RGN / RMN / RNLD - An exciting opportunity has arisen for a newly qualified preceptorship nurse or experienced registered nurse ( Adult Nurse - RGN, Mental Health Nurse - RMN or Learning Disability Nurse - RNLD ) to work within a very positive, friendly and supportive specialist care home for young adults with complex needs including mental health and physical health, neurological disorders, brain injury and complex dementia in Liverpool.

  • Location: Liverpool
  • Service Type: Care Home for young adults with complex needs including neuro-disabilities, brain injury and stroke rehabilitation, mental health and complex dementia
  • Salary: £16.78 per hour ( £31,412 - £41,882.88 per annum ) - negotiable depending on your experience
  • Hours: Full Time and Part Time hours are available - you can choose depending on your preference (options of: 22, 33, 38.5 or 44 hours per week)
  • Shifts: Options of Days only or Nights only or Mixed shifts on a rotational basis - you can choose depending on your preference

Care Home Details: The Care Home is split into four 10-bedded units. They are rated highly on carehome.co.uk and have a number of fantastic reviews left by services users and relatives of services users.

The Care Home has a lively and positive atmosphere and they always have something going on for the service users to get involved with. The team ensures that the priority is always what is in the best interests of the service users.

Preceptorship nurses: In the case of newly qualified / preceptorship nurses, the care home offers a fantastic preceptorship programme. They have a good number of experienced staff to support and mentor newly qualified nurses.

Training / Induction and opportunities for development and progression: The Care Home offers a structured and thorough 2-week induction programme, which will include various training courses. You will also have access to clear and structured development programmes where you can see clear pathways to progression within the service. You will also have access to training opportunities to develop and enhance your nursing skills. You will receive ongoing support from your Manager.

  • Comprehensive induction programme
  • On-going training and development

  • Preceptorship programme for newly qualified nurses

title: Cover Supervisor/Teaching Assistant
description:
rTriibe are currently recruiting Cover Supervisors to work on a daily full or part time basis in local schools in the Wirral and surrounding areas.

This is a great way to start a career within education whether that’s going down the road of becoming a Teacher or a career in support within schools.

We have daily requests for our Cover Supervisors from local Secondary schools to cover all subjects.

We can offer work to fit around your lifestyle whether you are available for one or two days per week or all week, we will work hard to find you suitable work to fit your availability and preferences.

The role will include the following:

  • All subjects lessons will be covered but work will be set, therefore you will need to follow the lesson plan set.
  • Explain the lesson plan to the students and ensure they understand and complete this work.
  • Ensure Students are working effectively and controlling behaviour following school behaviour policies
  • Collect work at the end of the lesson and report back to the cover manage

Requirements for this role:

  • At least 4 weeks of experience either in a voluntary or paid position working with children between 4 to 18 years old (Working in a school, coaching, workshops, Scouts Leader, Camp America etc)
  • The ability to work on a flexible basis
  • A 'proactive' attitude that will get involved.
  • Good behaviour management
  • Confidence giving instructions to a class of children

We can offer:

  • Temporary
  • Long term
  • Day to Day bookings
  • Long term potentially leading to permanent roles
  • Competitive rates of pay (paid via PAYE)
  • ongoing support from an experienced dedicated consultant
  • access to our rTriibe rewards

We require motivated candidates that can deliver lessons to Secondary age pupils, can easily build relationships, be proactive and have good classroom management.

To be shortlisted for the position, you must have recent experience of working with children that can be referenced. Please be aware that all applicants are subject to the relevant checks and clearance procedures required to work in schools.

If you’d like any additional information about what we are able to offer, please do either call us on 01244 747 639 or apply as below.

rTriibe is a forward-thinking supply agency with three core values Simple, Clear and Inclusive. We use simple cutting-edge technology allowing schools to book staff direct with a few simple clicks. Everything we do is clear and transparent; we show schools exactly what we pay and charge. We believe in rewarding everyone in rTriibe by offering 'rTriibe rewards' to our candidates.

title: Speech and Language Therapist - Band 6
description:
We are recruiting for a part time experienced Band 6 Speech and Language Therapist to join a small, friendly Community Speech and Language Therapy team in Ormskirk, West Lancashire.

This is a part time 27 hours per week role, 9 Month FTC.

The team provide communication, dysphagia and voice assessment, therapy and support to adults with acquired difficulties and to their carers. The caseload is varied including dementia, respiratory, other long-term neurological conditions, voice disorders and stroke. Patients are provided with a service in a variety of settings appropriate to their needs i.e. care homes, patients home and outpatient clinics across the West Lancashire area.

You will be a suitably experienced therapist and will have be able to manage a wide range of complex dysphagia and communication disorders independently. Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to: undertaking assessment and management of patients, manage and prioritise referrals, advise, develop, assist and educate all appropriate staff on the management and care of patients and provide specialist speech and language therapy advice to Health Care Professionals within the Trust.

Skills/Experienced Required:

  • You will be HCPC registered a member of the RCSLT
  • Have experience working at a Band 6 level within adult services and have a full driving licence to complete your role in the community.
  • Previous experience of working within the community will be highly regarded, as will experience of working within a multi-disciplinary team.

description:
WE ARE RECRUITING FOR CARERS FOR ALL SHIFT PATTERNS BETWEEN THE HOURS OF 7AM - 11PM AND ALTERNATE WEEKENDS IN HORWICH AND BLACKROD

Are you a people person?

Would you like to work for a company that values you, as well as their customers?

Then Premier Care is the company for you.

Premier Care is one of the leading care providers in the North West.

At Premier Care, we help vulnerable adults to live as independently as possible in their own homes.

As a care worker you could be involved in supporting the individual to maintain their personal hygiene, ensuring that they have a nourishing meal, supporting them to take their medication and other daily living tasks.

We need caring, enthusiastic, reliable and hardworking people to join our team. Premier Care is one of the largest providers of Community Care in the North West. title: Nursery Practitioner Level 3
description:
Kids Planet Day Nurseries provides the highest standard of nursery care and education in each of our 59 settings within a unique environment in which children are actively encouraged to explore, learn and interact with others.

We have a great opportunity for a Level 3 Nursery Practitioners to join our team at Great Sankey. This nursery has a lively setting with lots of creativity and has a team who are dedicated to the care of children. We are looking for an individual to provide a hands-on, fun, creative and an innovative environment for children.

Responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following:

· Ensure that all children attending the setting are kept safe and receive rich and stimulating play experiences appropriate to their age and stage of development.

· Observe, support and extend children learning.

· Plan appropriately for children using the EYFS framework.

· Maintain accurate and effective children’s records.

· Work in partnership with parents/carers and other family members.

· Demonstrate good practice with regard to special needs and inclusion.

· Ensuring that all legislation in relation to special needs, safeguarding and Health and Safety is complied with.

The ideal applicant:

· Must be at least Level 3 qualified

· An excellent knowledge of the EYFS and experience of working with children and families

· Extensive knowledge of Safeguarding

· Experience of working in partnership with parents and outside agencies.

· Managing and maintaining administration requirements

This recruitment opportunity offers the successful candidate a competitive salary, pension and career development whilst working within a highly successful and professional team.

Kids Planet is committed to equal opportunities for all. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our staff and children. Applications are encouraged regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships. In addition, Kids Planet recognises that Men are extremely poorly represented in the Early Years Industry making up just 3% of the total nationally and same proportion within Kids Planet. For 2021 we are proud to announce that we are working in collaboration with the Fatherhood Institute to combat this and actively encourage applications from men for our childcare roles.

title: Night Senior Care Assistant
description:
Nights Senior Care Assistant

Do you ‘care’ enough to join our team?

Cromwell Court Care Home, Warrington

£10.40 p h

Harbour Healthcare are recruiting for a Nights Senior Care Assistant in Warrington. We set high standards for resident care, and being a carer with Harbour Healthcare will mean that you are joining a team who put residents care and comfort before everything else. Our carers are professional, respectful, responsible, well trained and have high expectations of themselves and each other. Above all they work as a team to ensure that all in their care receive a ‘first class’ service.

Job Role:

To support the Manager in the overall management of the home. Assume responsibilities of the Manager or Deputy in his/her absence. To create an environment which respects the rights and wishes of the residents and to encourage person-centred care and maximises independence. The successful person will be joining a close-knit, family run, care provider and friendly team who offer a quality service.

As a Senior Care Assistant, you will be responsible for:

To assist the client in any area of his/her daily care needs which they would normally undertake themselves if they were able to do so. Care for all clients’ needs as required with the aim of optimising their independence. To be responsible for care planning reviews and updates, maintaining appropriate medication and care delivery for a designated group of service users. To understand the right of the individual to confidentiality. Moving and handling, dressing and assisting residents in their hygiene needs. Observing and reporting any changes in residents condition Report to Manager any hazard or unsafe equipment that may be hazardous to the health and safety of staff, residents and visitors To attend any in-service training arranged as part of staff development and mandatory training, which is a legal requirement

As a Senior Care Assistant, it would be essential to have:

NVQ 2 in Health and Social care and desirable to have NVQ 3 in Health and Social Care or working towards this. Previous experience as a care assistant/ senior in a Residential Care or Nursing Home. A Passion for Care of the Elderly and dementia care. Experience of Medication Administration and some evidence of correct qualification

Are you that ‘special’ carer we are searching for?

We would love to meet you………………come and join the Harbour Team!

Benefits are:

· A duvet day on your birthday!

· Company pension scheme

· Uniform

· Staff recognition awards

· Opportunities for training and career progression

title: Property Lawyer
description:
A well-regarded London Council is seeking a Property Lawyer to join their large, friendly team on a locum basis.

This assignment will be conducted remotely and will begin on a 4-month contract with a view to extend on a rolling basis.

My client requires someone who can hit the ground running with a busy caseload of commercial and residential matters, including regeneration. While public sector experience is preferable, they are also willing to consider applicants from private practice.

The successful Property Lawyer will handle a variety of matters, including but not limited to:

  • Leases
  • Licenses
  • Open space land
  • Landlord and Tenant matters
  • Compulsory purchase orders (CPO)

This is an unmissable opportunity to take on engaging work and continue your professional development within a welcoming and dynamic team.

The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, focussed and can handle a caseload with minimal supervision.

On offer is a competitive hourly rate and flexible working patterns. You may work part-time, such as 4 days per week, if this suits your lifestyle.

We encourage interested applicants to apply immediately to be considered for short listing. Alternatively should you require further information or wish to discuss your suitability before applying please contact Chloë Cameron in our Manchester office for a confidential discussion.

Sellick Partnership is a market-leading professional services recruitment specialist operating across the UK. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and circumstances, including minorities and those with disabilities. Please note our advertisements use years' experience and salary levels purely as a guide. We are happy to consider applications from all candidates who are able to demonstrate the skills necessary to fulfil the role. If you do not hear from us within 48 hours please assume that your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion. For information on how your personal details may be used by Sellick Partnership, please review our data processing notice which can be found in the footer on our website.

title: Consultant - Private Client Lawyer
description:
Role – Private Client Consultant Lawyer – (Solicitor; Licensed Conveyancer or Legal Exec. )

Location: - UK – ANY LOCATION

Remuneration – £40K - £70K+ - open ended - 70:30 in your favour – but expected to be earning £50K+ by year 2 and increasing from there.

Our Client is a top 75 law firm with ten offices based across the UK offering a diverse range of services, a reputation for innovation and a smart modern approach to client service.

They are seeking like-minded professionals within the Private Client sector that have a strong client following and are keen to work in a well-positioned and dynamic firm; on a consultancy / profit share basis.

Their consultancy model is a better way of working, providing the tools for success without the rigidity of a traditional employment structure, and allows professionals to focus their energy on servicing clients. You can choose to work from home, one of their offices, or both!

Consultants receive their remuneration based directly on their monthly billing, with the two main profit share options being 70/30% or 60/40% in favour of candidates; Dependant on individual needs and support.

(NB - Both options include PII cover, accounts, reception, compliance, marketing, IT, telephones and advanced CMS as well as access to the existing cross-referral network. Successful candidates will also receive guidance through the transition onto the consultancy model and induction into the firm and have a dedicated consultant liaison team to act as continued operational support. SO YOU ARE NEVER ALONE… )

Your should be Solicitors, CILEx or CLC of 3+ years PQE + (or qualification and experience equivalent) with good communication, business development skills, client care, and work ethic as well as a client following are welcome.

If you are an experienced ‘QUALIFIED’ Lawyer and want to work for an established national firm while benefiting financially and enjoying a flexible lifestyle, then this would be an ideal career move. They are seeking people who want to advance their careers but who also want to benefit from the freedom of being self-employed to achieve that highly sought after work-life balance and higher earnings potential.

OFFER:

  • Earnings will be split 70:30 in your favour based on any revenue generated. (NB – to assist start-up in some cases they may offer to pass over some caseload or offer a short term earnings guarantee).
  • Support covering various business areas such as – IT; Marketing; Accounts; Administration; HR.
  • Buddy system – offers cover when absent through holidays or sickness to ensure seamless customer service to Clients.
  • Cross referral system - Their philosophy is to introduce clients to the best lawyer available for the job, regardless of their employed or consultant status. They offer access to large and established clients. Networking is important to them and they encourage cross-referrals between consultants and their colleagues.

PERSON:

  • These exciting opportunities require you to be ‘Qualified’ – (Solicitors; CLC or ILEx) and be able to handle a varied Private Client caseload from instruction through to completion.
  • You will need to have either an existing Client ‘following’ or be someone with industry connections that you can cultivate to – in effect- grow and develop your own business whilst having the benefit of a highly established Firm to support you.
  • The successful candidate must be enthusiastic and motivated and will be expected to be able to 'hit the ground running’ and
  • This role would suit applicants who are looking to have more control of their own business and earning potential – but who also wish to still be part of a highly successful organisation.

In applying provide a paragraph to ‘sell yourself’ into such

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: £30,000.00-£60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Work from home

Work remotely:

  • Yes

  • Remote interview process

title: Tutor to work with SEND
description:
Connex Education are currently recruiting for a number of tutors with experience working with SEMH and ASC, to work in the Wigan area, either on a full time or part-time basis, working both 1-1 and in small groups with a variety of different children. Tutoring pays a vital role in allowing children to “catch up” and bridge the gap created by recent school closures. This role is open to anyone with experience working with SEND and holds QTS. Completion of our mandatory Tutoring training is required before starting work.

This is an exciting role for any teacher to make a difference to a child’s life and see the impact 1-1 or small group tutoring can have on a child.

As a successful teacher you will possess.
– QTS or equivalent, and have recent experience in teaching and/or tutoring
– Good knowledge of both the Primary and Secondary English / Math Curriculum
– Be able to explain key concepts fluently and accurately
– Be prepared to tutor face to face and/or online depending on any local lockdowns/closures
– The ability to work to the school’s scheme of work and provide constructive and effective feedback
– Good time management to fully utilize the sessions

In return, Connex will offer you
– Full free training in Tutoring, SEN, Safeguarding and much more
– Competitive rates of pay
– Ongoing assignments
– A dedicated consultant to help to after all your needs
– A weekly PAYE scheme, including employer pension contributions, subject to minimum requirements

If you are interested in a Tutoring role or would like to discuss any other opportunities, please email a CV to warrington@connex-education.com

Connex Education is a high quality, service-led education supply agency which puts its people – not its profit – first. We concentrate on finding the right people, with the right skills and attitudes, for our schools. We hand-pick our staff, put them on our own payroll, and give them the same dedicated attention and support that we give our schools. Looking after people is central to our business: it’s what has earned us our excellent reputation.

title: Accompanied Viewer
description:
ForTheLandlords.com are looking for remarkable Accompanied Viewers [Self- Employed Basis] to join our busy team, is this you? Do you have what it takes to join our fast-growing letting agency?

Are you confident, approachable and enthusiastic? Do you have a general love about everything property related? Are you passionate about providing customers with exceptional service? Are you able to commit to working flexible hours, to include weekends?

If you answer YES to the questions above ,then we would love to hear from you!

We are looking for a self-motivated, personable, and enthusiastic people to deliver our high standard of service. You’ll need to be methodical and organised, demonstrate excellent attention to detail and strive to make our Landlords and Tenants happy. You will work closely with our Branch Managers and Lettings Co-Ordinators to ensure a smooth and effective service for all our viewers.

We are seeking Accompanied Viewers [Self-Employed Basis] in MULTIPLE regions of the UK:

Hull / Scunthorpe / Grimsby

Northampton

Nottingham

Derby

Preston/Blackpool

Warrington

Sheffield/Doncaster/Rotherham/ Barnsley

Stoke on Trent

JOB ROLE

You’ll spend most of your time on the road and speaking with prospective tenants who wish to view our managed properties.

Key responsibilities

  • Required to follow a pre-planned viewing schedule with set viewing times specified.
  • Responsible for property keys and ensure safety and security of properties.
  • Arrive to the property promptly to open up and meet/greet.
  • Guide viewers round the property if necessary
  • Report any issues/concerns (such as safety issues, problems with the property) back to the Office[s]
  • Adhere to the Company Standards of Service and Health and Safety
  • Carry out any other reasonable duties required by the business
  • You will practice high levels of discretion and confidentiality with regards to any information that you may be privy to.

Attributes

  • Excellent communication and organisation skills
  • Computer literacy desirable but not essential
  • Clean driving licence and access to your own vehicle
  • Exceptional customer service in a customer facing role
  • Ability to report accurately to management.
  • Confident in speaking to and instructing members of the public
  • Experience in property management role desirable but not essential
  • Keen eye for detail and a conscientious approach to your work
  • Maintain a smart, well presented appearance at all times
  • Flexible attitude towards working hours

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR?

You must be enthusiastic about property and have had already a career/role within the industry. You must also have a friendly and confident disposition. You’ll be comfortable communicating with people from all walks of life and possess the tenacity to get tough things done so the ability to be organized with an efficient, can-do attitude is a must. You’ll pride yourself on completing tasks on time. We want you to love your job, communicate brilliantly and tell the ‘ForTheLandlords.com story’ with gusto! Ideally Experience within a similar role is essential.

PACKAGE AVAILABLE:

We have an attractive package available, which consists of a set fee paid per every successful property let/moved in and full mileage costs covered.

COVID-19:

We operate a strict regime to protect all our team and customers from COVID-19.

SOUND LIKE YOU?

If this sounds like your dream job, we want to hear from you. We like to collect people around us who can bring new ideas and develop old ones, we are scaling quickly and the more of us there are the stronger we become.

Visit ForTheLandlords.com to see what we are about, then send us your best CV.

title: Information and Intelligence Manager (Datix)
description:
THIS POST IS FIXED TERM/SECONDMENT FOR 21 MONTHS DUE TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE SERVICE.

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN APPLYING FOR THE SECONDMENT POSITION, YOU MUST OBTAIN PERMISSION FROM YOUR CURRENT LINE MANAGER PRIOR TO APPLYING FOR THIS POST.

Information and Intelligence Manager Opportunity (Band Six) Secondment or Fixed Term

The Welsh Ambulance Services NHS Trust is committed to providing the highest quality of care and fully engaged to promote a culture of openness, transparency & candour, embedding a learning culture, driving closer integration internally and with our health & social care partners.

We listen, shape, plan and learn from patients about the things that matter to them, their families and the organisations we work with. A key element of providing high quality and enabling a learning culture is how we collect and manage our data. One of the systems that we use is DATIX, a new version due to go live in April 2021.

We are looking to recruit an Intelligence and Information Manager (Datix) on a secondment basis from March 2021 until January 2023. Reporting to the Head of Quality Assurance, the post holder will have line management responsibilities for a Datix analyst and Datix administrator.

The post presents a unique opportunity to work across all disciplines within the Trust and indeed with colleagues across the Health Boards who are involved in the design and implementation of the new Datix system , enabling the Trust to record, monitor, track, learn and make improvements from incidents, complaints, claims, adverse outcomes, risks and events.

If you are interested in applying for the secondment (full time or part time) please obtain permission from your organisation prior to applying for this post.

The ability to speak Welsh is desirable for this post; Welsh and/or English speakers are equally welcome to apply.

For an informal discussion please contact Caroline Miftari Head of Quality Assurancecaroline.miftari@wales.nhs.uk

Closing date 29/04/2021

description:
Acquired Brain Injury Support Worker

Amore Group are a leading agency provider of support workers for people with diverse and often complex needs in settings including community, supported living and residential. We feel that the only way to offer the best service is to register dedicated, enthusiastic, experienced and motivated staff with a commitment to providing excellent service user led support.

Our Clients are at the heart of everything we do at Amore Group. Your job as a Support Worker is to ensure our Clients lead valued and fulfilling lives, helping them to reach their potential and achieve to the best of their ability. We have part time positions available supporting an adult with an Acquired Brain Injury in the Mold area.

We are looking for people with the right values and attitude, as you will work alongside family members, friends and professionals who are actively involved in our client’s life. title: Charity fundraiser - Employed
description:
Calling all Charity Fundraisers! – DOOR TO DOOR

Charity Fundraising activity Door to Door contributes to an increase in public profile and awareness in the correct way, alongside raising much-needed funds for the UKs largest breast cancer charity – who are dedicated to funding research into this devastating disease!

Did you know?

1. Breast cancer is the most common cancer in the UK

2. Over 55,000 women and around 350 men are diagnosed with breast cancer every year

3. Around 1,000 women die from breast cancer every month

The good news is that they believe if we all act now, by 2050, everyone who develops breast cancer will live and live well! Do you have what it takes to help raise the funds to fight this disease?

Job Description
Company description

Assetti Performance located at Cheshire Oaks, Cheshire.

Job description

Assetti Performance Cheshire Oaks is a new and exciting hub for Supercar & prestige car owners in the northwest. We are currently hiring candidates to be part of our new team and we are ready to hire!

Assetti is looking to hire an Experienced Paint Protection Film Installer with a minimal of 2 years of proven experience for a Full-Time position at our new and exciting location.

We are looking for someone that can install flawless or very close to flawless installations. Must be able to minimize moisture bubbles, without any stretch lines, silvering, ensure alignment is correct and control contaminants from getting inside the film during installation. Candidate must have proven professional experience installing automotive paint protection film ,vinyl vehicle wraps and/or automotive window tint

You will also be required to perform paint correction, apply ceramic coating and auto detailing.

title: Leaving Care Support Worker (EM)
description:
Do you have experience with young people ages 15-18 with extremely challenging behaviours in Leaving care settings?

Are you able to put boundaries in place while taking a therapeutic and holistic approach?

Amore Social Care are a leading care provider currently recruiting for experienced Support Workers with a background in children’s services, drug, alcohol, domestic violence, homelessness to transfer skills gained in such services to work within specialised leaving care services throughout the St Helens area on behalf of our client.

Our client takes pride in working with professionals from local councils to social workers and local authorities. The young people you will be supporting will require support to help them in developing their life skills to enable them to live independently.

Your main role will be to support young people on 1:1/2:1 basis in Solo placements and you will be expected to undertake 1000-0000 sleep ins (2 days minimum).

Responsibilities

· Mental strength, to cope with challenging situations and clients

· Promoting independent living and life skills.

· Maintaining a high standard of support, focusing on their well being

· Making a positive contribution to the service.

· Being a role model for the young people ensuring boundaries are set.

· You must be able to work a variety of hours to suit the needs of the services.

Amore Group will offer successful candidates: -

· Free training package (Mandatory and MAPA/PRICE)

· Competitive rates of pay.

· Flexible working patterns of work

Applicants who have a driving license and a transferable DBS are preferable but not essential.

*All applicants will be subject to pre-employment checks*

Sleep in rate of pay is £30

Monday-Friday days £9.50 p/h Weekend days-£10 p/h

title: Band 5/6/7 Occupational Therapists needed in Cheshire!
description:
Maxxima is currently searching for a Band 6 Occupational Therapist to work in Rapid Community Response Service (RCRS), for a council in Cheshire. We are ideally looking for a band 6 OT but will consider an experienced band 5, or a band 7.

The RCRS provide urgent assessment and support (in two days) for a short time, to help people recover and retain independence. The team is particularly important in during the current coronavirus pandemic as they may help people:
  • remain at home when things start to get very challenging or difficult
  • recover after a fall, accident, acute illness or operation that would otherwise put the person at risk of going into hospital
  • help people avoid going into hospital or residential care unnecessarily
  • help people return home more quickly after a hospital stay

This role will be full-time with a working pattern of Mon-Fri 8.30-4.30, on a 3 month contract, with potential extension. Candidates who are looking for part-time, or other working patterns will also be considered. Being a driver and having access to a car is essential for this position.

Rates will depend on experience but can be expected to be between £21-26 p/h.

If you are interested in this position please apply above, or contact our Occupational Therapy team here at Maxxima on 02077498286.
